loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua B. sells fresh garden eggs (eggplant), tomatoes and peppers at Jukwa market. She has no formal educational background. She is divorced and lives with her six dependents. She is responsible for the general upkeep of the home.

Efua has been in the sale of vegetables for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more garden eggs and other vegetables for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her extended business to save to build a shop to keep her vegetables and to build a good table to sell on.

loans.use: To buy more garden eggs and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Idrissou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la boucherie, il va acheter les viandes de mouton et de bœuf dans une ferme à Adetikopé qui est un village à 20 Km de Lomé, pour y aller il se sert d’une moto, cette moto de travail est en panne et vieille, il voudrait le changer.il sollicite alors un crédit pour l’achat d’une moto afin de faciliter les déplacements dans l’exercice de son commerce.
texts.en:
This gentleman works as a butcher to generate income. To buy mutton and beef, he goes to a farm in Adetikopé, which is a village located twenty kilometers from Lomé. He uses a motorcycle to get there, but this work motorcycle is old and not running, and he would like get another. Thus he is seeking a loan for the purchase of a motorcycle in order to facilitate his business trips.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle

loans.name: Lesbia Del Socorro

texts.es: Lesbia Del Socorro de 47 años, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, las cuales vende ciertos lugares en los que tiene suficiente clientes. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, desde muy joven se inicio en la venta de mercancía, como calzado y ropa femenina y gradualmente fue agregándole muchos productos, como adornos, cosméticos. La señora está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de mercadería en general. Ya que tiene variedad de pedidos. El sueño de Lesbia es continuar con este negocio activo.
texts.en:
Lesbia is 47 years old. She sells general merchandise. She sells this in certain places where there are enough customers. She has been doing this business for seven years. She started selling merchandise when she was young. First she sold shoes and women’s clothes. Gradually she expanded to more products such as adornments and cosmetics. She is asking for a new loan in order to purchase general merchandise as she has a variety of requests from her customers. Her dreams for the future are to continue with her active business

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Flor Juanita Group

texts.es:
Flor Juanita está integrado Miriam del Socorro A. G., Flora García  y Ivania del Socorro B. A. tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas. La coordinadora es la señora A. quien se dedica al comercio de verduras desde hace cuatro años.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ivania del Socorro B. desde hace tres años realizas tortillas y Flora María Arroliga García quien vende meneítos, galletas y los fines de semana realiza sopas y enchiladas. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios para que crezca.
texts.en:
The “Flor Juanita” Group consists of Miriam del Socorro A. G., Flora García, and Ivania del Socorro B. A.. These three women are hardworking and determined. The group coordinator is Sra. A., who has been selling vegetables for four years.

The other group members are Ivania del Socorro B. who has been making tortillas for three years and Flora María Arroliga García who sells cheese flavored snack food and cookies. On the weekends, Sra. García makes soups and enchiladas. They will invest this loan in their businesses so that they can grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Shabana Saleem's Group

texts.en: Shabana saleem lives in Multan the third largest city of Pakistan. She is a very caring lady. She supports her husband financially by working part time at her boutique — part time because she has to carry out her responsibilities of a mother and a wife as well. She is a talented lady. She prepares embroidered dresses and displays them in her boutique to attract customers. Her clientele base is made up of neighbors and her relatives. She has applied for a loan from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan) because she wants to operate her business on a full-time basis. She will put a large variety of ready-made garments, clothes, and embroidered material at her boutique to attract the maximum number of clients. She is very hopeful about the success of her business.

loans.use: Purchase required material for boutique

loans.name: Obenikina 5 Group

texts.fr:
OBENIKINA 5  est un  regroupement  de femmes mariées du village de SAGINEKAN de la sous préfecture e KIMPARAMA région de SEGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et au moins 4 enfants. Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
SABINE S. souhaite utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants,  au grand marché de kimparana ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les  dépenses  courantes  de la famille.
texts.en:
OBENIKINA 5 is a group of married women from the village of Saginekan, in the sub-prefecture of Kimparama, Region of Segou, the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They live in traditional families. They are an average of 34 years old and have at least four children. They grow peanuts. In hopes of making their agricultural work more profitable, the members of the group decided to participate in the loan programs of Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After having properly repaid their previous loans, they are on their third business loan. Sabine S. hopes to use her loan to buy adequate quantities of peanut seeds, small equipment, and fertilizers at the main market in the city of Kimparana. After the winter season, the crops are stored for a period of time so that they will increase in value before being sold at the main market in Kimparana and in neighboring markets at retail (and often wholesale), for cash, generally to clients from large cities. The members of the group expect to earn, after the sale of their agricultural products, a profit of 35,000 FCFA which will be used to pay the interest on the loans and to meet daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime de 46 años de edad vive en union libre con la Sra. Martha M. con quien tiene 2 hijos: Harvin de 18 años estudiando el 5to año de secundaria y Elizabeth de 15 en 4to año. Jaime trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 18 meses, desempeñandose como  conductor. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto, ya que desea brindarle privacidad a su hijo, ya que esta en una edad en la que la necesita.  

El mayor sueño de don Jaime es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en unos profesionales que saquen adelante a nuestro pais, ademas desea poder brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones basicas que se merecen.
texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Jaime lives in a common-law marriage with Señora Martha M.. They have two children: Harvin, 18, who is in his 5th year of secondary school and Elizabeth, 15, in her 4th year of secondary school. Jaime has worked for 18 months as a driver for the city of Juigalpa. He is requesting his first loan to add a room to his house. He wants to give privacy to his son, for he is now at the age where he needs it. The biggest dream of Don Jaime is to see his children become professionals and get our country moving forward. Also, he wants to give his family the decent standard of living that they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a room to his house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his mother and one brother. After the death of his father, he took the responsibility of meeting the family expenses. As with the majority of the Lebanese men, his story illustrates the day-to-day challenges in working hard to support their families with their business income. He has been working as a car electrician for almost eight years. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional tools for his business. In the future, he hopes to continue expansion of his business. He expects the coming year to be successful and to further increase his business productivity.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Micro-finance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Micro-finance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: purchase additional tools

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeun P., born 1967, leads a group of five members in Ta Koam Village, Takeo Province, Cambodia. She was selected as leader by the other members of the group who will use their portion of the loan for various ways to support their families. 

Mrs. P. is a successful pig breeder who supports her family with profits from the business. Since her breeding pig is going well, she would like to expand her operation. In order to do so, Mrs. Phoeun P. is seeking a loan to buy more piglets and pig food. 

Mrs. P.'s husband is a farmer who cultivates rice on a plot of land he owns to support the family. She is a mother of six children. One is a seamstress in garment factory, one is a construction worker, three are attending in school, and the youngest one is four years old.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and food for breeding

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 25 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Herminio de 29 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Luzmila sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos son la papa, el maíz y la arveja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden malograr la producción. Para el futuro, comprar más tierras para sembrar más café. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para hacer más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 25 years old and is an easygoing and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Hermino who is 29 years old and their two dear children to whom they want to give the best quality of life. Luzmila leaves very early every morning to work in the fields. For her, rest days don't exist since she has to continually work her farm in order for it to be productive. Her main products are potatoes, corn and peas which she sells wholesale in the city of Tarma. The thing that she likes most about her job is the freedom that she has working with her crops. She has been doing this for 6 years and she considers the pests that can ruin production her greatest challenge. In the future, she would like to buy more land in order to plant more coffee. This is her first loan with MFP. She hopes to be punctual with her payments. She is very well-liked among the rest of her fellow member in her communal bank since she is so cheerful. With the 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting she will buy more fertilizer to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more gold and silver

loans.name: James Muigai

texts.en:
James is 28 years old and married to Rosemary Wangeci, who is a housewife. He is a taxi driver and has been in the business for a period of six years now, with a monthly income of 17,300 KES. 

He wants to use the loan to start a retail shop for his wife. He plans to plough the anticipated profit back into the business for it to be stable. He hopes to help his wife create a stable, income-generating business. He also hopes to buy a car for taxi and other transport services in the future.

loans.use: To start a retail business for his wife

loans.name: Elsi Dolores

texts.es:
Elsi de 53 años, tiene un pequeño taller de confección de ropa en su casa. vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

A Elsi desde pequeña siempre le gusto coser por eso decidió que para tener dinero y ayudar con los gastos familiares necesitaba tener su propio negocio de costura y confección. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ha venido trabajando en una parte de su casa con su maquina de coser. Confeccionando y cociendo ropa es que ha podido incrementar su clientela, trabaja desde las muy temprano hasta la hora que termine todos los pedidos.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques y fierros para tener su casa mas ubicada con el taller de confección. En el futuro quiere construir la segunda plata de su casa y poder comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Elsi is 53 years old. She has a small dressmaking business in her home. She lives in the “Primavera de Duran” Zone, a semirural suburb on the outskirts of Guayaquil. 
Since she was little, Elsi has always liked to sew. This is why she decided to start a sewing and dressmaking business in order to earn money and help with the family expenses. Since this time she has been working in a part of her house with her sewing machine. By constructing and sewing clothes she has been able to grow her customer base. She works from early in the morning until she fills all her customer’s orders. With this loan she will buy cement, blocks and iron in order to have a home with a better sewing workshop. In the future she would like to add a second floor to her home and buy a car.

loans.use: cement, blocks and iron

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en:
Etaf A. M. is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Etaf's husband passed away, leaving her responsible for taking care of the family. Etaf's children are old enough now to work with her. She wanted to start a family business and have her sons working there.

A year and a half ago, Etaf started a small poultry farm on the rooftop of her house. She raises chicken and prepares them for cooking to be sold to neighbors. Etaf's returns are good but she wants to enlarge the project and cover a larger area, so she came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase coops and feeding trays.

Etaf hopes that one day she can rent a bigger place and have a proper farm, providing better opportunities for her children. Etaf's son appears in the picture here on the farm as Etaf is very religious and uncomfortable having her picture online.

Important information about this loan:
 
FFATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the culturA. context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principA. loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit our FAQs.

loans.use: To improve the farm by purchasing coops and feeding trays

loans.name: Tamaneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamaneh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit and, consequently, improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is M’balu K..  M’balu is 49 years old. She was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a farmer and one of of her children is attending primary school. Another one is in secondary school and the rest are in college. For 25 years now, M’balu has been selling cotton, shoes, bed sheets, dishes, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy cotton, shoes, bed sheets, dishes, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim B. A. is a resident of Lahore, Pakistan. It is known for its history and culture. She lives there with her family in a two-room brick house in the area named Fareed town. She moved here 12 years ago. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. All of them attend school and get an education. 
 
Shamim is a hardworking lady who operates a spice-selling business. She sells salts, pepper and red chili powder to grocery stores and earns income for the family. Her husband’s name is B. A. and he is a bus driver. He drives a government local bus and earns income on a monthly basis. 

Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her spice-selling business. With the loan, she will buy spices in larger quantity, which will help her fulfill larger orders on time and increase her income. She has been doing this business for 12 years and hopes that an investment will be a good step towards the growth of her business. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitabler experience for her.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy spices to sell

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur S. is a 25 year-old-man who lives in the center of Saatli region. Seymur just got married. He is a very happy man. In 2007 he opened his own fruit and vegetable stand. His stand is located in a good location where there is a lot of pedestrian traffic. This is his first loan with Aqroinvest and KIVA. He used this loan of 1000 AZN to stock up on fruit and vegetables to sell in his stand. This is the only source of the income for his new family. Seymur is an upbeat and diligent person. In future he plans to open his own store.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo Y., 50, sells food and groceries, earning $10 US per day. Y. is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo province, Cambodia – an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a farmer, earning $2 US per day. The family has to spend $30 US on food, $5 US on electricity and $50 US on other expenses every month. Y. is requesting a loan of $400 US to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Bahrullo

texts.ru: Шарипов Бахрулло проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 33 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Жена занимается торговлей. Она продает детскую и женскую одежду. Сам Бахрулло высшего образования не имеет. Занимается торговлей риса. Он привозит товар из Худжанда и продает у себя дома, оптом. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: S. Bahrullo lives in the Vahdat region. He's thirty-three years old, married and has three children. His wife works as a women's and children's clothes salesperson. Bahrullo doesn't have a university level of education. For the past eight years he has sold rice. He purchases it by bulk in Hudjanda, transports it to his home city and sells it for a profit. He's asking for a loan to increase his goods turnover.

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat, 32, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in the Uvurhangai Province of Mongolia. They live in a ger (traditional felt house) on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past ten years. He is an electrician and his wife is a seamstress. 

Erdenebat operates two kinds of business. He started his clothes trading business in 2002, and later began his carpentry business in 2007. He now rents a space and operates his business in a Local Business Development Center. He purchases the wood from nearby vendors in the countryside. 

Erdenebat is a hardworking, modest and warmhearted person who says, "I want to save money in order to be able to provide the possibility for my sons to get a college education in the future and I also wish to open my own workshop." He wants to purchase more clothing from China for his business clothing trading business. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothing from Erlian, a border city of China with Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Melindy

texts.en:
47-year-old Melindy lives in the town of Surallah with her family. She is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Melindy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Melindy also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. She also helps in selling their harvest to the community.

Melindy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melindy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Melindy is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child who is not currently in school.  Sarah has a business selling soft drinks, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase another fridge to put more drinks in for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  

In the future, Sarah hopes to own a plot of land. Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her to be able to save some money for herself.

loans.use: to purchase another fridge to put more drinks in for resale

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a twenty-six-year-old married man with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a dream of buying a motorcycle for transport business. For thirteen years he has been growing tomatoes and riding a motorcycle. He has a hardship of prolonged drought and his desire is to own at least ten acres of tomato garden and export them. Robert needs the loan to plant tomatoes.

loans.use: to plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Don Walter se dedica al engorde de cerdos desde hace varios meses  en Pérez Zeledón  de San Jose.
Este negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante  a su familia, y él desea que su negocio crezca, es por eso  que él está solicitando un préstamo de  594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para la compra de materiales de construcción. Su meta es agrandar sus instalaciones para tener una mayor producción. 
El es  socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
For several months Mr. Walter has been raising pigs in Pérez Zeledón in San Jose.

This business has allowed him to provide an income for his family.  Since he wants to increase his activity he is requesting a loan in the amount of 594,000 CRC to buy construction materials.  His goal is to expand his facility in order to increase production.

He is a member of the "Productores El General" Association, one of the 110 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Cristo Resucitado Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama CRISTO RESUCITADO el cual esta ubicado en el estado de Puebla, Mexico. El grupo se conformo con 11 integrantes. En la forografia se muestra la actividad comercial a la que se dedica la señora Ofrocina M. Quien se dedica a la venta de ajo, ella tiene 40 años realizando esta actividad pero con 45 años de experiencia, por lo que ya tiene bastante clientela y para atraer a mas, sus precios son bajos, ella sale a vender a otros estados donde vende sus ajos. La señora esta satisfecha con la institucion y agradece la confianza otorgada pues con los prestamos que ha obtenido ha ido creciendo su negocio, ella comenta que este prestamo lo destinara a la compra de más ajo para ampliar su negocio. Ella tiene 63 años y no tiene estudios, su esposo es campesino y tambien sale a vender con ella.
texts.en:
The group called “Cristo Resucitado” (Resurrected Christ) is located in the State of Pueblo in Mexico and has eleven members. The photograph shows the business of one of its members, Sra. Ofrocina M., who sells garlic. She has been in this business for 40 years, but has a total of 45 years worth of experience. Ofrocina already has enough customers, but she is able to attract more because she offers low prices. She travels to other states where the garlic is sold.

Sra. Ofrocina is satisfied with CrediComun and grateful for being entrusted with the loans that have helped to grow her business. She says that this loan will be used to buy more garlic to increase her business. Ofrocina is 63 years old and did not attend school. Her husband is a farmer and also travels with her to sell.

loans.use: To acquire more garlic to sell.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 46 years old and has seven children.  She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Matilde is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Matilde requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers for her rice mill. She has been farming rice for 4 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activity.

In the future, Matilde would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To pay for the rice grain and the laborers for her rice mill.

loans.name: Mahutin Davatin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN DAVATIN est formé de trois personnes qui vivent toutes dans la même localité au Benin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Alexandrine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Alexandrine est mariée à un pêcheur nommé Abraham. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont deux ne sont plus à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Alexandrine habite à dans une petite ville au Benin avec ses enfants et son mari depuis cinq ans. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de quatre ans que Alexandrine mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (biscuits, bombons, etc.) et de façon secondaire la vente de « Agbéli » (aliment local fait à base de maïs) à Sèmè. Alexandrine s’approvisionne à Cotonou. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Alexandrine désire obtenir un autre crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en:
The MAHUTIN DAVATIN group is made up of three persons who all live in the same locality in Benin. The representative of the group, Alexandrine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. This is the first time that this group has requested a loan from ALIDé with the intention of boosting their businesses. 

Alexandrine is married to a fisherman named Abraham. The couple have five children; they are no longer responsible for two of them. Some of the children are enrolled in school. 

Alexandrine has lived in a small town in Benin with her children and her husband for five years. The couple share in supporting their family. For about four years,  Alexandrine has been selling various items (cookies, candies, etc.) and secondarily « Agbéli » (a local dish made of maize) in Sèmè. She buys her supplies in Cotonou. Wishing to expand her inventory and better meet the demand of her clientele, Alexandrine wishes to obtain another loan together with the members of her group.

loans.use: to buy various items (candies, cookies, etc.)

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 48 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs, goats, chickens and ducks in the Philippines.  Erna has been raising livestock for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling feeds.   

Erna is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feeds and vitamins.   She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: purchase livestock, feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen, 62 years old, is a farmer. She is married and has three children, 27, 26, and 20 years old. Her children are working in the factory. 

She does not make any income, but she gets support from all of her children who work in the factory. Each of them gets $10 per day. Each month, she has to spend $100 on food, $5 on electricity, $12 on their transportation to work and $15 for other expenses.  

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy her son a new motorbike for his transportation to work.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her son to commute to work.

loans.name: Fakhridin

texts.ru: Фахридин проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 54 года. Он женат. Имеет 5 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Старший сын находится в России. Сам Фахридин более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Он сеет пшеницу, злаковые культуры и выращивает овощи для продажи. Целью получения кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений и химикатов.
texts.en: Fakhridin lives in Bohtar. He is 54 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a housewife. His eldest son is in Russia. Fakhridin has been farming for more than ten years. He grows wheat, grain, and vegetables for sale. He is taking out this loan to buy mineral fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Editha has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 2 years and also earns an income from tailoring and raising livestock.

She wants to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Asociacion Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento ASOCIACION EMPRENDEDORAS es un banco que ya trabajo nuestra institución esta en su tercer ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 8 Integrantes 7 Mujeres y 1 Varón y las señoras se dedican al comercio de diferentes  negocios, ropas y otros, la Sr. YOVANA es la secretaria en el Banco y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, su esposo se dedica al diseño grafico, ella se dedica a la venta de muebles y artefactos eléctricos, a facilitad, esto se refiere al crédito o contado y con el préstamo comprará más mercaderías para su negocio de esta forma mejorara sus ingresos económicos y aumento de su capital de trabajo, entrega variedad de mercaderías lo que le piden sus clientes, es una persona muy dinámica y trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The 'Asociación Emprendedoras' community bank is on its third loan cycle with our institution.  It has eight members: seven women and one man.  The ladies work in different sales businesses, selling clothes and other products.  

Yovana is the bank's secretary.  She has two school-age children and her husband is a graphic designer.  Yovana sells furniture and electrical appliances.  She sells on credit and for cash.  She will use this loan to buy more merchandise for her business so that she can improve her income and increase her working capital.  She will be able to deliver a variety of merchandise that her customers are requesting.  Yovana is a very dynamic and hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is from the village of Pkhvenisi, East Georgia. Vasil is a single father. He has two daughters who are 13 and 11 years old. Vasil’s daughters receive social assistance for orphan children. The younger daughter also receives social assistance for persons with disabilities, since she has some health problems. At the moment, Vasil’s daughters are at the local monastery, as he isn't able to care for them alone. 

The only source of income for the family is agriculture. In particular, Vasil has 1.25 hectare of land. He grows cabbage and tomatoes. Harvested vegetables are sold locally to the vegetable retailers. The total average monthly income of the family including the pensions of Vasil’s daughters is 1,200 Laris. 

Vasil requests a loan to pay the workers who help him with seasonal work. The rest of the loan funds will be used to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat the plants for parasites. After proper fertilization and treatment, Vasil will get a good harvest and sell it. He will be able to improve the living conditions at home, make it comfortable for his children and bring his daughters back home.

loans.use: to pay the workers and to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat the plants for parasites

loans.name: Indalicia

texts.es: Indalicia, de 39 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alberto de 41 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes les brinda una educación adecuada. Indalicia se dedica a la venta de ropas y su puesto esta situado en el lugar más conocido dentro de la ciudad de Quimbiri. En este lugar atiende a todos sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía, quienes la visitan continuamente, debido a los novedosos modelos de ropa que trae personalmente desde la ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los atuendos que mejor les queden, ya que de esta manera se distrae un poco. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. Con el apoyo del crédito  comprará más ropas de Lima, de preferencia ropa de verano, ya que este tipo de ropa es la que más se vende en esta parte de la selva. Con el tiempo, desea situar su tienda en las galerías de la ciudad de San Francisco, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este será su 17avo crédito y se siente muy contenta de saber que seguirá beneficiándose con el apoyo de los financistas, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa de Lima, de preferencia ropa de verano, ya que este tipo de ropa es la que más se vende en la selva.
texts.en:
Indalicia, 39, is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Alberto, 41, and their three dear children for whom they want to provide a good education.  Indalicia sells clothing and has a stall located in the best known area of the city of Quimbiri.  She attends to all her customers in a very kind and courteous manner.  They visit her frequently because of all the fashionable garments she brings personally from the city of Lima.  

What she enjoys most about her work is advising customers on what  flatter them most.  She has been in this trade for 15 years and feels the hardest part of it is having to stand up all day.  She will use the loan to buy clothing in Lima, especially summer apparel since this is what is most popular in this part of the jungle.  In the future she would like to open a shop in one of the shopping centers in the city of San Francisco, so she can give her customers better service.  This is her 17th loan and she is happy knowing that she has continued support from the lenders.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She plans to use the 3,000 PEN loan to buy clothing in Lima.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Ngirankugire / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean est commerçant et il est membre du groupe Ngirankugire. Il est né au Rwanda et a 52 ans. Il est marié et il a 3 enfants de 3 à 13 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de secondaire. 
C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des marchandises pour les revendre dans les marchés locaux. 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d‘améliorer l’accueille envers les clients pour les attire. Dans les prochaines années, Jean voudrait être un grand commerçant connu dans sa région. Avec les profits, Il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is an entrepreneur and a member of  the Ngirankugire group.  He was born in Rwanda and is 52 years old. He is married and has three children from 3 to 13 years of age, two of whom attend school.  He has three years of secondary school education.  
This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy merchandise to sell at local markets.  
His strategy for growing his business is to make his business more welcoming in order to attract customers.  In the next few years, Jean would like to become an important, well-known merchant in his region.  With his profits, he plans to pay for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell at local markets.

loans.name: Vanessa Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Vanessa, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 8, 5 y 2 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es controlador de un bus.

Nuestra amiga es una muy buena esposa que  para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan  sus clientes. Trabaja tres días de la semana pero sobre todo por las mañanas ya que a estas horas aprovecha que sus hijos están en la escuela y en la tardes no sale porque tiene que ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas escolares, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva dos años dedicada al comercio y le ha ido bien con sus ventas.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal  5 ciclos  y le gusta porque es muy fácil conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (Toward Development with Love and Faith) meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and its handicrafts. For example, its straw hats are known within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Vanessa. She is 24 years old, married, and has three children (ages 8, 5, and 2). The two older children are in school. Her husband is a bus driver.

Vanessa is a good wife who helps her husband with the household expenses by selling clothing of all types. She sells by going door-to-door and taking orders from her customers. Vanessa works three days a week, but only in the mornings so that she can take advantage of the time while her children are at school. She does not sell in the afternoons so that she can help her children with their schoolwork. Vanessa extends credit to her customers and collects payment at the end of the week. She travels to Guayaquil to purchase her merchandise as often as needed. Vanessa has been in business for two years and has done very well with her sales.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes. She has been with the Communal Bank for five loan cycles and likes being a member because the loans are very easy to obtain. Her dream is to move forward in her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Rim is 59 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom works.  She resides in Siem Reap province, an area full of ancient temples. She is a farmer earning $2 per day. her husband is a farmer and fisherman earning $3 per day. Every month, Rim spends $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

Rim is requesting a loan of $500 to buy wood and zinc to build a small shop for her child to do hair dressing and tailoring. She hopes this new career will help her children to earn some income to support themselves.

loans.use: to purchase wood and zinc to build a small hairdressing and tailoring shop.

loans.name: C9241 Abisunganye Group

texts.en: Emerita is the president of a group called “Abisunganye”, which has a total of three members, each with a different business. Emerita owns a small general store where she sells different kinds of goods like sweet potatoes, tomatoes, Irish potatoes and so on. Emerita is 33 years old and is married with seven children between the ages of 3 and 15 years old. Her business is open from 6 am until 8 pm every day, including weekends. This is her fifth successful year in her business. Emerita and her group will use this loan to purchase more products such as cassava flour, sweet potatoes, vegetables and so on. Emerita and her group have many plans for any profits that they make from this loan. They would like to provide food for their family, pay school fees for their children and renovate their house.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: El hijo de la socia tiene 11 años de edad; a la socia le ha ido muy bien en el ciclo anterior tanto así que ahora ella desea invertir el credito nuevamente en la compra de productos como arroz, azucar, leche en caja, harina en bolsas, aceite en bidones, panetones al por mayor en cajas, caramelos, golosinas, para las fiestas de brujas. La socia desea seguir invirtiendo el credito para poder apoyar en los estudios de su menor hijo.
texts.en: Luz Marina's son is 11 years old.  The last loan cycle went very well for her, so now she wants to invest the loan again in buying products like rice, sugar, boxed milk, packaged flour, canned oil, boxes of panettone in bulk, candy, and sweets for Halloween parties.  She wants to keep investing the loan to be able to support the studies of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel her kitchen and buy accessories (pots, cutlery, plates).

loans.name: 03.07.109.thiệu Long Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lâm works in agriculture by farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to grow vegetables and trees.

Lâm is 53 years old and she is married with 4 children. Lâm is the group leader of the 03.07.109.Thiệu Long solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Lâm's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Lâm faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lâm hopes to buy her own land. She hopes for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to grow vegetables and trees.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a married woman with five children. She is 34 years old and resides in Mantic, Tangub City, in the Philippines. Vicenta owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns about PHP 4,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase products to resell. Vicenta has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she wants to improve her business and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mrs. Men is 61 years old and the mother of six children. She lives in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia. To earn a living, she has spent most of her life cultivating rice and some kinds of vegetables together with her husband. Typically, she is able to earn an average of $1.00 per day. When her vegetable crops become mature, one of her daughters takes them to sell in a local market for a profitable price. 

Mrs. Men would like to borrow some funds from Kiva to build a nice kitchen and a toilet to improve her living conditions. As usual, she cooks her food in her yard outside the room and it’s not comfortable at all. In the future, she intends to buy a pumping machine for the process of growing her vegetable crops and to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to build a nice kitchen and a toilet to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Dios Ante Todo Group

texts.en:
Margo is the coordinator of her group, Dios Ante Todo 1, 2 and 3 (God first), located in a village where most of the citizens are Haitians. She lives in a modest home with one of her three children. With this effort, she can make extra income and help her long-term partner. In the meantime, she enjoys doing business.

Margo is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She runs a clothing sales business. She has had her business for nearly two years. She began her business by selling a dozen pairs of jean pants she bought with her first loan. 

Margo is planning to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing in different sizes for men and women. Christmas is a good season to do good sales. That is why she and her group are requesting this loan. She will reinvest the profits in her business by purchasing more products and expanding her business with more options and new clients. She dreams of becoming someone with a very important business.

Margo represents her group and many Haitians who emigrated to the Dominican Republic to improve their lives. In this group are a sample of 10 Haitian families fighting to overcome the Haiti crisis. Thanks to you for supporting this group.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Leticia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Leticia, se dedica a la venta de comida y atoles, vive con su esposo quien es agricultor, el negocio lo tiene instalado frente al seguro social de su localidad, en las mañanas vende atol y panes, en la mediodía vende comida, este negocio lo inicio con su madre y cuenta con experiencia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para preparar la comida y los atoles, como aceite, condimentos, arroz, frijoles, platos desechables, bolsas plásticas, azúcar y más productos.
Esta compra le ayudara a Leticia a mejorar su situación en el negocio, también para que su familia tenga mayores beneficios.
texts.en:
Leticia has a business selling food and atol (a traditional corn-based beverage).  She lives with her husband, who is a farmer.  She has her business set up in front of the Social Security office in her town.  In the mornings, she sells atol and bread, and at noon she starts selling food.  She started this business with her mother, and she has experience in this line of work.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make her food and atol drinks, such as cooking oil, condiments, rice, beans, disposable plates, plastic bags, sugar, and other products.  These purchases will help Leticia to improve her business so that she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, condiments, rice, beans, disposable plates, plastic bags, and sugar

loans.name: Costasie

texts.en: Costasie is a 52-year-old widow with five children. For the past 17 years, she has been running a business selling foodstuffs, which helped her provide for the basic needs of the family. With the loan, she will buy more tones of sorghum. With the profits, she will make savings and renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Ayak

texts.en:
Ayak lives in bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 35 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Ayak heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Kabujogera Tukwatanise Group

texts.en: Leonard is a thirty-seven-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house for residence. He has owned a school for two years and is facing hardships of inadequate capital to provide the necessary school facilities. Besides that, he has a vision of constructing permanent school structures and hiring employees to help expand his business. Leonard intends to use the loan to construct more classrooms. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to construct more classrooms.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El señor Cesar, es una persona de 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltero pero vive en concubinato, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a cargo las cuales son sus pequeñas hijas. La actividad económica principal del señor Cesar es el servicio de cerrajería, trabaja en el taller de su hermano que se halla situado en la población de Tíraque, asimismo se dedica a la producción agrícola, produce papa y trigo en sus propios terrenos las cuales se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Laguna del municipio de Araní y finalmente también cabe mencionar que su esposa realiza la venta de pipocas de maíz en Tíraque especialmente en época escolar por el cual también genera ingresos económicos adicionales. El señor Cesar y su esposa manifiestan ser personas trabajadoras y responsables que quieren superarse para lo cual se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de terreno agrícola en la población de Tíraque.
texts.en: Cesar is 25 years old.  He is single but living with his partner.  He managed to attend primary school and now has three young daughters, for whom he is financially responsible.  Cesar's main income comes from locksmithing.  He works in his brother's workshop, which is located in the town of Tírque.  At the same time, he makes a living in agriculture, growing potatoes and wheat on his own land.  The land is in the community of Laguna, which is in the town of Araní.  Finally, it must also be mentioned that Cesar's wife sells popcorn in Tíraque, especially during term-time,and this generates additional income.  Cesar and his wife have shown themselves to be hard-working and responsible people who want to overcome problems.  To do this, they need to apply for a loan in order to buy agricultural land in Tíraque.

loans.use: to buy agricultural land.

loans.name: El Milagro De Santa Ana Group

texts.en:
The women of this group call themselves "Milagro de Sta. Ana". Most of the women live in Santa Ana, a very small village on the outskirts of Antigua Guatemala. All of their businesses have been verified by business advisors, who believe that each woman stands to benefit from the support offered by Fundacion Namaste Guatemaya.  In addition to a loan, Namaste provides coaching from business advisors who develop a detailed understanding of the borrowers business (see below an example of how much detail they have on their clients).  

Each of the women in this group are hard-working entrepreneurial ladies that dream of growing and bettering their businesses. Most of them are involved in the production and selling of food. For example, one of them promotes her business on Facebook and provides updates on the new products she will sell in the near future. There is also a woman who sells corn meal (the only one in the area) and another who sells products by catalog. 

Carmen Lucrecia (2nd from left to right) is a 48 year-old single mom who went to school through 9th grade. She has two daughters, one that is already married who contributes Q400 ($53)  per month to the household income and a younger daughter that still lives with her. Her younger daughter also has a daughter and Carmen Lucrecia pays for her school. Carmen Lucrecia has been selling food at the park of Santa Ana for the last 12 years and has become famous for her garlic bread, a product she introduced long ago to differentiate herself from the competition. She calls her big delicious bread “Neco” and this is the main attraction for her customers. She will share this business with her daughters so they have a place to work and support their families as well. 

Her dream is to learn how to manage her income, separate her profit from her personal expenses and be able to save enough money to open a new place to sell food in the village of Jocotenango. Currently she has a profit of Q986 (US$130) and works 240 hours (US$0.54/hour) per month. Her plan for the next 9 months is to increase her profit to Q1,665 (US$220). She knows that with the support of Namaste she will learn how to calculate and better manage her profit so she can open an additional location to sell her food.

loans.use: to save money to open a new location

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.en:
Born into a poor family, Mrs. Akpéné D. is a dynamic woman struggling to pull herself out of poverty. At the age of 28, she stocks grain and sells it in times of shortage. In this way, she earns a little money to provide for her basic needs. But her resource capital is too meager to amass a large enough stock of grain to meet market demands. However, she has excellent control of her store, which she runs rigorously.

Mrs. D. is asking for a loan of $850 to stock up on grain in order to grow her business. The resulting additional income will go towards the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY:

Issue d’une famille pauvre, Mme D. Akpéné est l’une des dynamique dames qui luttent pour sortir de leur état de pauvreté. Agée de 28 ans, elle fait du stockage de céréales qu’elle revend en période de soudure. Ce qui lui fait gagner un peu d’argent pour subvenir à ses besoins élémentaires. Or, son fonds de commerce est très insuffisant pour constituer un stock assez important pour faire face aux demandes sur le marché. Elle a une maîtrise parfaite de son commerce qu’elle gère avec rigueur.

Mme D. Akpéné sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $ 850 qui servira à acheter et stocker des céréales en vue d’accroître ses activités et de facto, ses revenus au besoin de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy cereal stock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth Asemota is 50 years old and happily married with seven children. She specializes in the making of local food (Agidi) for the community. She is eager to receive the loan to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more dried maize for production

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Ms. Chim S., a 38-year-old widow with two children, lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been struggling to work very hard for her two children since her husband passed away many years ago. S. operates a grocery stand in her village that makes a profit of about $2/day. One of her children works in a restaurant in Phnom Penh, while the other one is enrolled in secondary school in the 7th grade. 
S. is asking for a $1000 loan to expand her grocery stand by purchasing more products.
She eventually hopes to have enough money to own a big grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products to run a business.

loans.name: Santos Gregoria

texts.es:
I have run a grocery store in my house for three years. It is my job and how I pay for family expenses. Now I need to buy more products to stock my store and provide better service to my customers who have already asked for certain products. At my age this is the only work that I can do because in my country it is very hard for people my age to find employment. I would appreciate your help to buy the products that I need.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo una pulperia hace 3 años en mi casa, este es mi trabajo y de aqui salen todos los gastos familiares. Ahora necesito comprar mas productos para poder surtirla y dar un mejor servicio ya que mis clientes me han pedido varios productos. A mi edad este es el unico trabajo que puedo hacer ya que en mi pais es bien dificl que contraten personas a mia edad. Le agradecere mucho su ayuda para poder compar mis productos

loans.use: To purchase beans, sugar, coffee, soap, etc.

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim is 40 years old, married, has two children. He lives in the town of Khachmaz. Just four years ago, Nazim started his agricultural produce business. He brings the agricultural produce from the village and sells these in the local market.. Now, he needs a loan of $725 to buy agricultural produce in order to increase his current income.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Dung Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Dung is married with Nguyễn Văn Phi, she has 2 children. She cultivates rice and vegetables that she would sell at the market. She also raises poultry. Her husband is a construction worker, his salary helps cover the expenses for the family. But his work requires him to be on site, away from home. So Dung has to take care of everything. She has to manage wisely the money from the sale of vegetables and her poultry in order to cover the increasing expenses of her family. She really hopes to obtain a loan to buy more ducks and chickens to raise thus this would increase her income in the long run.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Dung có chồng là anh Nguyễn Văn Phi làm nghề xây dựng và có 2 con. Chị trồng lúa và rau để ăn và bán. Ngoài ra, gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi gà, vịt. Thu nhập từ nghề thợ xây của anh cũng đỡ đần chị phần nào trong sinh hoạt của gia đình. Tuy nhiên do tính chất công việc, chồng chị thường xuyên vắng nhà do đó mọi công việc ở nhà đều do chị gánh vác. Từ công việc nuôi trồng của mình, chị cũng cố gắng để xoay xở cho các khoản chi phí ngày càng tăng của gia đình. Chị rất mong có thêm khoản tiền nhỏ để hỗ trợ cho công việc kiếm sống của gia đình và có thể dành dụm để hoàn vốn.

loans.use: To purchase feed for ducks and chickens and other items to support her business

loans.name: Mutaramkhon

texts.en: Mutaramkhon V. lives in Khujand; she is married and has 3 children.  She works in the joint-stock company “Navbakhor” making women's wear.  Mutaramkhon V. has been an active, serious, and strongly motivated client of MicroInvest since 2005. Her credit history makes eligible for larger loans. She has successfully paid back past loans thanks to a stable business and increased income.  To manufacture women's wear, she needs fabric, accessories, and various other essentials, because she develops her own patterns. She is asking for loan of $600 to purchase new fabric for winter suits. Her dream is to open her own business in which she can realize the ideas she has today.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for winter suits

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is 28 years old and single. She lives in Beirut, where she runs a clothing store. She aims to generate enough revenue to be able to open a new store. This is the second time Zahra is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. A $1000 loan would help her take a significant step towards accomplishing her business expansion plan.

loans.use: To help her open a new business

loans.name: Station B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aidah N.. She is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to add to her clothes business. Aidah is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children ranging from age 8 to 13, and her children go to school. Each week, Aidah makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to to start a bar business. Aidah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Aidah is joined in her small group by Jane N., Juliet N., Jane N., and Claire N.. Jane N. has a business in tailoring and wants to buy more clothes fabrics and another sewing machine. Juliet N. is currently operating a business in selling snacks and wants a loan to expand the business. Jane N. operates a business of selling matooke and eggs and wants to start a poultry business. Claire N. is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To expand clothes business

loans.name: Lutfiniso

texts.ru:
Lutfiniso M. is 29 years old and has 4 children. Her husband is in Russia to earn money. Lutfiniso spends all of her time taking care of goats. Currently, she has 12 goats. She knits socks from thread made from goat hair. Since livestock is now cheap on markets, Lutfiniso wants to buy 10 more goats with the loan money.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Мамадрахимова Лутфинисо,29 лет имеет 4 детей муж на заработках в России .Сама полное время проводит по уходу коз.На данное время у нее 12 козочек.Она вяжет носки из кзьей шерсти.Т.к. сейчас скот дешевый на базарах,то она хочет купить в кредит еще десяток коз.

loans.use: To purchase goats

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
My name is Sughran S.. I am a mother of five: four boys and one girl. Two of my kids are married. The others are working. I reside with my family in a brick mud house in Borewala, a small town in Pakistan. My husband is a jeweler. He runs a small shop in a nearby market. He has been in this trade for the last twenty years. Currently, we need a loan to improve our business.

My group fellows who require loans for their businesses are: Suriya B., who is borrowing for her grocery store; Rafia B., who will buy items for her sanitary store with her share of loan; and Zahida P., who is borrowing for her milk business.

loans.use: To expand the family's jewelry business and to fund the other businesses

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila has been a part of the El Roble community bank for the past 9 years. She is 53 years old, is married, and has one child.

Cirila sells coca leaves at different fairs in the region of Ayacucho. The coca leaf is an important herb for the farmers in the countrysiD. of Ayacucho. Cirila also sells candy and cigarettes at wholesale prices. She acquires the products in different cities of the Ayacuchan region of Huancayo and then distributes the products to different stores and markets.

Cirila needs a loan of 2,500 soles to buy more cigarettes and candy to sell.

She dreams that her child will become a professional. She also wants to add a second story to her home and rent out rooms.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes and candy to sell.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mr. Hai H., 51, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Mai, 51, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have eight children, four sons and four daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home. The other three children are in local school.

Hai has been in the business of wooden house building for two years. It’s a skill he learned from his neighbor. Before doing this business, he was a mason. His wife was a craft weaver, but now she is a housewife and takes care of the children.

Hai is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a construction crane for use in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a construction crane for use in the business of wooden home building

loans.name: Edita Graciela

texts.es:
Edita belongs to the Bellavista Communal Bank. She is 59 years old and married; she studied until the second grade, has one child, and is independent. She lives in the district of Esperanza in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad. Her primary occupation is preparing meals. Edita buys ingredients from the Hermelinda market and prepares chicken and meat soups. It's a traveling stall in the Bellavista market. With her first loan of S/.300.00, she invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, pots, etc.. With her loan of S /. 1200.00, which will be paid within 6 months, she will buy rice, potatoes, chicken, vegetables, etc.. She is thinking of a requesting another loan of S/.1500.00 to establish her own stall at the market. The personal challenge that this entrepreneur faces is moving her business forward. Edita would be willing to continue working with Manuela Ramos because the loans are sufficient, and they have helped her increase her income. Her daily profit is approximately S/60.00. She decided to request a loan to survive during the economic crisis. Her long-term goal is to have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Edita, pertenece al Banco Comunal Bellavista,. Está casada, tiene 59 años; estudió hasta 2do grado de primaria, tiene 01 hijo, es independiente. Vive en el distrito de La Esperanza Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Su actividad principal es la preparación de comidas. La señora Edita compra los ingredientes en el mercado La Hermelinda y prepara caldo de gallina y de carne, ella realiza su actividad de forma ambulante en el mercado Bellavista. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00, el cual invirtió en la compra de arroz, fideo, ollas, etc. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, el cual será pagado en un plazo de 06 meses; comprará arroz, papa, pollo, verduras, etc. Piensa solicitar S/.1500.00, para tener un puesto propio. El desafío personal que la empresaria hace frente es, salir adelante. La señora Edita, sí estaría dispuesta a seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos, porque los créditos son suficientes y han ayudado a incrementar sus ingresos. La ganancia diaria es aproximadamente de S/60.00. Decidió solicitar el préstamo para sobresalir de la crisis económica. Tiene como meta tener un restaurant propio.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun M., age 51, is the mother of two children and resides with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has a business selling a variety of fruits in front of a garment factory, earning around US$ 12 in revenue per day. Her husband has worked as a village chief since 2000. Noun M. also gets support from one of her children who is married and works in a garment factory earning US$ 40 every month.

Noun M. says there are many people doing the same business as she so she needs to diversify her products to better serve her customers. She would like to borrow from Kiva through Credit, Kiva's local partner, to purchase many kinds of fruit to sell.

In the future, she wants her son to finish at least high school. Noun M. is pictured at her stand in front of the garment factory.

loans.use: To diversify her inventory

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
K. Furkat is 33 years old. He is married with two children. Furkat uses his car to provide taxi services. He has run this business the last three years. Furkat is trying to provide high-quality services, but at prices attractive to his customers. That is why he replaced the fuel supply system with one using gas as a fuel. However, now he is planning to change the old gas cylinder with the new one made of kapron because this is safer for him and his clients. Thus, Furkat is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable as he is the only bread-winner in his family. He works from early morning until late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones.

Furkat's business generates considerable income for his family. Furkat requests a loan of $700 to purchase the kapron gas-cylinder for the fuel supply system for his taxi. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing the kapron gas-cylinder for the fuel supply system for the taxi

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
H. Farida is 43 years old. She is married and has 4 children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 8 years, she has been purchasing young sheep, which she fattens and sells in the local markets. Farida is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible and admirable.

Farida has always looked for a way to provide extra income for her family. Farida wakes up early every morning to feed her sheep, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. She started this occupation at the recommendation and teaching of her beloved mother. This business has allowed her to provide for her children's education. Farida wants them to continue their education, because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have set for themselves.

Farida is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900) to buy sheep so she can expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing more small sheep to fatten and sell to expand the business

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan Sidibé est âgée de 42 ans, elle vit avec son mari et ses six (6) enfants dans une famille nucléaire dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Obligée d’abandonner l’école pour le mariage, elle tenta plusieurs activités génératrices de revenu sans succès. Elle décide finalement de mener l’activité d’achat et de vente des matériels en bois fabriqués localement par les forgerons tels   les mortiers, les escabeaux, les pilons, les agitateurs etc et cela depuis 5 ans. Le mortier est un récipient en bois utilisé par les femmes (indispensable en milieu rural) pour décortiquer, broyer et moudre les graines de céréales, les condiments etc. Jouissant d’une grande popularité, elle est très sollicitée surtout à l’approche de l’hivernage où les femmes font beaucoup d’achat pour la constitution des trousseaux de mariage de leurs filles (car dans la mentalité bambara en générale et celle des maliens en particulier une femme qui n’a pas de mortier dans son trousseau de mariage est comme un cultivateur sans charrue). En plus de son activité principale, elle fait également le commerce du charbon de bois et de miel.
Afin de se faire un stock pour remédier à d’éventuelle rupture, elle a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est en relation depuis trois ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et un prêt individuel tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 15 mortiers, 7 sacs de charbon et 20 litres de miel.
Madame Assitan Sidibé s’approvisionne à Tissala un des villages environnants de la ville de Ségou auprès de forgerons spécialistes du bois (pour les mortiers), des paysans faisant de l’apiculture(pour le miel) et ceux ayant une autorisation de coupe et de vente de bois( pour le charbon de bois). Elle vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assitan Sidibé, 42, lives with her husband and her six children in a nuclear family in the Médine neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Obliged to abandon school to be married, she tried out several money-earning activities without success. She finally decided to engage in the buying and selling of wooden objects made locally by metal-workers, such as mortars, stools, grain huskers, stirrers, etc. She has been doing this for 5 years now. A mortar is a receptacle made of wood used by women (indispensable for rural folk) to husk, break, and grind cereals, condiments, etc.

Enjoying great popularity, she is much sought after, especially around the beginning of the off-season when women do a lot of buying as they set up trousseaus for their daughters (since in Bambara culture in general and that of Malians in particular a woman without a mortar is like a farmer without a plow) de leurs filles (car dans la mentalité bambara en générale et celle des maliens en particulier une femme qui n’a pas de mortier dans son trousseau de mariage est comme un cultivateur sans charrue). Besides her principal business, she also sells charcoal and honey.

So as to build up her inventory to avoid running out of something, she came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom she has been working for 3 years. After three group loans (solidarity loans) and one individual loan, all correctly reimbursed, she is on her second individual loan which she will use to buy 15 mortars, 7 sacks of charcoal, and 20 liters of honey.

Mrs. Assitan Sidibé does her buying in Tissala, one of the neighboring villages of the town of Ségou from blacksmiths specialized in working with wood (for the mortars), rural folk who keep bees for her honey, and those who have an authorisation to cut wood as far as the charcoal is concerned. She sells for cash or on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. She expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will be used to make repayments on the loan and for her own needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of mortars, charcoal, and honey

loans.name: Celfa

texts.es: La señora Celfa, de 23 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, y otro que viene en camino, vive con su conviviente, quien está de acuerdo con sus metas trazadas. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y adultos, complementa su negocio con la venta de zapatos y otros accesorios para vestir. Sus prendas las deja a sus clientes al crédito o al contado, trabajo que viene realizando desde hace 2 años atrás. Ella trabaja muy duro, con la intención de sacar adelante a sus hijos y desde luego crecer con su negocio para adquirir más adelante su propia tienda. Le es rentable porque su ropa la lleva a vender por los caseríos (zonas rurales de los distritos), y le va muy bien porque no tiene competencia. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero solicitado será usado en la comprar de ropa, posteriormente alquilará un local para poner su tienda.
texts.en:
Señora Celfa, 23, is the mother of 2 children with another on the way. She lives with her partner, who is supportive of her goals. She sells children's and adult clothing, and complements her business selling shoes and other apparel accessories. She leaves the garments with the clients on credit or cash, and has been doing this work for 2 years. She works really hard, intending to get her children ahead.
