For now she wants to grow her business so that later she can have her own shop. This is profitable for her because she takes her clothing around the villages (the rural areas of the districts) to sell, which does quite well for her because she has no competition. This is her first loan from MFP. She will use the money to buy clothing, and later she will rent a space for her own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more garments to increase her sales

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa A. is 36 years old, married and the mother of two children, Muniru and Mariama Ganiru, who are in school. She operates a clothing shop in Ashaiman, a suburb of Tema, where she lives with her family. For the past three years, Latifa has made a living selling jeans, blouses, skirts, women slippers, bags and headscarfs. But a lack of funds has forced her to operate on a very small scale. 

She has applied for a loan to expand her business. She believes the loan will help her buy a larger and higher-quality inventory of goods, particularly of jeans, women's clothing, headscarfs and slippers. Latifa is a member of the Gold Trust Group. Members agree to help each other repay loans.

loans.use: To buy jeans, ladies clothing and slippers

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
“I am the provider and breadwinner in the family,” says Federico P., a 57-year-old father from South Cotabato City. “I have to meet all my family's needs and I work hard to help my children achieve their dreams,” he said. “It's my prayer to really uplift our lives. I will do whatever I need to do to have my children graduate from college and let them pursue fruitful lives,” he added. 

Federico is requesting a loan from CEVI to purchase all kinds of feeds and rice for retail. Through this, he believes that he could really support his family, especially his children's educational needs. He runs his business by himself, and his wife is very supportive of him in this endeavor. He started his business in 1997 with only Php 25,000 capital (less than $500 USD). Now, he wants to make it grow by purchasing additional merchandise so he can earn a bigger profit.

CEVI has been supporting Federico for a couple of years already. Being part of the program has let Federico enjoy the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: Purchase feed and rice for sale

loans.name: Fadenkene Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (04) femmes du groupe Fadenkene (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 41ans  ont en moyenne 04 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier I, un des quartiers de la ville de Loulouni sous préfecture,  la 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles exercent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente d’haricots, d’atiéke, d’essence et  la restauration.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle ; elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt (prêt de groupe) et tous les précédents  se sont dénoués. 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 2sacs de 100kg d’atiéke - un bidon d’huile alimentaire de 10litres, 3 sacs de 100kg d’haricot , 2sacs de 100kg de riz – 2 paquets de condiments alimentaires(pour la restauration) et 2 bariles et ½ d’essence.
Elles s’approvisionnement à Kadiolo ville, Loulouni et dans les villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché surtout les jours de foires (aux forains), au bord du goudron et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 27.250FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Fadenkene ambitionnent d’être, un jour, chacune une commerçante grossiste et de s’octroyer un restaurant digne de ce nom ou aménager un point de vente adéquat.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Fadenkene (all married) have an average age of 41 and on average 4 children. They live in traditional extended families in District 1, a neighborhood of the town of Loulouni, third administrative region of Mali.

They have various businesses, among others buying and selling beans, atiéke (cassava grits), gasoline, and working in food service. So as to satisfy the needs of their clientele, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 9th group loan, and all the preceding ones have been repaid.

They intend to use this loan to buy 2 sacks of 100 kg of atiéke, 1 jerry can of 10 liters of cooking oil, 3 sacks of 100 kg of beans, 2 sacks of 100 kg of rice, 2 packets of condiments (for food service), and 2 barrels and a half of gasoline. They do their buying in the town of Kadiolo and Loulouni and surroundings. The merchandise is sold at the market, especially on weekly market days (to itinerant merchants), at the roadside, and in the neighborhoods, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make an average profit of 27,250 F CFA per month of which a part will be used for family expenses and the rest invested back into their businesses. The women of the Fadenkene group each hope one day to be a wholesaler or to open up a restaurant worthy of the name or a real shop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Dina Angelica

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Dina es casada tiene 39 años, tres hijos de 18, 13 y 7 años, el mayor está en la universidad y los menores estudian en la escuela estatal.
La mama de Dina empezó vendiendo plásticos y descartables por ocho años en el mercado  ella le ayudaba, cuando su mama se enferma deja de trabajar y le deja el negocio a su hija Dina, ella decide ampliar el negocio a una librería-bazar-regalos “ROGER”.  
Dina necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, para la compra de útiles escolares, cartulina cuadernos, hojas.
Desde que está en Finca, los préstamos le han ayudado, a tener mas mercadería;  en su persona esta mas sociable, porque era tímida ahora tiene más amigas, le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal por que se distrae.  
El sueño de Dina es terminar de construir su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales, quiere comprar una fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of Bancomunal Los Claveles. Dina is 39 years old and married. She has three children, 18, 13, and 7 years of age. The oldest is in college, and the younger ones go to public school. Dina's mother started selling plastic and disposable items at the market. For eight years Dina helped her, and when her mother got sick, she left her the business. Dina decided to expand the business into a bookstore and gift shop called "ROGER." Dina needs a loan for 2200 soles to buy school supplies, binders, and paper. Since she has been with Finca, the loans have helped her get more merchandise. She used to be shy but is more social now, and has more friends. She likes the Bancomunal meetings because they are fun. Dina hopes to finish construction on her house and see her children learn a profession. She would like to buy a photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dina needs a loan for 2200 soles to buy school supplies, binders, and paper.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina A. sells fabric and used clothing at Neizer in Elmina. Faustina has a junior high school education. She is single and has no children. Faustina has been selling used clothing since 1994. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. She has experienced an increase in demand from her customers, so her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to buy more fabric and thus increase sales.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward a house she wants to put up.

loans.use: To buy fabric and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Jocelyn D. M. is 41 years old, married and lives at Balintawak, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Sur, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in opening a sari-sari (variety) store. Her husband is a truckman and they have 5 children to feed, she works hard to have a good life.  

Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to start up the business. Now, she requests a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy additional inventories. She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete store.

loans.use: Expansion of her variety store

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has been a clothes seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to the Shukrani group loan (Group code 2025). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day, she works at her business from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bedsheets, khanga and other types of clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatma is 35 years old, married, and has three children: ages 16, 15 and 12.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets, khanga and other type of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mumin

texts.ru:
Мумин Утанов мужчина 1968 года рождения, женат на Рохат Утановой, имеет 4 детей.
  Занимается Мумин животноводством, откармливает скот дома. Стаж работы в сфере животноводства у Мумина 20 лет.
  Жена Мумина Рохат помогает ему в животноводстве, доит двух коров и перерабатывает молоко, которое продает своим соседям сестра Мумина.Прибыль полученную от продажи  молока делят поплам. Так же, Мумин работает в дехканско-фермерском хозяйстве «Бураген».
  Мумин запрашивает сумму 2400 на 8 месяцев, для закупа дополнительного бычка.
texts.en:
Mumin U. is a man who was born in 1968. He is married to Rohat Utanova, and has four children. Mumin raises livestock, fattening cattle at his home, and has twenty years of work experience in raising cattle. Mumin's wife Rohat helps him with the livestock by milking the two cows and processing the milk, which she sells to her neighbors, Mumin's sister. In addition, Mumin works on the Buragen farm. Mumin is requesting a loan in the amount of 2400 somoni in order to purchase an additional steer.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a steer

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is a native of Cardona, Rizal, in the Philippines. She is forty-eight years old and has three children. Her oldest son, Chad Nezzar, is eighteen years old and a high school graduate. The youngest, Christian, is in elementary school. She also has a 9-year-old boy. Her husband, Victor, is forty-five years old and a partner in their business.

In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI partner of KIVA in the Philippines. With her first loan, she ventured into the retail selling of charcoal. She had observed the demand for charcoal in the market and knew that selling charcoal would bring them enough profit for their day-to-day living. Now on her second loan, she is requesting 10,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. The loan will be used to pay for 101 sacks of charcoal and a brand new weighing scale. Josephine is hopeful that, with the financial access that she has from ASHI, she can improve her business and make it grow.

Josephine came from a poor family. During her childhood, she dreamed of finishing her studies, but due to financial shortages she was not able to make it. Now, her dream for her own children is to send them to school until they finish college and find jobs, so that they will not suffer the life that she had. She hopes that her business will grow and be sustainable, and is looking forward to having a space at the market someday.

loans.use: To buy 101 sacks of charcoal and a new weighing scale.

loans.name: 14-Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Khoa Lê Thị is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Khoa is the group leader for a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 14-Đông Sơn (10.13.14).




Khoa is married and has 2 adult children.  She operates a specialized retail store, and her income comes primarily from selling products in the local community.  Khoa has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2100000 VND a month from it.




In 2009, Khoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  This will be Khoa's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is requesting 1626900 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  Khoa plans to use the additional revenue generated by selling these products to improve/expand her business.





About the Other Borrowers in the Group:




1.  N. Thị Lâm is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.





2.  N. Thị Tuyết is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.




3.  N. Thị Thuỷ is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.






4.  N. Thị Hoan is a 46-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.





5.  N. Thị Vinh is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.




6.  Vũ Thị Phẩm is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.






About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:




The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.





*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.





Khoa Lê Thị (253) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Khoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 14-Đông Sơn (10.13.14).





Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm đồ gia dụng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Khoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Khoa kiếm được khoảng 2100000 VND.  Vào 2009, Khoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Khoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1,626,900 VND.






Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

\pr\
\pr\


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

\pr\
\pr\


1.  N. Thị Lâm (251) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1626900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

\pr\
\pr\

2.  N. Thị Tuyết (252) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1626900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

\pr\
\pr\

3.  N. Thị Thuỷ (256) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1626900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

\pr\
\pr\

4.  N. Thị Hoan (254) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1626900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

\pr\
\pr\

5.  N. Thị Vinh (255) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1626900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

\pr\
\pr\

6.  Vũ Thị Phẩm (257) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1626900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

\pr\
\pr\

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
\pr\
\pr\

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

\pr\
\pr\

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is 30 years old, married and the mother of two children, who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking woman and because of her hard work, she is so loved by her husband and the children. She prepares and serves porridge in the community where she lives. Her porridge is enjoyed by many as breakfast and supper. Kate prepares a large quantity, and before the day ends, it all will be finished.

Recently she complains of a high increase in stock at the market, making it very difficult to meet the daily demand of her customers. She is requesting a loan to buy an increased stock of bread, eggs, milk, tea bags, etc. She believes her resources support her husband in taking care of the children. It is her dream to save more, to expand her business and to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy bread, sugar, tea, Milo, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
58-year-old Señor Angel L. has three children and lives in San Antonio neighborhood in the city of Tobati. He has dedicated more than 15 years to manufacturing bricks. One of his children helps him with his work with much responsibility. They are humble and self-sacrificing people.

Señor Angel has an established clientele thanks to the good quality of his products. He stocks up on his material deposits from different areas of the country. This line of work is very difficult because there is a lot of competition in that area; 80% of the inhabitants in that area work in the same line of work.

The credit that he is asking for will be used to purchase primary materials (clay and wood). He is very content with the loan support that the institution has offered him, and he hopes it will continue so that his business can grow and he can better the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials: clay and wood

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
"My business are buy & sell and Hog raising. It is helpful to sustain the needs of my family ", says Rolando H., 57 years old father of four children. His eldest child is turning 24 this year. He is a bit worried because his child's school expenses is growing.

He is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to purchase additional stocks for his sari-sari store business. And because he runs a piggery as well, he will save the rest to buy feed to grow pigs.

CEVI helps him manage his business efficiently. CEVI teaches their clients about savings. They also provide insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for his sari sari store business

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria Luisa es casada, trabaja en la colonia San Miguel  a 22 km de Nueva Guinea, tiene 1 hijo de 10 años de edad estudiando la primaria, su esposo trabaja como agricultor en  una comarca quien le apoya con los gastos familiares, esta solicitando su primer  crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo compra de materiales de construcciòn para mejorar algunos detalles que le hacen falta a su casa, Maria todos los dias tiene que madrugar para dejar hechos sus quehaceres y salir muy temprano a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños de la colonia San Miguel, se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora, responsable y por ser una persona que ha luchado para ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda,  su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad, trabajo, y  llegar a ser una excelente profesional,  tiene como meta el proximo año estudiar una licenciatura para asi mejorar mas sus conocimientos.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: The Blood Of Jesus Group

texts.en:
Justice is a trader. He runs a cold store in his community. He is 35 years old, married and has four children, all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in the town of Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

Justice is the leader of a trust bank group called "The Blood of Jesus". The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They supply retailers and chop bar operators in their town and nearby communities. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Shamsaddin

texts.en:
Shamsaddin S. has raised cattle and farmed for fourteen years. With three children and the responsibility of providing food for his home, he has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals.

Today Shamsaddin finds himself in need of purchasing calves to raise in order to be able to take greatest advantage of raising and selling them when necessary. For this reason he is obtaining loan in order to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Newton

texts.en: Newton sells detergent, toiletries and disinfectant to make a living. He has been in this business for two years. He is 36 years old and married with five children. He hopes for the loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more toiletries and detergent to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more detergent and toiletries to sell

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Miss Phally N., 35 (on the left), is single and lives with her father and sister and brother along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phally has been a farmer for about 2 years. She hopes to increase the yield of her vegetables, so she is applying for her first loan of US$ 300 in order to purchase fertilizer to put on her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To use for growing vegetables

loans.name: Iyobosa

texts.en:
Iyobosa is 42 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a carpenter. She sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers.

She is a friendly woman who is determined to excel in all that she lays her hand to do. She started her business this year.

She hopes for a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es: Edmundo, tiene un vehículo (Vagoneta Toyota)con el cual trabaja todos los días, brindando un servicio a la población en general. Vive en una casa en Anticrético, el deseo más grande que tienen es comprarse su propia casa, para de esa manera   dejar de vivir en anticresis, ya que le resulta algo incomodo pòr no poder realizar algunos cambios en la casa por no ser de su propiedad. Cuenta con algo de capital para la compra de su vivienda, capital que lo tienen invertido en el anticrético, por un monto de  seis mil dólares americanos ($us 6.000.-)su esposa se dedica a la venta de comidas en la misma casa para de esta manera poder ayudar en su núcleo familiar. Tienen dos hijos a quienes sustentan. Don Edmundo empezó a trabajar desde muy joven ya lleva en el rubro 15 años y con su propio vehículo  1 año y medio, hoy en día trabaja más tranquilamente con su vehículo ya que no tienen que entregar renta diaria a nadie solo trabajar para él y su familia. El sueño de tener su `propia vivienda no está muy lejana puesto que ahora gana  más dinero con su propio vehículo para aumentar el capital que tiene invertido en el anticrético.
texts.en:
Edmundo has a Toyota station wagon, which he employs every day to offer service to the greater community. He lives in a house in Anticrético. His greatest desire is to buy his home, so that he can get out of antichresis (possession and enjoyment of mortgaged property by mortgagee in lieu of interest payments) because it is inconvenient for him to not be able to make changes to his house because it is not his property. He does have some capital to use towards his home, capital which he is currently using to pay off the antichresis, but he needs six thousand American dollars ($6,000). His wife sells food out of their house to help support their nuclear family. They have two dependent children. Don Edmundo started to work when he was very young, and he has been working in this field for 15 years, with his own car for one and half years. Now, his work in his own car is easier because they don't have to pay daily rent to anyone; he can just work for himself and his family. His dream of his own house is not far off, because he now earns more money with his own vehicle, which he can use to pay off his mortgage.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheels and other vehicle improvements

loans.name: Larn

texts.en: Larn L., 32, is married with four children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling groceries at home in her village to her new and existing customers, earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband produces traditional drums as souvenirs for tourists, earning a gross income of US $14 per day. Both sources of income from L. and her husband help cover the family expenses. L. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, L. is asking for a loan of US $600 to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. L. is pictured with her husband while he is producing drums.

loans.use: to repair the house

loans.name: Chhoam

texts.en: Chhoam S., 45, is married and lives with two school-aged children in Battambong town, Cambodia. S. is engaged in the business of selling porridge and soup at her home. She is able to earn an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family’s expenses. Her husband operates his motorbike as a taxi driver, earning an income of US $4 per day. He always provides his service at the markets in the town. S. and her family members try to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because the old motorbike often needs to get repaired. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena H. is 36 years old and married, and she is the loving mother of two children. Rena’s husband is currently unemployed, so her business is the main source of income for her family.

Rena has a grocery store where she sells sweets (candies), preserved food, juices, soft drinks, detergents, and other products. She has been in this business for five years. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Rena is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again.

Rena wants to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 1,200 AZN to increase the inventory she has for sale. 

One of Rena’s dreams is that her daughters progress by means of their studies. You can help Rena to approach her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela K. is 38 years old, married and the mother of eight (8) children. She lives in the Igara Busia District where she does her food business. She started her business in 2008 to generate income to help her husband bring up their children. Before she started her current business, Pamela used to sell groceries but had to change, as it was not generating enough income.  Now she restocks her products on a daily basis.

As a mother, Pamela has a big dream for her children. She wants all of them to get an education that would guarantee them a bright future. Having learned from KMET about economic empowerment, Pamela developed an urge to expand her business by buying more supplies and to start a poultry farm that would boost her income. To achieve all this, she needs a loan worth Ksh.10,000.

loans.use: To buy more stock and chicks

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es:
Betzabé, de 60 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Enrique (59) y su hijo Ricardo (24), sus otros 5 hijos se han independizado y tienen sus propias familias.

Hace 3 años instaló una pequeña y bien surtida tienda de comestibles en su vivienda, al principio sentía temor de no tener buenas ganancias, pero sus ganas de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar hicieron que empiece con el negocio, tiempo después se dio cuenta que le daba buenas ganancias y amplió el local de su bodega. A Betzabé le gusta mucho su trabajo porque es tranquilo y en algunas oportunidades una de sus hijas la ayuda, sobretodo cuando tiene que salir, pues no le gusta cerrarla porque es una perdida. Aunque a su edad la mayoría de personas piensan en descansar después de toda una vida de trabajo, ella piensa en mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.

Este  es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito para seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta. Además está muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo, ya que todos son muy puntuales en los pagos de sus cuotas. Betzabé invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Betzabe, 60, lives in her own home accompanied by her husband Enrique, 59, and her son Ricardo, 24. Her other 5 children are independent and live with their own families. Three years ago she set up a small and well-stocked food store in her home. At first she feared she would not have good earnings, but her desire to help her husband with the household expenses led her to start the business. She later realized that the store would give her good earnings and so she expanded the store site. Betzabe likes her work very much because it is quiet. At times one of her daughters helps her, especially when she has to go out, because she does not like to close the store and lose the income. Although at her age the majority of people think of resting after a lifetime of work, she is thinking about improving the facilities of her store and offering a greater variety of products. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who have made her loans possible so that she can continue doing the work that she enjoys. Also, she is very pleased to work with her group, since everyone is very punctual with their payments. Betzabe will invest the money that she requests in the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise to restock her store and offer a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Riham

texts.en:
Riham is a single woman, 23 years old. She has worked at home-based clothing sales since 2006 to earn income to be able to pay her academic school fees. She also sells women’s accessories. She is known by the neighbors and she has a good number of clients.

Today, Riham is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy more clothes and accessories to offer the new collection to her customers and make a good profit. And she plans to expand her business in the future to open a formal clothes store.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna O. is married with one child. She owns a business where she sells artificial flowers and funeral wreaths. She started this business 10 years ago. Excellent client service and large variety bring in many clients.

In Ukrainian culture there is a time in spring to remember the dead. Most people go to the cemeteries and put artificial flowers or wreaths by the graves of their relatives. Thus spring is a high season for Inna.

Inna would like to borrow 18,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. Inna's business goal is to start several more retail locations.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cassava to make fufu to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 52 years old and married with three children who are in school.  She runs a boutique to earn a living. She has been in the business for nine years and has one employee.   She saves her money with her group in Faulu Kenya called Dafulos on a weekly basis, which enables her to borrow loans because the group guarantees. She had previously taken out two loans from Faulu Kenya which she used to expand her business, and she successfully repaid.  She hopes that she will have saved enough money so that she can have a good retirement after work in the future. Her wish is to see her children through the university.   She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Julio Hermes

texts.es: El prestatario se dedica desde hace 8 años en brindar transporte a escolares y servicio de taxi; la movilidad que utiliza es alquilada con placa BF-2838 de propiedad del Señor Tasayco Saravia Hector.Es soltero, vive en casa familiar junto a su madre y dos sobrinos.No cuenta con experiencia crediticia ni comerciales. Requiere prestamo para invertir en un negocio y necesidad personal.
texts.en:
The borrower has worked for eight years providing school transportation and taxi service. The vehicle he uses is rented with plate BF-2838, and it belongs to Mr. Tasayco Saravia Hector. He is single, and he lives in the family house with his mother and two nephews. He does not have loan or commercial experience. He needs the loan to invest in his business and for personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal needs and invest in his business

loans.name: Confianza Group

texts.es:
La señora Ninfa es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza hace 3 años aproximadamente, las socias del Banco son de la comunidad de Totoraccocha, Provincia de Acobamba, Departamento de Huancavelica.
Ninfa es casada, tiene 8 hijos, Ninfa empezó con la compra de árboles  para  hacer leña y venderlos en  Acobamba mas adelante    a medida  que iba  creciendo el negocio en su  comunidad ejecutaron la  construcción de un centro  educativo donde le mandaron habilitar listones y pies derechos, a la  fecha  provee a la municipalidad de Acobamba; Puntales, pies derechos y habilitación de maderas para  diferentes  obras. Ahora tiene un camión para poder trasladar su madera y leña. Los árboles los compra en las  comunidades  aledañas a Totoraccocha,  y los  vende  al municipio de Acobamba  y la leña a diferentes tiendas y panaderías, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su  esposo, sus hijos y el yerno mayor. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de mas  árboles y mandarlos  a  habilitar madera.
Ninfa quiere comprarse una  combi para poder prestar servicio de movilidad en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ninfa has been a member of the Confianza (Confidence) Community Bank for approximately the past three years. The group's members are from the community of Totoraccocha, province of Acobamba, department of Huancavelica. Ninfa is married and has eight children. She started out buying trees to make into firewood to sell in the municipality of Acobamba. Later on as the business kept growing she implemented the construction of an education center in her community by providing beams and other timber supplies. To date, she has provided Acobamba with planks, beams and timber for other construction projects. Now she owns a truck to transport her timber and firewood. She buys the trees from the surrounding communities of Totoraccocha and sells the timber supplies to the municipality of Acobamba and the firewood to local shops and bakeries. She carries out the work with the help of her husband, her children and her eldest son-in-law. She plans to use to the loan to invest in the purchase of more trees and make it into timber to sell. Ninfa wants to buy herself a van so she can be able to provide transportation services in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trees to make into timber and firewood

loans.name: Zoila Isabel

texts.es:
Zoila de 64 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, ella vende hace 10 años bebidas gaseosas para mantenerse con su propio dinero. Por la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio inicio comprando bebidas a la distribuidora de coca cola. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación obtuvo clientela para venderles a sus clientes. Trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Cada bebida la vende a $ 0.30, desde la mañana comienza a repartir las bebidas hasta las 20h00 . Ella quiere vender en su casa las colas pero para eso necesita comprar con el préstamo mas colas.    

En el futuro quiere tener su propio deposito de bebidas para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Zoila, 64, lives in El Suburbio, Guayaquil. For 10 years she has sold soft-drinks in order to earn money to support herself. She was desperate to have her own business so she started out buying soft-drinks from the Coca-Cola distributor. Little by little with effort and determination she acquired regular customers. She works from 9am until 10pm every day. Each drink is sold for $0.30. She starts out selling in the morning and goes until 10pm. She wants to sell the colas in her home but to do so needs a loan with which to buy more colas. In the future, she’d like to have a beverage warehouse to assure her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For beverages.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Efrain; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; él socio es abogado de profesión, él tiene una oficina en pleno corazón del Cusco en San Andrés, él socio desea implementar su sala de espera, para que sus clientes estén cómodos mientras él los atiende, El socio desea comprar un televisor y algunos cuadros. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un televisor y cuadros para su oficina.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the comunal bank “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”. He lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. The member is Efrain. He is 40 years old, lives with his partner and has two children. He is a lawyer and has an office in the heart of Cusco in San Andrés. He wishes to set up his waiting room, so that his clients are comfortable while he sees to them. He wants to buy a television and some paintings. He is soliciting the loan to buy the television and paintings for his office. He values and is infinitely grateful for the loan given, since it will allow him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. Moreover, he commits to making the loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a television and paintings for the waiting room of his office

loans.name: César Antonio

texts.es: César Antonio M. L. de 20 años de edad, es un joven muy visionario y emprendedor el cual cuenta con su propio taller de corte y confección, el reside en el departamento de San Salvador junto a su madre la cual trabaja como comerciante. César elabora ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, así mismo elabora ropa para camas y cortinas, el elabora la ropa en su casa, lugar en el cual tiene sus maquinas de coser, y luego las comercializa con sus vecinos y amigos y de esta mismo forma las vende en diferentes puntos del país comercializándolas de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias y cantones. A pesar de su corta edad César trabaja muy duro para poder ayudar a su madre a salir adelante, él se ha vuelto una gran ayuda para ella y de esta forma contar con todo lo necesario. Es por esta razón que el solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de tela, en diferentes estampados y colores, así mismo para comprar hilo y botones y todo lo necesario para invertir en su taller de costura y elaborar más trabajo para comercializa en mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
César Antonio M. L. is 20 years old and has his own sewing business. He is an entrepreneur and a young man with great vision. He lives in the department of San Salvador with his mother, who works as a merchant. César makes clothing for men, women and children. He also makes bedding and curtains. He makes his clothing at home where he has his sewing machines and then he markets them with his friends and neighbors. He travels to different neighborhoods and cantons in different areas of the country to sell them. In spite of his young age, César works very hard to provide for his mother. He has become a great help to her and she has all that she needs. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan so that he can have the capital to invest in his business. He will buy a larger quantity of fabric in different prints and colors, thread, buttons and all that is necessary for his sewing business so he can make more clothing and sell in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread and buttons

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has two young children who attend school. He is the main provider for his family with his business income. He has owned a car painting shop in his town since 1990. During this long period, he has gained good experience and a good reputation in this field. He is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his capital to improve and expand his business. In the future, he is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell spare car parts

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To increase his capital to improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Kitamba Turibamwe Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
Hard working and trustworthy 32-year-old married father of two children, M. Jackson is a professional teacher who does other side businesses such photography in his free time. He is further involved in agricultural farming where he carries out cattle fattening. 

He has been doing this for three years in Kitamba, Ibanda, and is able to earn about $67 on a monthly basis from the photography. His drawback is having a small stock of cows in his farming business. Therefore, he would like to use this loan to restock his cattle business by buying more cows for fattening and later resale for a profit. 

His future plans are to expand his business and improve his sales revenue. He wants to improve his family's living conditions and build a residential house.

loans.use: buying more cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Tomasa Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito D. Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa Agripina; ella tiene 62 años D. edad y es casada y  tiene 5 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz), y también es propietaria D. un bar picantería que trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, su esposo se dedica a la ganadería y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos.la socia quiere ampliar su bar picantería y mejorar el servicio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocina  y para comprar maíz para hacer la chicha.

  La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Tomasa Agripina, 62, is a member of the “VIRGEN D. LA O” communal bank located in Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is married and has 5 children. She combines her daily household chores with chicha sales (a drink maD. from corn). She also owns a pub that’s open from 8am until 6pm. Her husband is a cattleman and together they are providing for their children. She’d like to enlarge her pub and improve service. She is asking for a loan to buy kitchen supplies and corn to make chicha. She uses this forum to thank all those who are part of this dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen supplies and corn to make chicha (a drink made from fermented corn).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods for reselling

loans.name: Chunaidullo

texts.en:
M. Chunaidullo is a 50-year-old married man with six children. His family plans include moving forward with crop production so that he can financially support his children’s studies. The biggest problem Chunaidullo faces is that pests have affected his crops, and he does not have enough money to deal with the problem. He has been working in agriculture for five years. He is requesting this loan in order to use it for his crops, thus thwarting losses. Agriculture is his family’s source of income. For this reason, Chunaidullo gives thanks to IMON and Kiva for the support it gives him via this loan, which will be of great benefit for his crops.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Este Grupo se formo atrvez de la Sra. Luisa C., le invito  a sus vecinas para formar un comité. 
Cada una de las integrantes realiza actividades dependiendo de las facilidades con que cuetan y de las herramientas con cuentan para sus emprendimientos.
De esta manera una de las integrantes es la señora Eusebia docente y se ha integrado al comité y quiere comenzar con una actividad que le genera ingreso extra a la actividad que ella realiza.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropas y calzados que estaria vendiendo en un comienzo en sus tiempos libres y mas adelante si el negocio resulta desea abrir un salon para exponer sus mercaderias.
texts.en:
This group was started by Sra. Luisa C. who invited her neighbors to form a committee. The members engage in activities based on their skill sets and have the equipment needed to run their businesses.

One of the members is Sra. Eusebia, a teacher. She joined the committee and wants to start a business so that she can generate extra income. Eusebia is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing and shoes that she can sell in her spare time. Sometime later she hopes to open a boutique where she can display her merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE FALLOU est créé le 28 mars 2007. Il est composé de 03 femmes qui habitent la même concession et nouent de très bonnes relations amicales. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de THIECKENE-LOUGA

Madame AWA B. à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait du petit commerce et de l'embouche ovine depuis son intégration dans le Banc Villageois.

Son crédit lui permettra d'amplifier son activité en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement et d'acheter un mouton.

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de la famille
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Fallou Solidarity group was created on 28 March 2007. It is composed of 3 women who live in the same area and have established excellent social relations with each other. The group is a member of the Village Loan fund of Thieckene-Louga.

Ms. Awa B., on the right in the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 30 years old, married, and is the mother of 6 children who are in her care.

She has run a small business raising sheep since joining the Village Loan fund.

This loan will allow her to expand her business by increasing her supplies and letting her buy a sheep.

Her goal is to provide for her family.

loans.use: To expand and promote her income-generating activity.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 43 años, esta casada con Walter de 44 años, que es confeccionista. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales  los 2 mayores ya  trabajan y la ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Juntos viven en su casa que es propia. Cuando sus hijos empezaron a crecer tuvo más tiempo, así que decidió empezar con un negocio propio; han transcurrido 3 años y hasta la fecha se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza de diversas marcas que ofrece por catalogo. Le entretiene mucho su labor ya que tiene clientes fijos con las que conversa, mientras negocia, además su capacidad para convencer le ha permitido  recibir grandes incentivos de la compañía por el volumen de su  ventas. Por esta razón esta satisfecha, pues mientras trabaja y gana dinero no descuida las labores de su hogar, además ayuda a su esposo en los gastos, pero lo que le disgusta es que a veces sus clientes se demoran en pagar en la fecha indicada y eso genera un atraso de su capital. Como Sonia es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado aumentar su mercadería y también quiere instalar una librería en su casa. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que les permitirá continuar en su negocio. Sonia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de productos de belleza, pues necesita cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, asimismo espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Sonia is 43 years old, married to Walter, a 44 year old tailor.  They have 4 children, 2 of which are older and already work and help with the household expenses. Together they live in their own house. When their children began to grow, Sonia had more time and decided to start a business; it has been 3 years that she has earned her living selling different brands of beauty products through a catalog. She enjoys her work very much, speaking and doing business with her steady customers; it has given her the ability to receive big incentives from the company for her volume of sales.  For this reason she is satisfied because as she works and earns money, she does not neglect her household chores, and helps her husband with expenses.  What she dislikes is that sometimes customers delay paying on the specified date and that generates a delay with capital. Sonia is an entrepreneurial woman; for the future she plans to increase her merchandise and also wants to install a bookstore in her home. It is her first credit MFP and promises to pay the assessed fees on time because she does not want to look bad with the people who made this loan possible and allow them to continue their business. Sonia has plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of beauty products because she needs to meet the demand of her customers and hope to improve her profits.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty supplies

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 32-year-old married man who has been working as a house painter since 1995. Khalil has lived in Saida all his life, and he’s well known among his friends and neighbors. He’s famous in the region because of his quality work and commitment. Khalil is requesting a loan for the second time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary products for his work and to make preparations for the expected baby. His previous loan had a positive impact on his work and family. Khalil is happy about the expected baby and can’t wait to see him; he hopes to provide a good and safe home for his new small family. He also hopes to expand his business to cover a wider area and to bring in employees to help open a construction company.

loans.use: To buy necessary products for his work and to make preparations for the expected baby

loans.name: Mercilyn

texts.en:
Mercilyn S. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old. Mercilyn is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercilyn owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of daily use products such as sugar, coffee, milk, soap, canned good, 'pancit' (noodles), instant noodles and spices to the community. Mercilyn has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mercilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercilyn has successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mercilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Mercilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: 59-year-old Margarita L. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has nine children. Two of her children still go to school. Margarita is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops to sell at the market. She also raises chickens and runs a sari-sari store. Margarita does all these activities to provide for her family. Margarita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: This is 27 year-old Mabinty K.. She is married and has three children ages 3, 7, and 11. In 2006, Mabinty established her used clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-employed. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about Le 450,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy additional used clothing. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Mabinty plans to educate her children to college level, buy a commercial vehicle for additional profit making, and become a supplier to other retailers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Madina has a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Madina sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Madina has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. The main business challenges for Madina include debtors and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to educate her children up to university and also to be a wholesaler.   

Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria  P. is a 56-year-old widow who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a sari-sari (general) store and a buy-and-sell coconut business. 

She lives in Cauayan , Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her sari-sari store and buy-and-sell coconut businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. 

Gloria is borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she can  purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gloria  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora M. S. María de los Ángeles, tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Doña María es una persona que por su situación económica no pudo ingresar a la universidad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, tomo la decisión de ser comerciante ya que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y María tuvo que asumir la responsabilidad.
Es su primer crédito, se entero de los servicios que ofrece la fundación por medio de una cliente de capacitación , con el crédito piensa invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para tener más capital de trabajo ya que María ha enfrentado algunas  enfermedades  y abandono un poco su negocio
María empezó en el comercio hace 25 años, tuvo un capital por empezar de 100,000.00 los cuales fueron prestados por su esposo, Doña María hace las labores domesticas en la pura mañana y durante la tarde se la dedica a vender, cobrar y a coser
Este crédito  será de gran   ayuda a su negocio ya que ha quedado descapitalizado y con el crédito podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y tener más capital de trabajo
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles M. S. is 55 years old and lives with her husband and two children.  Owing to her financial situation, María couldn't go to university.  She is a very hard-working and responsible person who took the decision to become a saleswoman since her husband lost his job and she had to take responsibility.

This is María's first loan.  She found out about the services that Fundación Mujer offer through a training client.  She plans to invest her loan in buying merchandise so that she has more working capital as she has faced a number of illnesses and had to leave her business for a while.  María started out 25 years ago with 100,000 'colones' in capital from her husband.  María does her housework in the morning and in the afternoon she sells, collects payments and sews.

This loan will be a great help to María's business since she has been without capital and this loan will enable her to improve her quality of life and have more working capital available.

loans.use: To have more working capital so that she can keep investing

loans.name: San Juan Bautista Ñeembucú Group

texts.es:
El grupo "San Juan Bautista Ñeembucú" ya está en el 2 ciclo del programa, ellas utilizan el crédito para la compra de materiales para sus diversos negocios, este grupo se formó el 27 de agosto  del 2010, y hasta la fecha siguen siendo parte del programa de Comité Mujeres Rurales, ya que en él encuentran la ayuda económica que necesitan para continuar sus actividades y así mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
La sra. Dora T. se destaca en el grupo ya que ella se dedica al lavado de ropa y ella dice que gracias a la fundación pudo iniciar su mini-comercio y hoy día solicita el crédito nuevamente para comprar un lavarropas y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
The group “ San Juan Bautista Ñeembucú” is currently in it second cycle of this program.  They use the loan to buy materials for their various businesses.  This group was formed the 27th of August, 2010, and since that date they have continued to be part of the program of the Committee of Rural Women, from which they find the economic help they need in order to continue their activities and so improve their quality of life and that of their family.

Dora T. stands out from the group as she works washing clothing, and she wash that thanks to the foundation she was able to begin her micro-business and today she is asking for a new loan in order to buy a washing machine and so increase her output.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
Doña Josefina, tiene 56 años de edad, reside en Lolotiquillo, departamento de Morazán, vive junto a sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y la elaboración de flores, ella realiza sus ventas por las mañanas y de dedica por las tardes a la elaboración de flores artificiales.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de leña, maíz y otros materiales para elaborar flores,  ya que por el momento no dispone de mucha materia prima por lo que este préstamo le dará fortaleza para continuar en su negocio.
Doña Josefina  tiene como objetivo, trabajar diariamente por conseguir ahorros para mejorar el techo de la vivienda ya que esta deteriorado, también apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years old and lives in Lolotiquillo, in Morazán department.  She lives together with her children and her business is selling tortillas and making artificial flowers.  She makes her sales in the mornings and in the afternoons she makes her flowers.

Josefina is requesting a loan to buy firewood, corn and other materials for making her flowers since she doesn't have much raw material at the moment.  This loan will give her strength to continue in her business.

Josefina's goals are to work every day so that she can save the money she needs to improve her roof since it is in a bad state of repair and also to support her children.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and other materials for making artificial flowers

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La Sra. Manuela está casada pero actualmente su marido no participa del crédito porque está trabajando en un restaurante en la Ciudad D. Asunción y no le dan permiso para firmar los documentos con ella.
El copetín lo habilitaron en el año 1997 con la experiencia del esposo que es cocinero D. profesión, al principio solo tenían una despensa y luego fueron complementando los fines D. semana con la venta D. pollo al espiedo, y como tenían éxito fueron agregando a su menú más variantes del mismo para luego incorporarle la venta D. bebidas para todos los gustos.
Su local comercial está en su propia vivienda ya que está ubicado sobre  una calle principal D. su barrio, en la Ciudad D. San Lorenzo.
En el negocio trabajan con dos D. sus hijas, quienes están estudiando en el colegio, nivel secundario.
Ella desea el crédito para poder comprar más bebidas y comestibles, que puedan abastecer D. mejor manera su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Manuela is married but her husband is not joining her on this loan because he is working at a restaurant in the city of Asunción and has not been able to get time off from work to sign the documents with her. 

They outfitted the snack bar in 1997 with the experience of the husband who is a cook by profession. At first they had only a pantry and later they began augmenting on the weekends by selling rotisserie chicken. Since they were successful they continued to add to their menu more variations of the same, then incorporating drinks into the menu to please all manner of tastes. 

Their business establishment is located within their own living quarters as they are located on one of the primary roads in their neighborhood in the City of San Lorenzo. 

They work at their business with two of their daughters who are in school at the high school level. 

She wants the loan to be able to purchase more drinks and food items in order to better supply her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of drinks: beer, soft drinks, wines etc., along with bakery items, meat, sugar and other food items.

loans.name: Bikuto Work Hard Group, Kihihi

texts.en: T. Godfrey is the leader of Bikuto Work Hard Group, Kihihi. He is 36 years old. He is married and has five children above the age of 1, with four already in school. Godfrey sells clothes and clothing materials from Butogota by the side of the road, out of his home. At times, he also goes to the daily markets. He has been in business for over seven years, and he is able to generate 250,000 monthly. He is also involved in farming and selling farm produce, and he has a boda-boda that he hires out for a daily fee. He is very hardworking, and this is why he is able to run all his businesses. His dream is to expand his business and educate his children to the highest level. Godfrey needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Bernitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BERNITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Guadalupe. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de chalecos, distribución de cerveza, venta de embutidos y derivados, venta de comida, venta de comida, tejido en lana, venta de cosméticos, vehiculo público. 

La señora Guadalupe,  indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por información de mi mamá que le invitaron para sacar crédito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio que consiste en tejidos de chompas a máquina, que viene trabajando hace tres años; este oficio lo aprendió de sus cuñados empezando con tejidos a mano.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de máquina overlok (para mejorar la calidad de sus productos). El material que utiliza para la elaboración de sus chompas lo compra del Desaguadero de las mayoristas; posterior a la elaboración lo vende en la Ceja y a parientes que venden por mayor. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la facilidad del crédito y el apoyo para la salud.
texts.en:
The BERNITAS community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The bank has eight members and is managed by a board of directors which is led by Guadalupe.  The businesses which are carried out by the members of this group are varied and include: sewing vests, distributing beer, selling cold meats and derivative products, selling meals, knitting, selling cosmetics and running a public vehicle.

Guadalupe tells us that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer and she joined through information from her mom.  They invited her to take out a loan.  Guadalupe currently has a business machine knitting sweaters.  She has been in this business for three years.  She learned this trade from her sisters-in-law and started out knitting by hand.

Guadalupe will use her loan to buy an overlock machine (to improve the quality of her products).  She buys the materials that she uses to make her sweaters from wholesalers in Desaguadero.  When she has made her products she sells them in La Ceja and also sells them to family members who sell them wholesale.  Through her work, she makes income to support her family.  She is married and has one child.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the ease of the loans and the health services.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine

loans.name: Ma. Daty

texts.en:
Ma. Daty is 43 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Ma. Daty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Ma. Daty has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling seaweeds and livestock. Ma. Daty aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Adjoa Felicia

texts.en: Adjoa sells cosmetics, panties and other items at Elmina. Adjoa has received senior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been selling cosmetics, panties and other items for five years. She helps to pay the utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy cosmetics and panties. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy cosmetics and panties.

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli was born in 1961. She lives in Azatamut village, Tavush Marz, with her husband and her daughter. For a long time Leyli worked as a engineer at Ijevan works, then as a mathematics teacher at the village school. 

Ten years ago, Leyli and her husband re-equipped their garage and started a food trading business in it. Their daughter helps them in the shop.  Thanks to their joint efforts they run their business successfully.  In their shop they sell food and household goods.  Through the business's profit,  Leyli and her family have bought furniture for their house, a car for goods delivery and they are able to support their family. 

Leyli is seeking a 700,000 AMD loan to buy beverages, food, sweets, confectionery and a large lot of household goods for her shop.

loans.use: to buy beverages, food, sweets, confectionery and household goods for her shop

loans.name: Tuvdenjargal

texts.en:
Tuvdenjargal is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in Mongolia's Gobi-Altai province. His two daughters, ages 17 and 20, attend college, while his wife is a tailor who manages her own business. Tuvdenjargal makes wooden products in his town, a business he started in 1993 after working as a carpenter at a private company for three years. Now he has his own workshop near his home and is planning to expand his business in the future.

A kind man who was able to stabilize his business within a few short years, Tuvdenjargal is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wood and some equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and some equipment for his business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila, vive en un lugar muy bonito, ya que es muy fresco y todo tipo de frutas seda , en ese lugar, ella es casada con el señor Jesús, con quien procreo tres hijos quienes ya están casados. 

  Ella es ama de casa  y se dedica a la  compra y venta de maíz para tostarlo  y luego  venderlo en la misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva un año  y comenta que le bien ya que con ello  ha tenido un buen ingreso.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad inicio por su propia creatividad, para tener sus propios ingresos, para que se pueda apoyar con algunos gastos que se generan en su hogar.

      Lo que más deseo que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo que le han otorgado pueda mejorar su calidad de vida para así salir delante.
texts.en:
Lucila lives in a very beautiful place where it is very cool and there are all types of silk fruits. She is married to Jesús; they have three children who are all now married.  She is a housewife who buys corn to roast and then resell in the same community.  She’s been in this line of work for a year and comments that she’s done well with it because she’s had good earnings.
Her inspiration for this activity was her own creativity, to have income of her own and to help out with some of the household expenses.  What she most wants from this small activity and the loan she’s been granted is to be able to improve her quality of life to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to pay to have the corn roasted and then sell it ground.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa, ellos se consideran una familia muy unida. Trabaja en la crianza y venta de animales, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 13 años, además en su casa ha implementado su establo de animales en donde los engorda hasta que consiga un peso exacto, y que luego son llevados en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Por otro lado, dispone de terrenos de cultivo en donde siembra principalmente alfalfa, pues le  sirve para alimentar a sus animales, y a su vez para venderlos. En estas tareas siempre tiene la ayuda de sus hijos, en los que se encargan de cortar el pasto y cuidar de los animales. Silvia disfruta de esta trabajo porque le permite ser independiente en el control de su tiempo y esto le da más ánimo para seguir trabajando con empeño en sus actividades. “Me agrada ser parte de un grupo humano donde todos se consideran  como familia” comenta Silvia, porque en estos años de haber trabajado de manera grupal con MFP el banco comunal que integra han superado varios obstáculos de las cuales ya son 12 ciclos de crédito donde  todos han demostrado su puntualidad. Como siempre tiene de buena costumbre seguir invirtiendo su dinero en la compra de más animales.
