texts.en: Silvia is 39, and lives with her husband and their 2 children in her home.  They consider themselves to be a very united family.  Silvia works raising and selling animals.  She has been engaged in this activity for 13 years; she has set up a stable by her house for her animals where she fattens them until they reach an exact weight.  Later she takes them to the livestock market in her area.  In addition, she has farmland where she mostly cultivates alfalfa, which she feeds to her animals and also sells.  In her work, she always has the help of her children; they are in charge of cutting the alfalfa and caring for the animals.  Silvia enjoys this work because it allows her to be independent and in control of her time, and this motivates her to continue working hard in these activities.  "I appreciate being a part of a group of people where everyone treats each other like family," she comments, because over the years of working as a group with MFP, her communal bank has overcome a number of obstacles.  This bank has already been through 12 loan cycles, and everyone has demonstrated punctuality in their payments.  As always, she has the good habit of investing her money in her business by purchasing more animals.

loans.use: to buy more animals

loans.name: 23 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa has a retail business selling cloth. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Hoa is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 23 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of six members. 
Hoa lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoa has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes to remodel her house, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and dressmaking supplies to resell.

loans.name: Delfines Group

texts.es: Abraham es originario de una localidad rica en cultura e historia cuenta con 29 años de edad y estudio una carrera técnica y ya no continuo con sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos, el esta casado la cual ella le ayuda a atender la tienda de bisutería y regalos que ellos tienen, es padre dos niñas una de 5 años la cual va a empezar a estudiar la primaria y la menor de dos años. Don Abraham esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pulseras, aretes, anillos, gargantillas, corsetería, juguetes y regalos y un poco de dulces ya que vende en una mesita en su local. El renta un local desde hace 5 años muy cerca del centro de su población, el surtirá artículos de plata ya que se le hace un buen negocio, el comprara en la ciudad de Taxco Guerrero los artículos de plata y la bisutería de fantasía en la cuidad de México ya que aya le dan un buen precio y así ganarle un poco mas a las cosas que vende. La meta que tiene Abraham es tener su propio local ya que si tiene perdidas al pagar la renta y el con las ganancias que obtenga ahorrara para la educación de su pequeña hija ya que empezara próximamente a estudiar la primaria y tendrá que comprarle los útiles escolares y los uniformes que ocupa en la escuela primaria. Las otras diez integrantes del grupo se llaman Elsa Celina, Ma. Eusebia, Blanca Estela, Verónica, Susana, Carlota, Ma. Eugenia, María del Carmen, Bernarda y cristina ellas invertirán sus créditos en zapatos por catalogo, en una cooperativa escolar, en una tienda de ropa, elotes preparados, bisutería, antojitos mexicanos y artículos para estética.
texts.en:
Abraham is from a location that’s rich in culture and history.  He’s 29 years old and studied a technical career but did not continue with his studies for lack of economic resources.  He’s married and his wife helps him tend to a costume jewelry and gift shop they have.  He is the father of two little girls, a five-year-old who is about to start elementary school and the youngest who is two years old.

Abraham is asking for a loan to buy bracelets, earrings, rings, necklaces, ladies’ underwear, toys and gifts and some candy since he also sells it from a table he has in his shop.

He has rented his shop very near to the center of his town for the last five years.  He will stock up on silver items because he feels it’s a good business.  He will buy the silver items in the city of Taxco, Guerrero and the costume jewelry in Mexico City because he gets good prices there and he can then earn slightly higher profits on the items he sells.

Abraham’s goal is to have a locale of his own because paying rent is a loss and profits he earns then can be used to save up for his little daughter’s education who is about to start elementary school and he’s going to have to buy her school supplies and uniforms that she needs in elementary school.

The other ten members of the group are named Elsa Celina, María Eusebia, Blanca Estela, Verónica, Susana, Carlota, María Eugenia, María del Carmen, Bernarda and Cristina.  They will use their loans for catalogue shoes, a school snack shop, a clothing store, prepared corn on the cob, costume jewelry, Mexican fast food snacks and beauty salon supplies.

loans.use: to buy silver and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Handaa

texts.en: Handaa is 48 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger (traditional nomadic tent-like dwelling) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her eldest daughter is a college student and the others are in high school. She started her business in 2004 by selling foods and other things on a mobile cart in her hometown. Now, she has her own commercial space where she sells her products. She has many years of business and work experience. She is a diligent woman who says, "I want to expand my business and then buy a container so that I can sell my goods and products easily." She is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to buy products in bulk at the wholesale price.

loans.use: To buy products at the wholesale price

loans.name: Gnek

texts.en:
Gnek, 21 years old, resides in Siem Reap Province, an area full of ancient temples. She sells vegetables, fish and pork and earns $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $5 per day. This couple has one children and he is two years old. 

Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for the use in the family. She wants to repair her house to be better for her family to live in. For her children, she will working hard to support them to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the use in the family.

loans.name: Don De Dieu Plus Group

texts.en:
“Don De Dieu Plus” is a group of ten small business owners chaired by André. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.
André’s main business activity is providing video games to children who pay to play. He has been a micro-entrepreneur since 2002. Having repaid his previous eight loans properly from Kiva partner HOPE DRC, he intends to use his next loan to buy a new series of children's games in order to generate additional profits. Currently, André makes a daily profit of $15 USD. His ambition is to someday expand his business by adding a computer section. He is 33 years old, single and has a daughter who is three years old. He also takes care of a child left by his relatives.

loans.use: to buy a new series of children's games.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger selection of fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa smokes fish and chicken at Takoradi. Adjoa has received junior high education.  She is divorced and has 3 children. She is responsible for the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish and chicken to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro is 44 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 

To earn a living, Ma. Socorro has a business selling soft drinks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Ma. Socorro has requested a loan of PHP 10,500 to purchase beverages to sell.

Ma. Socorro has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Ma. Socorro would like to pay school tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beverages to sell

loans.name: Jemame

texts.en:
Jemame is 23 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is single and has a 5-year-old child that is currently in school and living at home.

She started her business through her friend and for a year now she has been selling slippers in the market. She said sometimes business goes slow ( the buying), but she makes a lot of profit and has more customers, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for  her business.

She plans to learn a trade and help her child.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
This is Felicisima, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a single parent with three children currently studying in elementary school.  She keeps herself busy attending to her kids and business. She wants to provide a comfortable life for her family. 

Felicisima maintains a direct selling business. She sells herbal supplements. Her customers' orders are bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer on a cash basis. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community who prefer taking herbal medicines to cure their ailments.  She earns a minimum of Php550 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 31,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy herbal supplement orders for her customers. The herbal supplements that she carries produce good results for her clients and they recommend them to friends who they believe need them, too. To date, she has received plenty of orders and she needs additional capital. 

Felicisima dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She aspires to attain a good position in her direct selling business and to be able to have a kiosk someday where she can display her herbal supplement items.  She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to share her own story of God’s love and provision in her life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for herbal supplement products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anger

texts.en:
Anger is a 20-year-old married woman with one child. Her child is not in school. She has sold charcoal in Dokuru bor, South Sudan for two years.

Anger requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. In the future, she plans to use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro, administra un taller de enderezado y pintura automotriz,  vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, uno de sus hijos le ayuda a realizar algunas actividades en el taller, el trabaja desde hace 5 años, inicio como ayudante, y hace dos años instalo su propio taller en el cual contrata de manera eventual a un ayudante.
Actualmente Mauro solicita un préstamo para la compra de masilla, pinturas, sierras, fibra de vidrio, para poder realizar su trabajo, esta inversión le ayudara para tener los materiales necesarios y ahorrarse en su compra con la obtención de precios bajos por adquirirlos al contado.
Su Aspiración es crecer con más capacidad para mejorar su trabajo, ganarse más clientes y que su familia tengan una mejor forma de vida.
texts.en:
Mauro operates an auto paint and body repair business.  He lives with his wife and their three children, one of whom helps him with the business.  He's operated the shop for 5 years.  He started as an employee of another repair business before opening his own shop two years ago.  He then hired an employee to help him.
Mauro is applying for a loan to buy mastic, paint, tools and other supplies for the business.  The loan will allow him to save money when he buys the supplies he needs because he will get a discount for paying cash.  
Mauro's goal is to draw more customers and grow his business.  The extra income will allow him to better support his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his paint and body repair business.

loans.name: Gaudance

texts.en: Gaudence is 22 years old. She is married with two children. Her husband is a farmer. She has spent 3 years selling foodstuffs. She requested the loan to buy more beans and sorghum for resale. She plans to use the profits for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Nyatop

texts.en:
Nyatop lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 24 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Nyatop heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Productivas Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Productivas group is located in Canton Siglo II*, municipality Santa Cruz Mulua, in the department of Retalhuleu, Guatemala. 

The group is  composed of six hard working women who have know each other for many years. They all are involved in buying/selling businesses or production/selling. They have demonstrated in the early educational sessions that they are motivated and very interested in learning how to keep control of their expenses and sales. 

They also mentioned that nobody has even been interested in teaching them how to work and improve their business thus they are eager to have the Business Advisor monthly visit to improve their businesses. 

Lilian is 40 years old, a widow and is raising two kids under 15 years old who are going to school (in the picture, you can see her 4th from left). She does not how to read and write and is living far away from her family. While she was living with her husband and raising their family, he suddenly fell ill and ultimately passed from an unknown illness.  They exhausted their savings on medical bills and were forced to sell all of their appliances to pay doctors and hospital bills. Widowed and broke with two kids to raise, Lilian moved to a place where she pays no rent and gets electricity from the owner. She started selling “tortillas” door to door and now she has a place to make them and sell them too. Until now, she has been producing the tortillas for lunch and dinner. 

Her dream is to be able to have enough money to buy wood and corn by bulk because it is cheaper and now with the rainy season, dry wood is very difficult to find. With these supplies, she will be able to start producing tortillas for breakfast to meet her clients requests. She wants to learn how to manage her money and separate and save it in a way that she can start purchasing all of the appliances she was forced to sell when her husband got sick. 

Her actual monthly profit is Q1,740 (US$228) and she works 170 hours per month (US$1.35 profit per hour). Her business plan is to increase her profit by 40% by adding an additional selling time and by purchasing dry wood and corn in bulk.

loans.use: Buy corn buy bulk and dry wood to improve her production/selling hours

location.town: Canton El Siglo II, Santa Cruz Mulua, Retalhuleu

loans.name: Flimi Group

texts.fr: FLIMI est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Naïmath, la représentante du groupe(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 36 ans est mariée à un certain Moudachirou. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Naïmath vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Naïmath et son mari. Naïmath n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais a fait la restauration par la suite. Naïmath mène cette activité depuis six ans, ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses de la famille. Naïmath s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Naïmath sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FLIMI un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et de bidon d'huile.

loans.name: Yelian Group

texts.fr: YELIAN est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ida Aubierge (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans. Aubierge est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Luc. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Aubierge vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Aubierge vend des sacs de charbon de bois, du maïs et de l'huile végétale dans sa région depuis trois ans. Aubierge s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Aubierge sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe YELIAN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de charbon de bois, du maïs et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Victoria Secundina

texts.es: Victoria de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su esposo, ella posee un taller de costura desde hace 12 años en su casa de habitación, elabora manteles, bolsas, carteras, etc. comercializa su mercadería en las diferentes colonias y tiene muchos clientes, gracias a su trabajo es como ella puede salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas variedad de telas, hilos, agujas, elásticos, etc. ya que le va bien en su negocio y asi podra seguir teneiendo buenos ingresos economicos.

loans.use: compra de mas variedad de telas, hilos, agujas, elásticos, etc.

loans.name: Kossi Anani

texts.en:
Mr. L. Kossi Anani was born in Kpopé-Tansi in 1977 in the district of Zio. He is married and father of three, and works as a secondary school teacher. His salary is insufficient and irregular and he fails to meet all family needs; therefore he decided to launch a second career. Brave, courageous and hardworking, he decided to go in for market gardening to improve his revenue. Thus very early in the morning he works in his garden before going to the school and does the same the evening after school. His wife provides him with significant support in this activity that is growing larger and larger. Honest and good manager, he was able to reimburse very easily, the loans that he received earlier. Today, Mr. L. wants to expand his market gardening activity and make it an important source of revenue for his family. To that end, he requests a loan of $950 that will help him purchase a motor pump, watering cans, inputs and other necessary equipment for quality and large quantity market gardening.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC, a Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur L. Kossi Anani est né en 1977 à Kpomé-Tansi dans la préfecture du Zio. Marié et père de 03 enfants, il est enseignant dans un collège de la place. Son salaire étant insuffisant et irrégulier pour tous les besoins de la famille, il prit l’initiative d’entreprendre une activité parallèle à l’enseignement. Brave, courageux et bon travailleur, il décide de faire du maraîchage pour améliorer son revenu. C’est ainsi que très tôt le matin, il va travailler dans son jardin avant de partir à l’école et fait la même chose le soir après les cours. Sa femme lui apporte un soutien considérable dans cette activité qui, de plus en plus, prend une allure considérable. Honnête et bon gestionnaire, il a su rembourser facilement les crédits qu’il a déjà eus. Aujourd’hui, M. L. souhaite agrandir son maraîchage et en faire une source de revenu importante pour la famille. Il sollicite à cet effet, un crédit d’un montant de $950 qui va lui permettre d’acheter une motopompe, des arrosoirs, des intrants et autres matériels nécessaires aux cultures maraîchère en qualité et en quantité.

loans.use: to purchase a motor pump, watering cans, inputs and other necessary equipment

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She also knows how to keep records of her business transactions. She needs a loan of $650 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchse more stocks of fruits and vegetables for her grocery business

loans.name: Rosa Julia

texts.en: Rosa is 40 years old and supports her two children, Elsa Janeth, 18 and Diego Ivan, 16.  She currently has a successful business selling holiday-specific goods, such as flowers on All-saints Day, ceramic nativity scenes around Christmas and ¨misturas serpentinas¨ during Carnival. She currently rents space during festivals to sell her crafts. Although she does not have a permanent store she has established a strong and faithful client base. She hopes that with a $325 loan she can expand her business during holiday seasons and accumulate enough savings to maintain an artisan store year-round selling both festival crafts and handmade jewelry.

loans.use: Maintain an artisan store year-round

loans.name: Fazil

texts.ru:
Fazil M. was born in 1968 in Aksu. He is married and has 2 children. For more than 10 years, he has been running a pharmacy. In 2006, he Fazil M. took $500 credit. Now, he needs another loan to purchase inventory. Fazil’s father died a long time ago. Fazil lives with his family and his mother.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Меликов Фазил родилься 1968 году в городе Аксу.Женат, имеет двоих детей. Уже больше 10-ти лет занимаеться торговли лекарством.2006 году взял вкредит 500$.Теперь ему нужен кредит чтобы купить необходимые лекарство .Отец давно умер.Он живет с семьёй и с матерью.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sueli

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Sueli is a homemaker with two children, who nowadays need more funding. Ni Nengah Sueli's husband is Ketut Suela, a farmer. In addition to being a homemaker, Ni Nengah Sueli sells crops. She uses the loan from Dinari to add to her working capital. Every day Ni Nengah Sueli travels to purchase goods such as bananas, cacao, banana leafs and coconut leafs. She leaves home at 5AM to start selling in Negara market. Before getting loan from Dinari, her profit was about 30,000-50,000 IDR per day. After getting the loan she could earn 50,000-70,000 IDR (1USD~9,000 IDR). Ni Nengah Sueli is very happy with her job. With her increased profit Ni Nengah Sueli can pay for her children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalam keseharian Ni Nengah Sueli adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga dengan 2 anaknya yang sekarang membutuhkan biaya yang cukup besar. Suami Ni Nengah Sueli bernama Ketut Suela, dengan mata pencaharian sebagai petani. Disamping sebagai ibu rumah tangga Ni Nengah Sueli memiliki usaha sebagai pedagang hasil bumi. Dengan modal pinjaman yang di dapat dari Dinari, dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usahanya. Setiap hari Ni Nengah Sueli keliling membeli dagangan seperti pisang, kakao, daun pisang dan janur. Pagi hari, jam 5, Ni Nengah Sueli sudah berangkat ke pasar Negara untuk berjualan. Sebelum mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari, keuntungan yang diperoleh per hari Rp. 30.000.- sd Rp. 50.000,-. Tetapi setelah mendapat pinjaman, keuntungan yang diperoleh perhari Rp. 50.000,- sd Rp. 70.000,-. Ni Nengah Sueli senang dengan pekerjaannya ini dengan keuntungan yang semakin meningkat Ni Nengah Sueli bisa membiayai pendidikan ke dua anaknya .

loans.use: To add working capital by buying more goods.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora I. lives in Khujand; she is married and has 2 children. She works in the Joint-Stock company “Navbakhor" in the commercial industry of making ladies' jackets. She has been one of the active clients of MicroInvest from 2005. Her business is stable. She is very experienced in making ladies' jackets. Now she requires the loan to improve the needle (sewing) department's variety and staffing. That gives her additional opportunities for the ladies' jacket-making.

loans.use: To imporve the needle (sewing) department

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en: Shakir B. is 43-year-old man who raises livestock in the southern region Bilasuvar. He sells calves for meat production and keeps one cow for dairy products. He is married and has two children. He lives in an IDP settlement and does not have a job. He would like to expand his business and  purchase two more milk cows for $600 each. Shakir is requesting a loan of $1200 to improve his dairy product business.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Isabel Novo Mariamo

texts.pt:
Isabel Novo Mariamo M. was born in 1940 and was raised by her parents. She didn't study beyond third grade due to her early marriage. She is a widow and mother of eight children. Since her childhood, she has dedicated herself to subsistence farming. With the death of her husband in 2002, she saw she would also have to pursue a small business. She started with a little stall in front of her home, and later in the Josina Machel market at milepost 16, without giving up her stall at home.

She learned about Hluvuku through an employee in 2006. She approached them and solicited her first loan the same year, to grow her business. Her business has hit a good stride, despite having paused for more than a month recently after the death of her daughter, a victim of a longterm illness.

With the profits of her business, she supports her family dependents, school fees of her five grandchildren, as well as the health of the whole family. With the loan of 11000 meticais, she intends to acquire more merchandise so as to avoid being out of stock.

Her business has a major impact on the community, as it places basic necessities closer to residents of Chinonanquila, as well as provides employment to herself as a widow, and to one of her grandchildren, who runs the stall at home.

Her plan is to buy the booth at the market at milepost 16 and reconstruct it with conventional material.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Localizaçao: Mercado Josina Machel km 16, Boane.

Nome: Isabel Novo Mariamo M.

Actividade: comercio

Montante: 11.000.00mt

Aplicação: compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade

Inicio: 28-01-08

Fim: 22-05-09

Isabel Novo Mariamo M., nasceu em 1940, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos pais, não estudou para alem da 3ª classe devido ao casamento precoce, viúva, e mãe de 8 filhos. Desde a sua juventude dedicou-se a agricultura de subsistência.Com a morte do seu marido em2002 viu-se obrigada a dedicar-se também a pequenos negócios, começou por uma pequena banca em frente a sua residencia e mais tarde no mercado Josina Machel no km16 sem com isso ter abandonado a banca de casa.

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma funcionaria da mesma instituição em 2006, aproximou-se e solicitou o seu 1º credito no mesmo ano para a ampliação do seu negocio. O seu negocio esta num bom ritmo, pese o facto de ter tido uma pausa de mais de um mês apos a morte da sua filha vitima de doença prolongada, recentemente.

Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares, as despesas escolares dos seus 5 netos, assim como as de saúde de toda a familia. Com o empréstimo de 11.000.00MT pretende adquirir mais mercadoria de forma a evitar ruptura de stock.

A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade, pois põe o produto de 1ª necessidade mais próximo dos residentes de Chinonanquila para alem de proporcionar emprego, a ela que e viúva, e, a um dos seus netos que cuida da banca de casa.

A sua perspectiva e comprar a banca do mercado km16 ao município e reconstruí-la com material convencional.

loans.use: To buy stock to improve the business

loans.name: Twahiba

texts.en:
Twahiba is a 40 year old and is single woman with 3 children, ages 18,15 and 7 years old. Twahiba is a cloth seller. She started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 5am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Twahiba has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Eliza's Hekima Group

texts.en:
Eliza is 48 years old and is a married woman with eight children, ages 12-23. Eliza owns a small store, which she started in 1998. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $45 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwaisha and Zainabu, who have store businesses as well.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.es:
Daniela, Sonia and Elsa are members of the community bank Ccatun Sacha, which means “Big Tree” in Quechua.

Daniela is 25 years old, is married and has 2 children. She travels two times a week to the different markets of the region where she buys grains. Daniela sells them later in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. With her loan, she will buy two cell-phones in order to offer phone calls.

Sonia is 27 years old, is married and has 2 children. She sells groceries and fruits in a small market close to her home.

Elsa is 37 years old, has a partner but no children. She buys animals in the different markets of the region and sells their meat to butcher’s shops. In addition, Elsa breeds goats.

Daniela, Sonia and Elsa request loans of 1000, 600 and 1000 soles. They will use the money to buy cell-phones, rice, soap, eggs and goats.

The dreams of Daniela, Sonia and Elsa are to have a big shop, some own capital, to improve their housing and to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Daniela, Sonia y Elsa son socias del Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha que significa “Árbol Grande” en quechua.

Daniela es casada, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Daniela viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 2 veces por semana donde compra cereales, que posteriormente vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Daniela con el préstamo que obtendrá comprará dos equipos celulares para brindar servicios de llamadas telefónicas.

Por otro lado Sonia es casada, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Sonia vende abarrotes en un mercadillo cercano a su casa, además vende frutas.

Mientras que Elsa es conviviente, tiene 37 años y aun no tiene hijos, Elsa vende carne, los animales los adquiere en las diferentes ferias de la región y luego lo beneficia, la carne lo vende al por mayor a las carnicerías. Además Elsa se dedica a la crianza de ganado caprino.

Daniela, Sonia y Elsa necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de equipos celulares, arroz, azúcar, jabón, huevo y ganado caprino.

Los sueños de Daniela, Sonia y Elsa son tener una tienda grande, capital propio, mejorar su casa y comprar un carro.

loans.use: Daniela, Sonia and Elsa request loans of 1000, 600 and 1000 soles. They will use the money to buy cell-phones, rice, soap, eggs and goats.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
Maria Lecrecia is 40 years old. Seven years ago, she started selling different products such as clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She sells these items on credit as well as for cash by going door-to-door. She also sells out of her home. She started the business with clothing, however, gradually she increased her product variety. Maria Lucrecia lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She is married and has one 11-year-old child. Her husband is a carpenter and together they bear the responsibility of getting their family ahead. The plans that she has for her family are to improve their housing conditions. She needs a loan in order to increase her sales volume and generate more income which will allow her to improve her home in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria Lucrecia tiene 40 años de edad, desde hace 7 años se dedica a la comercialización de diversos productos como lo son ropa, zapatos, cosméticos. Los cuales los vende al crédito y también al contado, de forma ambulante y también otra parte la tiene en su casa de habitación. El negocio lo inició con la venta de ropa, pero poco a poco fue incrementando la variedad de productos que oferta. Doña Maria Lucrecia habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada y tiene un hijo de 11 años. Su esposo es carpintero y juntos llevan la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a su familia. Los planes que ella tiene para su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. El préstamo lo requiere para incrementar el volumen de sus ventas y así generar más ganacias, que le permitan en un fufturo crecano poder mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tania Isabel

texts.en:
Tania is 36 years old and single. She belongs to the Tulipanes Village Bank and earns income running her own store from her home. At the store, Tania sells icecream, clothes, jewelry, cosmetics, groceries, and various gifts. She also rents out costumes and dolls, and is gradually expanding her business even further.

Tania currently needs a loan to buy pants, poloshirts and glasses for sale.

In the future, she hopes to be able to offer a greater variety of produtcs in her shop and thus improve her financial stability.

loans.use: Purchase of pants, poloshirts, and glasses for sale

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mr. Saret P., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Sarith Pho, who  live in a small village off of National Road Two about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 2003 and have one son. The couple lives with Sarith's mother.

Mr. Saret has been a construction worker for two years. Now he wants to create another business driving a motor taxi (Tok Tok). His wife sells small trees and flowers at her shop in the village. Currently, she is learning to weave silk for creating another business as well.

Saret is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a trailer for driving Tok Tok. He hopes that this new business will provide a good income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for driving motor taxi (Tok Tok)

loans.name: Trading And Raising Livestock Group

texts.vi:
chị Nguyễn thị Lan Ms 09020024 năm nay 30 tuổi,chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con. chị là một phụ nữ rất năng động, hàng ngày chị đi chợ thu mua sắt vụn,ngoài ra chị lại chăn nuôi, làm ruộng, bán hàng tạp hoá tại nhà. Còn chồng chị là một nhân viên quản lý chợ, nên thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định từ 200.000 VND đến 250.000 VND / ngày. Chị cùng nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt. Lần này chị tiếp tục đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000 VND để thêm vốn bán hàng, đi chợ và chăn nuôi. Các thành viên trong nhóm của chị :

  • chị Ngô thị Sinh Ms 09020026 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua phụ tùng sửa chữa xe máy
  • chị Lê thị Khánh Ms 09020023 vay mức 2.912.000 VND để mua thóc làm bánh bán
  • chị Nguyễn thị Mận Ms 09020021 vay mức 4.704.000 VND để đi chợ bán hàng khô, mua cám lợn
  • chị D. thị Tú Ms 09020022 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua lợn giống, đi chợ
  • chị Ngô thi Y Ms 09020025 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ bán bánh đa, bán mỳ
texts.en:
Mrs. Lan thi Nguyen, 30 years old, lives with her husband and two children. She is a very proactive and hardworking woman; each day she goes to the market to trade scrap iron, and she also raise livestock, works the fields, and sells general goods out of her home. Her husband is a manager of the market, so the family's income is relatively stable at 200,000 VND to 250,000 VND per day. She and the group has participated in the Fund for a previous funding cycle and very good with making the repayments. In this round of funding she is continuing to request 4,256,000 VND to buy more goods to sell, trade at the market, and raise livestock. The participants in her group are:

  • Mrs. Sinh Thi Ngo, requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy repair equipment for motorscooters.
  • Mrs. Khanh Thi Le, requesting 2,912,000 VND to buy unpeeled rice to process and sell.
  • Mrs. Man Thi Nguyen, requesting 4,704,000 VND to do trading in dry goods and buy pig feed.
  • Mrs. Tu Thi Duong, requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy a breeding pig, and to do trading at the market.
  • Mrs. Y Thi Ngo, requesting 4,256,000 VND to do retail sales of sesame rice crackers and bread.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods and raise livestock

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy Osariemen sells kerosene and yams. She started with the yam business before starting the kerosene business. She has been in this business for a long time.

Christy is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more yams and kerosene for re-sale. This, she says, will enhance her profit capacity and also enable her to meet the demands of her numerous customers. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene and yams for sale

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: La señora Marcela, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, se dedica día a día desde muy temprano en la mañana a la venta de frutas y verduras en un mercado muy popular de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia. Esta casada, su marido es chofer de transporte público, y entre ambos llevan el sustento diario al hogar, son muy sacrificados y trabajan con mucho esfuerzo para mantener a su pequeño hijo que está en edad escolar. La casa donde vive la familia es muy pobre y humilde.
texts.en:
Señora Marcela is a very humble and hardworking woman. She works from day to day from very early in the morning selling fruits and vegetables in a popular market in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She is married. Her husband is a driver of public transportation, and between them they are able to manage the daily sustenance of the household. They are very sacrificing and they work very hard in order to maintain their small son who is of school age. The house where the family lives is very poor and humble.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 2 añitos,  quien es su inspiración para salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional,  en sus distintas variedades (perfumes, talcos, cremas y otros), estos productos los lleva a vender por las diferentes zonas de Pucallpa, los deja al contado o al crédito, trabaja solo por horas, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce mucha gente con la cual socializa y también conoce muchos lugares. Su trabajo le genera buenos ingresos y le va muy bien.  Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, donde se mantuvo puntual en sus cuotas. Ahora quiere comprar más productos de belleza, además de una vitrina para tenerlos más seguros y mejor exhibidos.
texts.en:
Maria is 23 years old and she lives with her husband and their little 2 year old son, who is her inspiration to move on. She sells a line of very nationally well-known beauty products from catalogs in all their varieties (perfumes, talks, cremes, and other things). She brings these products to the different zones of Pucallpa where she sells them on credit or with an I.O.U. She works alone for hours, and she has been doing this for 2 years. What she likes about her work is that she gets to know a lot of the people and the places that she goes to. Her work is quite profitable and she is doing well. This is her second loan through MFP where she has been punctual with her repayments. She now wants to buy more beauty products as well as a display cabinet so that they will be more secure and better shown off.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display case for her beauty products/Compra de una vitrina para sus productos de belleza

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah O. is the wife and mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a 42-year-old trader who trades in charcoal. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. Through this business, she has supported her first child to complete senior high school. Hannah obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Koforidua and retails them to her customers. Her starting capital provided by her husband is not adequate to purchase the large quantities to meet customers’ demands. Her sales and profit margin have ultimately been small. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of charcoal to increase her inventory. She believes the loan would enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children. Hannah is a member of the community group called God is King Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days, and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido P. runs his own poultry business. He is 60 years old and has six children. His wife is managing a small store to contribute to the family income. All of his children are already married.

Poultry farming is a dirty but a noble work. Everyday he takes good care of his chickens. He requested a loan from CEVI to purchase feed for his farm animals. Through this loan, he believes he will have a better income and be able to employ additional workers to help support his married children. In this way he can provide jobs to other people so they can also earn a living.

“Our life is just too short, we need to invest it well,” he said. “I’m happy now because I see my grandsons. I want to give my grandchildren a good future by helping my children established their own families,” he added.

CEVI is an organization that helps people realize their dreams. Through the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI provides, people like Bienvenido start to build the future for their love ones.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Graciela es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Graciela tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, útiles escolares, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Graciela junto a su esposo tiene un taller de carpintería.
Graciela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.
Los sueños de Graciela son tener una ferretería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Obreras Village Bank. She is 40-years-old, and married with 2 children. She has a store in her house, where she sells groceries, fruits, and school supplies on a daily basis. In addition, she and her husband have a carpentry workshop. Graciela needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of wood. Her dreams include having a hardware store, and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Maria vende quesos que adquiere en la comunidad de Sachabamba que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas los realiza por mayor en los mercados. Además compra animales que vende vivo en el camal de la ciudad.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Maria sueña con que su negocio prospere y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Llapanchik (which means "Everyone" in the Quechua language) Village Bank. She is 26 and has a common-law husband, and two children. She gets cheeses from Sachabamba, which is 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho, and sells them wholesale in the markets. She also buys live animals that she sells to the city slaughterhouse. Maria needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll invest in buying cheeses. She dreams of having a prosperous business and seeing that her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheeses

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en: Perpetual N. is married and has two children. Her husband works as a commercial driver, while Perpetual operates her own vending service. She sells a variety of threads, lining, and other sewing materials at her own business, which she has owned since 2005. Perpetual is requesting a loan in order to meet the increased demand from her customers. She plans to reinvest her profits in order to expand her business and maximize her outreach to potential clientele.

loans.use: To meet increased demand from customers

loans.name: Gertrudez

texts.en:
Mrs. Gertrudes D., 31 years old, is married and lives at Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She has 2 children and raised them alone as her husband never returned home for years now. Because she could not get a good job, she decided to open food vending business.

With the family's financial difficulties, Mrs. D. joined Paglaum MPC to avail herself of financial assistance, but she was also happy knowing that she will also be able to save part of her income and obtain other benefits offered by the Cooperative. Now, she requests PHP 3,000 to purchase additional inventories. Her greatest desire is to see her children finish their studies and live a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen J. sells dresses and beer at home and is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine for her business.  Thirty-two years old and married to a businessman,  Hellen has two children who attend Juba Day Secondary School.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to establish a supermarket at Konyokonya market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mrs. Ouch K., 32, is a farmer. She also sells a few grocery items. She earns around $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Sang Soeurm, farms rice with her. K. buys grocery inventory from the town market and transports everything by bicycle to sell around her village. In order to make more profit, she is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner, HKL, to be used to purchase more inventory to sell. She plans to use half of the loan to buy a cow to plow the farmland and rent out to other farmers. This will provide a more stable income to cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia es una madre de familia muy amorosa, tiene 29 años y vive en la casa de su esposo Carlos, de 30 años, tienen una pequeña hija de 2 años, Marilyn, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo al que Claudia se dedica es la impresión gráfica, su local está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, por lo cual, es muy concurrido por sus cliente. Trabaja a pedido, y entre las solicitudes más comunes que tiene están los calendarios, recordatorios de celebraciones familiares, volantes, afiches, etc. Ya son 5 años los que viene realizando en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su negocio es diseñar los trabajos para luego verlos impresos, pero lo más difícil es tener que soportar los fuertes olores que sueltan algunos químicos que usa en su imprenta, aun así sabe que tiene que realizar un buen trabajo, ya que es la actividad que escogió. Para más adelante desea tener una imprenta mucho más grande, y así poder brindarle una mejor vida a su familia. Este es el primer préstamo de Claudia con MFP, se siente muy segura de poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y participativa. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará materiales nuevos para mejorar la calidad de sus impresiones.
texts.en:
Claudia is the mother of a very loving family. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband, 30-year-old Carlos, and their young daughter, two-year-old Marilyn, who is her motivation. Claudia's business is graphic printing. Her shop is located in the center of the city, so it is very busy with customers. She works by order, and among her most popular orders are calendars, reminders for family events, flyers, posters, etc. She has now been doing this work for five years, and what she likes best is designing the work and then seeing them printed. The hardest part is having to stand the strong odors of the chemicals she uses to print, but she knows that she must do a good job, and this is the work she chose. In the future, she would like to have a much larger printing office, and thus be able to provide a better life for her family. This is Claudia's first loan with MFP. She is very confident that she will be able to make her payments on time. She is a very happy and participative member in her communal bank. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will buy new materials to improve the quality of her printing.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for printing

loans.name: Mavdjuda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.
Мавджуда-женщина 48  лет.Вдова имеет 3-х детей.Имеет среднее образование.Занимается продажей парфюмерии и хозяйственным товаром.Так как его муж умер, она растит 3-х детей в одиночку и конечно же ей очень трудно. Мавджуда закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Мавджуда хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Мавджуде помогает старший сын Толиб.
texts.en:
Mavdjuda is 48 years old. She is a widow and has 3 children. She has a secondary education. Mavdjuda sells perfumes and household products. Because her husband passed away, she has to raise her children by herself, which is, of course, very hard. Mavdjuda buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Mavdjuda wants to expand her merchandise assortment because good variety attracts more customers. Mavdjuda’s oldest son, Tolib, helps her with the business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand merchandise assortment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more eggs in bulk for her business

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is forty years old. He is married and has five children, all of whom are all still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Mohammed is a trader. He deals in livestock, such as goats, sheep and cattle. He supplies meat to the chop bar (cafe) and restaurant operators in his community. He gets the animals all the way from Northern Ghana. Mohammed has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to buy livestock in bulk to increase his stock. He aspires to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Gunjinlham

texts.en:
Gunjinlkham B. is a 33 year old shoe repairer living with her husband and three sons in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. The oldest two sons currently attend secondary school and the youngest is in kindergarten. Gunjinlkham started the shoe repair business with her father in 1998 with an investment of 20 USD. Through years of profits and savings, she now has an available working capital of nearly 1,000 USD.

Since the business is her main source of income, her biggest priority is providing shoe repair of the highest quality. As she currently rents her workplace, her main goal in the future is to own her own workplace. This will protect her from sudden price increases in rent. She is requesting a loan to be used for purchasing shoe repair materials.

loans.use: For purchasing shoe repair materials.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines es una mujer emprendedora de 54 años. Tiene 4 hijos todos independientes . 
Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo ,el es comerciante  pues se dedica a la venta de materiales de pesca. Ella es socia hace dos años del Banco Comunal  “Virgen de la Natividad “. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles.

Con este préstamo de 2,000 soles, ella piensa invertirlo comprando más golosinas y bebidas.

La meta de Ines es  ampliar su negocio de golosinas y dedicarse a la venta al por mayor de bebidas como gaseosas y nectar.

loans.use: compra de golosinas y gaseosas

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 27 years old. She is married and the mother of a child who is breastfeeding. Victoria owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc., in the area where she lives. 

She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. With her two years of trading experience and with Christmas approaching, she needs more capital to buy goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more to complete the project she is embarking upon. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Romelia

texts.en: Romelia A. S. started a committee of women in 2006. She lives in an apartment 4 km away from the east city. She is the mother of 10 children, but only 2 are dependent on her. She operates a foundation with Isabel Vallareo, her neighbor and hard worker. She also has a small pantry shop. With her loan she wants to buy merchandise for her grocery shop.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from the village of Cabanglasan Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Edna is married and has six children who attend school. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Edna has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim P., 30, is married with two young children living at home in the Takeo province.

Tim raises pigs and grows rice, typically making US $2 each day. Her husband, Chorn Chhan, typically makes about US $5 each day as a recycler.

Tim would like a loan of US $450 for a new investment. She will use this loan to purchase a sugar cane cart.

loans.use: To buy a cart to sell sugar cane juice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair products, shampoo and other materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es: María Cristina A. de 45 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Cuscatlán, junto a su hijo y una hermana. Ella posee una venta de ropa para niños y niñas, cada día María sale a las calles a ofrecer su producto, en muchas ocasiones visitas a clientes en sus propios hogares, en otras ocasiones grita por las calles ofreciendo la ropa. María es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual refleja el deseo por seguir adelante, es por esto que solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más ropa e incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
María Cristina is 45 years old and lives in the Department of Cuscatlán with her son and a sister.

She has a business selling clothes for boys and girls. Each day María heads for the streets to offer her products. She often visits customers in their own homes; on other occasions she walks the streets calling out her offer of clothes for sale.

María is a very hard-working woman, reflected in her desire to forge ahead. For this reason, she is soliciting a loan to buy more clothes and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHES TO SELL

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en: Anatalia A. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Anatalia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Anatalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Anatalia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Salman Group

texts.en:
This is Salman Group. This group has four members: Nasima, Yasamen, Azatullah and Shukrullah. They all keep busy in different businesses and they have requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani. Nasima, who is the group leader, is married and has five children - two sons and three daughters. She runs a quilt making business and she wants to buy cloth and thread to make more quilts. This is the only business through which she supports her children and husband. Yasamen is a tailor. Since the Taliban regime she has sewed clothes because at that time they had lots of economic problems. Now by the Kiva loan she wants to buy a new sewing machine and wants to start her business anew to support her husband and children. Azatullah has a public bath, and he wants to buy the necessary equipment for his public bath. Shukrullah has a retail shop, and he wants to buy the essential materials which are demanded in the market, to attract more customers. With the income from his shop he supports his family members and his reason for requesting a loan is to expand his business.
They would like to say many thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy quilt making materials.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr: Ramatoulaye D. est une femme de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois WALIDANE depuis 5 ans et a eu 10 expériences avec le crédit. Elle vend des tissus teintés. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de contribuer aux différentes charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ramatoulaye D. is a 39-year-old woman who is married and the mother of three.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de WALIDANE for five years and had ten experiences with loans.  Ramatoulaye sells dyed cloth.  Her goal is to bolster her savings and to help cover various family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and developing her commercial work

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer O. is a 56-year-old businesswoman who lives in Kwirare Busia District. Since 2006 she has had a business selling fish and groceries. She buys her stock once a week in the nearby Miyanga market but sometimes travels as far away as Malaba for stock.

She is married and a mother of three children. She plans to use her loan of 20000 KES to expand her business by increasing her stock of fish and groceries.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Willy (39), que es comerciante, y de sus 3 hijos; Angelie (13), Kimberly (10) y Cristian (8).

Cuando sus hijos crecieron quiso empezar trabajar apara apoyar a su esposo en los múltiples gastos del hogar, pensó en una bodega, pero se dio cuenta que había mucha competencia en la zona. Es así que su madre le dio la idea de instalar un pequeño restaurante y le dijo que ella podría ayudarla en la cocina y desde hace 4 años empezó en este negocio, donde le ha ido muy bien, ya que ambas tienen muy buena sazón y se han hecho de múltiples fieles clientes.
A Mariela le gusta mucho cocinar y a parte de su madre tiene una ayudante para la atención, que es de lunes a domingo; desde muy temprano ofrece desayunos, en la tarde almuerzos y por la noche termina el día con la cena. Siendo una mujer muy trabajadora, para el futuro está pensando ampliar su negocio para atender a mayor número de comensales.

Este es el 5to préstamo que tiene con MFP y agradece a todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito para seguir con su negocio. Con el dinero que ahora solicita tiene pensado comprar gaseosas para ofrecer en su negocio, además de ollas nuevas, ya que las que tiene están deterioradas.
texts.en:
Mariela is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her husband Willy (age 39), who is a merchant, and their three children; Angelie (age 13), Kimberly (age 10), and Christian (age 8).

As her children grew up she began to want to start working in order to help her husband with the many household expenses. She thought about a small store, but realized there would be too much competition in the area. Then her mother gave her the idea of starting a small restaurant and offered to help her in the kitchen. Now its been four years since she started this business which is going very well and both of them enjoy. They have acquired many loyal customers.

Mariela enjoys cooking very much and in addition to her mother she has another woman who helps with the restaurant. The restaurant is open seven days a work; starting very early in the morning they serve breakfast, in the afternoon, lunch, and at night they finish the evening serving dinner. Being a very hard working woman, in the future Mariela would like to expand her business to accommodate a larger number of diners.

This will be her fifth loan with MFP and she is grateful to all of the people who have made it possible for her to receive loans to continue her business. With the money from this loan she will buy sodas to offer at her business and new pots to cook with since hers have deteriorated.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying beverages and new pots for her restaurant

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Oñondivepa” tiene antigüedad de 1 año de formación y trabajó con la Fundación  Paraguaya durante este periodo. El comité se encuentra conformada por mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras de un barrio muy humilde de la ciudad, pero todas tienen la esperanza de seguir trabajando y sacar a sus familias de la mejor manera posible.
Recurrieron al préstamo para seguir mejorando la actividad que cada una realiza de manera independiente.
La señora Jorgelina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general y también vende en horas de la mañana algunos alimentos como empanadas, sandwiches, croquetas y otros. Su negocio forma es la principal fuente de ingreso ya que su marido no tiene trabajo constante y es jornalero.
Doña Jorgelina comenta que toda la familia ayuda para el mantenimiento del negocio, y esta muy contenta por que con  crédito de la Fundación puede ir cargando mercaderías y mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Oñondivepa" Committee just had its one year anniversary and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya during this period. The Committee is comprised of determined hardworking women who live in a modest neighborhood of the city. They all hope to continue working and succeeding for their families in the best way possible. They have resorted to loans in order to continue improving each of their businesses which they manage independently.

Sra. Jorgelina is one of the Committee members. She sells mainly beverages, but in the mornings, she also sells food such as empanadas, sandwiches, croquettes, and other items. Her business is her main source of income since her husband does not have steady work as a laborer. Doña Jorgelina says her entire family helps manage the business and she is very happy with the loan from Fundación Paraguaya because she will be able to buy merchandise and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages such as sodas, wine, and liquor

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a 26 year old single man. He runs a general merchandise shop where he sells sugar, soaps, cooking fat, and maize flour to earn a living. He is also employed on a farm.  He works very hard to be able to meet his expenses and to be able to take care of his aged parents. He hopes to expand his business and improve his living standards in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.use: Inventory for general store

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. has been educated through junior high school. She is married and lives with her five dependents. Her husband is a farmer and Hawa helps him in the general welfare of the home.

Hawa sells a variety of soaps by moving from house to house in and around the vicinity of Jukwa. She will use the loan to purchase more soaps and soap powder (which is going to serve as an additional trade) to sell.

With the new profits from her extended business, Hawa plans to save to buy a shop that she can sell from.

loans.use: To purchase more soaps and soap powder to sell

loans.name: Espiritu Emprendedor Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo  se ecuentra integrada por 16 mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras con muchos deseos de trabajar y así mejorar su estilo de vida.
Ellas  son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, tienen almacén, copetín, tienen huertas y comercializan sus propios productos. Venden articulos de limpieza, mercería, venden carbon, mandioca, Venta de Producto Avón,etc. 
La Sra. Cristina F. se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal y de la vivienda, ya sean cosméticos, utencilios de cocina, perfumes, útiles escolares, pequeñas herramientas de mano etc.
Todo esto actuando de representante de una empresa comercial distribuidora.
Ella tiene una gran clientela ya formada y teniendo en cuenta la demanda de productos desea incrementar sus ingresos ampliando el estock de los productos que posee para su comercialización.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 16 hard-working and enterprising women. They are eager to work and improve their quality of life. They are independently occupied and work selling clothing, food and beverages or running stores, working market gardens and promoting their own products. They sell cleaning supplies, hardware, coal, cassava plants, Avon products etc. Mrs. Cristina F. sells personal products such as cosmetics, kitchen gadgets, perfumes, school supplies, small hand tools etc. from her home. She works as a representative for a commercial distributing business. She has already secured a large customer base and has a great demand for her products. She would like to grow her earnings by increasing the stock of products that she has to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nail polish, nail polish remover, nail clippers, cotton, nail files, pumice stones, Avon products etc.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Nụ Nguyễn Thị (20203050077) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Nụ is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 3 - Nhóm 14 (14).


Nụ is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Nụ owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business, making and selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  Nụ has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $265 a month from these activities.


In 2009, Nụ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nụ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND which again will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  This will be her 2nd loan from SEDA.  Nụ plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị L. (0) is a 19-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


2.  Trương Thị T. (0) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


3.  Trương Thị S. (0) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


5.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


6.  Nguyễn Thị Y. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nụ Nguyễn Thị (20203050077) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Nụ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 3 - Nhóm 14 (14).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nụ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nụ kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Nụ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nụ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trương Thị L. (0) là 19 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Trương Thị T. (0) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  Trương Thị S. (0) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


6.  Nguyễn Thị Y. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Elsa's Group

texts.en:
Elsa Torre, from the village of Sinian Baliangao Misamis Occidental, is the 49-year-old leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Shine.

Elsa, who is married and has two adult-aged children, owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as sugar, rice, salt, canned goods, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
