Mariama I. prepares millet porridge and sells by moving from one house to another in and around Abura. She also sells salted fish under a shade in front of her house.

Mariama has received senior high education and is married to a security man. She has two children. She supports her husband in providing the basic needs of the family.

Mariama’s loan will be used to buy more millet for her porridge and more salted fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy more millet for her porridge and more salted fish to sell

loans.name: God Will Provide Group

texts.en:
Rev. Mois T. (pictured right) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Rev. Mois was born in Matru Jong, a town in southern Sierra Leone. He is sixty-eight years of  age.  He is married to a teacher and the couple has three children. For over eight years now, Rev. Mois has been selling stationery and office equipment. 

This is first loan that Rev. Mois and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Rev. Mois will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand his business; he will buy A4-size paper, stamp pads, books, etc. to add to his shop inventory.

loans.use: Buy A4-size paper, stamp pads, books, etc. for resale

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 31 años de edad, es viuda, vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Al quedarse sola, tuvo que luchar para poder mantener sola a sus hijos. Desde entonces se ha dedicado a varias actividades y gracias a su arduo esfuerzo pudo instalar una bodega, situada en el interior de su casa. Es así que su negocio esta Implementado de varios productos así como productos perecibles entre carnes y verduras.  Por otro lado, con los ahorros que logró pudo comprarse una moto, el cual lo alquila y otras veces su hijo mayor lo utiliza para trabajar ofreciendo servicio de transporte público, y del frecuente uso la moto ha presentado algunos desperfecto.  Es por ello que Delia esta solicitando un nuevo crédito, para poder llevar su moto al mecánico y lo deje óptima para seguir trabajando en ella. Ella asegura que el arrendarla es muy perjudicial ya que las personas ajenas no la cuidan como es debido, ahora espera sacar adelante a su familia con los ingresos que recibirá del servicio de transporte que realiza su hijo. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y afirma que todos los préstamos que ha recibido la han ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Con el crédito que solicita, enviará al mecánico su moto.
texts.en:
Delia, 31, is a widow. She lives with her two children in a house that she owns. When her husband died, she had to struggle alone to support her two children. Since then, she has worked at various jobs and, thanks to her hard work, managed to set up a small general store, a business that she operates in her house. She sells a variety of perishable products such as meat and vegetables. Separately, she used some savings to buy a motocab that she has rented out and that her oldest son uses for a taxi business. The motocab has been used so much that it is now in need of repairs. It's for that purpose that Delia is applying for a loan. She wants a mechanic to repair the motocab so that she can continue to use it. She says that renting the motocab has been a difficult business because renters don't take good care of it. She now hopes to help her family with income from her son's taxi service. This is Delia's third MFP loan and she says that past loans have helped her to improve both her quality of life and that of her family. She will use the loan to repair her motocab.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motocab for taxi business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Monsieur Adama M. est un jeune couturier qui exerce son métier dans le quartier de Diamaguene depuis prés de 8ans .Ainsi,pour diversifier ses activités le sieur M. sollicite un prêt pour complement achat d'un taxi clando dont il juge l'activité rentable pouvant générer des bénéfices ce qui lui permettrait de faire face à ses besoins quotidiens et à la survie de sa famille
texts.en:
Mr. Adama M. is a young tailor who has been practicing his trade in the Diamaguene district for almost eight years. In order to diversify his business activities, Mr. M. is seeking a loan towards the purchase of an unregistered taxi, which he sees as a profitable activity that will help him increase his revenues. This will allow him to provide for the everyday needs of himself and his family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be used towards the purchase of a taxi

loans.name: Mrs. Thoeurn Prum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeurn P., village bank president and 58 years old, was selected by sixteen people who live in ThU. village in Takeo province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their current businesses. 

Mrs. Thoeurn P. and her husband, Mr. Chorn Nus, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. Although both of them try to work hard in their field, they can earn very little income to support their family. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Thoeurn P. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets to raise to start a new business. With any remainder of the loan she will buy a bicycle and fertilizer. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while one is studying at the local school, and the other is helping her to do farming.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding and possibly a bicycle and fertilizer

loans.name: Shirley Maria

texts.es: Shirley S. en Los Calamares, un barrio de la ciudad de Cartagena, vende conservas a base de leche, negocio que inició en compañía de su padre, cuando comercializaba pequeñas cantidades que ofrecía de tienda en tienda y en otros negocios; así logró la aceptación de la comunidad  y concretar muchos clientes, hasta convertirse en proveedores de grandes negocios en la ciudad de Cartagena y también en Turbaco, pueblo muy cerca a esta ciudad;  este negocio ha sido importante para su vida y la de su familia, porque de él se ha derivado el sustento de ella;  por eso sus esfuerzos están dirigidos a que su negocio crezca, se fortalezca y se formalice para algún día poder exportar este producto que es el gran sueño de su vida. Shirley cuenta que aunque el mercado de los dulces en Cartagena es bastante competido,  la calidad reflejada en la higiene, la pureza de sus ingredientes hace que su negocio sea una microempresa sostenible. Este es el primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y  lo requiere porque va a comprar en mayor volumen los ingredientes que utiliza para su elaboración, como leche y azúcar, porque ella sabe que como mujer joven, si ella persiste en cumplir sus metas, finalmente conseguirá en un futuro que sus conservas sean apetecidas en muchas partes del mundo.
texts.en:
Shirley S. sells milk-based sweets in Cartagena’s Los Calamares neighborhood. She started the business with her father selling small amounts from store to store and to other businesses. Thus she gained acceptance in the community and acquired many customers until she became a supplier to large businesses in Cartagena and Turbaco, a nearby city. This business has been important for her and her family’s lives because from it they have supported themselves. Her efforts, therefore, are directed towards its growth so that it will strengthen and formalize so that one day the product may be exported; this is the big dream she has. Shirley tells us that even though the sweets business in Cartagena is quite competitive the quality that’s reflected in the sanitation standards and the purity of her ingredients make her firm a sustainable micro business. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she needs it to buy a larger amount of ingredients that she uses to elaborate the product, like milk and sugar, because she knows that as a young woman, if she persists in meeting her goals, in the end she will secure a future in which her sweets are savored in many parts of the world.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy larger amounts of ingredients like milk and sugar.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn C. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Ginalyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ginalyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ginalyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ginalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ginalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ginalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ndung Irene

texts.en:
Ndung Irene C. was born in1969. She is married to Nana Jean Perrie and they have four children. They live in Nacho Junction, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Irene's challenges include paying her house rent and building a house of her own. She plans to invest this loan in an off-license business and buy food stuff including cocoa yams, palm oil and other ingredients to prepare Ekwang — an African dish. She believes the business will succeed because she has long experience. She believes her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to success. The loan will help the people in her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Irene will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for rainy days. She likes GHAPE because of the training she receives and the low cost of obtaining and paying back loans.

About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, groundnut oil, beans, and wood

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es: El señor S. P. labora en la Alcaldía Municipal de Catarina, con guarda de seguridad en donde ya tiene dos años de antigüedad y con este salario logra sostener su familia ya que solo él y su esposa conviven ya que sus hijos ya son mayores y casados además que ya se fueron a vivir por su parte, el visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito y pagar unos gastos personales que posee.
texts.en: S. P. works in the Catarina Town Hall as a security guard. He has two years of experience in this job and with his salary he is able to support his family. He and his wife live alone as their children are grown up, married and went to live in other places. He visited the CEPRODEL offices to request a loan to pay for personal expenses.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert S. was born in 1978. He lives in Ijevan city with his wife and his parents. 

Robert runs his own clothing sales business in the Ijevan central market. He sells men's clothes: suits, trousers, sweaters and tracksuits. Thanks to his business income, Robert supports his family, and he says his parents help him a lot in his business. When he goes to purchase merchandise, his parents take his place at the business stall.  

Now Robert is asking for 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy outerwear to resell.

loans.use: To buy outerwear to resell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; la socia tiene 64 años de edad, ella es casada; la socia  tiene 4 hijos y ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de muebles en si ella también vende muebles hechos que fabrica su hijo que es carpintero, la socia trabaja en el barrio de Santiago; la socia tiene su tienda en este barrio y es muy conocida la gente la visita los días sábados que hay feria de muebles. La socia invertirá su crédito en la compra de materiales de carpintería. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Felicitas is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Lideres” (The Leaders), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 64 years old, married, and has four children. Felicitas buys and sells furniture but she also sells pieces made by her son who is a carpenter. She works in the neighborhood of Santiago and has a local store. Felicitas is well-known among the people who visit the furniture fair on Saturdays. She will invest this loan in the purchase of carpentry materials.

Felicitas is grateful and values the loan she was provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en: Sanita is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She operates a grocery business, selling green vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Sanita faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business and sell as a wholesaler in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario D. is a a 68-year old married woman from Cubay South Bugasong Antique. She is married to Julito D.. They have children, but their children all have families of their own and their own houses, so Rosario and Julito live alone like newlyweds these days.

Even at her age, she explains that she is still strong and very motivated to succeed with her business. She really enjoys generating money from her business. The profits she realizes from her business help to sustain her and Julito by providing for their basic needs, which normally leaves some income that they give to their grandchildren as an allowance. She fundamentally believes in not just helping her relatives but also her community. Indeed, she believes that, if she helps others, God will provide her twice as much in return -- maybe not in the form of money, but possibly with good health.

She would now like to expand her store by purchasing additional inventory so that her store can be a convenient location for her neighbors' shopping needs. To realize this plan, she is seeking to borrow 20,000 PHP ($475). Her dream is to be able to support her children by sending her grandchildren to school, though she would also like to have some savings for her and her husband's future needs.

loans.use: To expand her store and to satisfy customer demand by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Pok

texts.en: Pok K. is 22 years old and lives with her husband and young child in Takeo province. She is able to make about $5 USD profit a day, selling groceries, while her husband is a professional traditional singer, typically making $3 USD per day. Pok K. is asking for a loan of $700 USD to add to her grocery inventory.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar:
احمد في عمر 42 سنة متزوج يعمل تعهدات وديكورات المنازل له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله ويسعى دائما الى تطوير
عمله ونفسه ولكنه يلق صعوبة مادية في زيادة مدخوله وتحسين وضع عمله عمله يتميز بالدقة والقلة الموجودة في هذا المجال
يتميز هو بدقة في عمله والثقة والمجارات الموديلات الجديدة يحب ان يطولا نفسه من خلال ملاحقة كل جديد في هذا العمل
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء معدات للعمل ماكنة لحام + كمبروسيور وتكملة دفع ال بيك اب لأنه طموح ويريد
زيادة المعدات لملاحقة كل جديد في العمل
texts.en: Ahmad is 42 years old and married. He has been working for the past ten years in house contracting and interior design. He is always eager to improve himself and his business, although this is not completely easy because of his modest finances. Ahmad provides services which very few other businesses can offer. His work is distinguished by thoroughness and integrity, in addition to which he constantly keeps up with the latest industry techniques. Ahmad was interested in seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase new equipment for his business, including a welding machine and a compressor, as well as to complete the payments for his pickup truck.

loans.use: To purchase welding machine and compressor and to complete payment of pickup truck

loans.name: Sylvanos

texts.en:
Sylvanos has been practicing mixed farming for twenty years and employs two farmhands. His farm produces tomatoes, cabbages and maize which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his motorbike transport business.

He has requested a loan of 62,400Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him pay school fees for his children. In five years' time, he hopes to have increased the number of his dairy cows and increase his milk production.

Sylvanos is 53 years old and married with 8 children whose ages range between 3 and 26. Four of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 36-year-old lady. She is married to Lambertus a 40 year old mason. Susana and her husband have been blessed with 3 children, namely Marni, 16 years old who is in the first grade of Senior high school; Novi, 12 years old who is in the sixth grade of elementary school; and Marten, 9 years old in the third grade of Elementary school. Susana and her family live in Liliba village.

As a mason, Lambertus earns only a small income for the family. Therefore, Susana decided to find another way to help her husband in order to provide a better life for her family. She works selling various products. She walks from house to house offering the products. Susana has been doing this job for 5 years. Her income depends on the number of products sold. She is not quite satisfied of her current sales arrangement and tried to find a way to sell her own products rather than selling the products of others. But this is very difficult for Susana to make this come true as she needs a larger working capital.

To realize her dream, Susana is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to purchase goods to sell. She hopes that the loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 45 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de sus padres y de sus hijos que ya son jóvenes.

Recuerda como empezó en la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, desde entonces ya  han pasado 3 años. En la actualidad no solo comercializa su mercadería, si no también capta nuevas vendedoras lo que le permite obtener buenos incentivos y ganancias de la empresa para la que trabaja.  Además esta muy satisfecha pues el trabajo es muy tranquilo y lo puede realizar en la comodidad de su casa, donde ha instalado una vitrina y ahí muestra los productos que tiene en stock, entre cosméticos, perfumes y accesorios trata de colocar toda su mercadería a buen precio. Y desde hace algún tiempo una hermana le envía de la Argentina accesorios de todo tipo que han causado novedad entre sus clientes, y tiene mejores ganancias.  Además como es una dama muy emprendedora para más adelante tiene planeado surtir su otra  vitrina de productos y accesorios  pues con frecuencia sus clientes se acercan en cualquier momento a comprar, ya que necesitan para regalos ocasionales.

Luz tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en productos de belleza, pues desea surtir mejor su otra  vitrina, y de esta manera espera ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

Es el décimo  crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues  no quiere quedar mal con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Luz, 45 years old, lives in her own home, with her parents and her young children.

She began selling a well-known brand of beauty products three years ago. Now she not only sells products, but recruits new sales people, which allows her to earn incentives and increased earnings from the company she works for. She is very satisfied with her job, it is peaceful and she can work from the comfort of her own home, where she has installed a display case in which she can showcase the products she has in stock, including cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories. Her products are reasonably priced. 
Some time ago her sister sent her a variety of accessories from Argentina, which are a novelty for her customers and increase her earnings. In addition, as an enterprising woman, she is planning an additional display case for more products and accessories. Her customers visit often on the spur of the moment to purchase products, sometimes as gifts.

Luz plans to invest the money she's requested in purchasing more merchandise, to stock her other display case and hopefully to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

This is Luz's 10th loan with MFP, and she has agreed to make her repayments on time, as she does not want to look bad in front of all of the people who have made these loans to her business possible.

loans.use: Beauty products

loans.name: Ada Ruth

texts.es:
la señora  Ada Ruth H. tiene 46 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijas que dependen de ella.
Ada se dedica a la venta de refrescos en varios tamaños, agua y jugos, tiene 2 años de tener su negocio.
Ada vive en el barrio Mongollano desde hace 15 años y su eposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos, agua  y jugos. en todo momento se venden los refrescos, agua y jugos ya que esta zona es muy caliente (es la zona climatica mas caliente de Honduras) y las personas buscan este tipo de producto para refrescarse.
 
la señora Ada es popular y gentil, le gusta hacer bromas y su mayor sueño es graduar a su ultima hija de la universidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ada Ruth H. is 46 years old, married, and she has 2 daughters who depend on her. 
Ada sells soft drinks in various sizes, water and juice, and she has been in business for 2 years.  

Ada has lived in the Community of Mongollano for 15 years and her husband helps her with the household expenses. 

The loan will be used to purchased soft drinks, water and juices. Soft drinks, water and juices are always in high demand especially because the region is very hot (the climate is the hottest in Honduras) and people always look for this kind of product for refreshment.

Ada is well known and kind and she likes to tell jokes. Her greatest dream is to see her youngest daughter graduate from university.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, water, and juices

loans.name: Adjo Kafui

texts.fr: Madame Adjo fait la restauration. Ce commerce lui permet d’assurer parfaitement tous les besoins de sa famille et son enfant.   Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a débuté en 2007 ce commerce et a son hangar sur le boulevard 30 Août à côté de l’école Kouvahey. Elle reçoit tellement de demandes de ces clients, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de riz  Djino, 1 sac de riz Oncle Bomb, 3 cartons de produits congelés et 3 bidons d’huile. Elle a 31 ans et est mariée à un pasteur. Elle est résidente du quartier  Avenou.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo is in the catering business. This activity allows her to provide completely for all her family's needs and those of her child.

She gets her supplies from the Grand Market of Lomé. She started this business in 2007 and her shed is located on the August 30 Boulevard, next to the Kouvahey school. 

She receives so many orders from her customers that she is requesting a loan to buy 5 bags of rice Djino, 1 bag of rice Oncle Bomb, 3 boxes of frozen items and 3 jugs of oil. 

She is 31 years old and is married to a minister. She lives in the Avenou district.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, frozen items and jugs of oil

loans.name: Aida Turqueza's Group

texts.en: Aida T. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Aida is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Aida is married and has an infant. To make a living, Aida runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Aida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Aida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca N. lives in the Nabulagala neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Jesca has a business of selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Jesca sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale. 

Jesca has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bales of second hand-clothes. The main business challenges for Jesca include defaulters, transportation, and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to build rental rooms. 

Jesca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, medication, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia Patricia, tiene una tienda llamada Granero Merkamax ella vive con su cónyuge y sus tres  hijos en las edades de 12 a 18 años al Sur Occidente de la ciudad. Claudia  nació en Barranquilla y con el buen ejemplo de su madre trabajadora,  aprendió todo lo que ella es hoy.  Una Vez termino sus estudios de bachillerato conformó su hogar y empezó a trabajar en una empresa privada por más de 15 años y finalmente decidió iniciar su propio negocio , con el legado que le dio su madre  que mucho   aprecia : su tienda.  
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean exitosos y que finalmente cumplan sus propios propósitos, como el de ser parte de la  policía Nacional de su hijo mayor.  Su máximo desafío es el manejo de su tiempo pues tiene un negocio que demanda mucha operatividad durante todo el día  y en la noche apoya las tareas de sus hijos y realiza los quehaceres de su hogar. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a su credikiva, con el cual comprará ranchos y víveres que son las mercancías de mayor rotación,  pues le va muy bien con sus clientes porque se encuentra ubicada en una esquina y tiene tiempo de estar funcionando allí . Su mayor reto es aumentar su capital para ampliar su oferta de servicios y la cobertura de clientes, logrando una rotación de inventarios inferior a 24 días,  y una rentabilidad no menor del 25% mientras esto ocurre
texts.en:
Claudia Patricia has a store called Granero Merkamax. She lives with her partner and their three children, ages 12 to 18, in the Southeast of the city. Claudia was born in Barranquilla and she learned all she needed to become who she is today from her mother's good example. Upon completion of high shcool she started a family and worked for a company for more than 15 years. She finally started her own business when she received her inheritance from her mother: her shop. 

Her dream is for her children to be successful, and that they can fulfill their dreams. Her eldest son hopes to be a member of the National Police. One of her big challenges is time management because her business requires attention throughout the day, and in the evenings she helps her children with their homework and does housework too. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and she will use the money to purchase snack foods and groceries which have the highest turnover at her store. Her shop has many clients because it is located on the corner and has been in business for a long itme. Her biggest challenge is to increase her capital to offer more services and coverage for clients, so that she can have inventory turnover in less than 24 days and earn a return of not less than 25%.

loans.use: purchase snack foods and groceries for her store

loans.name: Kourk

texts.en:
Mrs. Kourk is a 64 year old widowed villager who lives in the Kompong Cham Province. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are sewing workers. Her husband died of senility several years ago.

Mrs. Kourk has been growing crops for a long-time, making a low income of about $1.25 per day to support the family. Presently, her house is too narrow and very old, and she wishes to move to a new place but does not have sufficient funds to do that. Mrs. Kourk is applying for a loan of $550 to buy some land to build her new home.

loans.use: buy land to build a new house.

loans.name: Wolale Marakasso 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WOLALE MARAKASSO 4  est composé de femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la préfecture de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et au moins 6  enfants.
Elles cultivent  exclusivement du sésame.  Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans d’ ou leur deuxième  prêt de campagne et  PORTIO, qui est la deuxième femmes  assise  à gauche en T-shirt jaune, compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles au grand marché de SAN  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN  et DAH et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 19000 à 41000  FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en: The Wolale Marakasso 4 group is made up of married women from the village of Cinzara in the San region of Segou, the fourth largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They live in traditional families and are all around 39 years old with at least 6 children each. They specialise in the cultivation of sesame. In order to generate higher profits from their agricultural activities, the group members decided to seek a loan from Soro Yiriwaso two years ago, and are seeking their second from them now. Portio- the second lady from the right sitting down, and wearing a yellow T-shirt- aims to use her loan to purchase a sufficient quantity of seeds, small tools and agricultural inputs from the large town market at San. Once the rainy season has passed, the harvest is stored for a while so that it rises in value before being sold at the large town markets of San and Dah and in the neighbouring towns.  She takes cash sales from retail and wholesale customers whos generally come from large towns.The group members aim each to generate profits of 19,000 to 41,000 FCFA from the sales of their goods, and will use to repay the loan interest and to see to their families' everyday needs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and small tools

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water bills and electricity. 

For the past three years, she has operated an ice cubes selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Sofia dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 (KES) she wants to purchase another freezer for storing ice cubes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase another freezer for storing ice cubes for sale.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME 2 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SETOU, qui est la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir environs 0,5  hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguisseme 2 group are married women, on average 37 years old with 3 children. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the town of Massigui in the Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region in Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they grow include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan collaboration with the institution.
With this new loan, Setou, standing all the way on the right in the photo, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and pay for labour costs to manage about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.
After the harvest, the produce is sold town-wide in Missagui to a clientele composed of men and women. Each member intends to realize an average profit of about 50,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and small equipment.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació en el distrito de Echarate (La Convección, Cusco, Perú) y  vive en la comunidad de Papel Pata a 45 minutos de la  ciudad de Quillabamba (La Convección, Cusco). Es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que hace mucho tiempo se separo de su pareja. Ella a pesar de las adversidades sigue sacando a su familia, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos y gallinas, ella también se dedica al cultivo de frutas como por ejemplo naranjas, mangos, piñas, mandarinas, etc. Ya son varios años que funciona el negocio y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar chanchos. 

(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.)
texts.en:
Victoria, 48, is married and has four children.  She was born in Echarate District (La Convección, Cusco, Perú) and lives in the community of Papel Pata 45 minutes from the city of Quillabamba (La Convección, Cusco).  She is an enterprising, hard working woman who separated from her spouse some time ago.  Despite adversities she continues to move her family forward.

She raises small farm animals like pigs and chickens.  She also farms fruit like oranges, mangoes, pineapples, mandarins, etc.  The business has been in operation for several years now and she’s doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy pigs.

(Quillabamba is the capital city of La Convección Province and an important commercial hub of Lares and La Convección Valleys.  Its main activities are coca leaf, coffee, cocoa bean and fruit production.)

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  2 cows or heifers to slaughter

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg is 44, a seamstress, and lives only with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her husband is a driver and electrician. She has been running her clothes tailoring business since 1991 and she has been able to gain enough experience in this business. 

At first, she started her business with only one sewing-machine. But now she owns a full workshop. She has a plan to expand her business. Recently,  she needs more inventory of cloth materials because it is a busy season for her and she has a lot of orders. 

Therefore she is taking out a loan to purchase cloth materials to increase her  current business assets.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Rubiela

texts.es:
Con el propósito de contribuir a cubrir los gastos del hogar, Rubiela decidió empezar a trabajar desde su casa a través de la venta de productos por catálogo los cuales vende entre sus familiares, amigos, vecinos y conocidos. 

Actualmente, Rubiela necesita de un préstamo para comprar productos naturales que le permitan ampliar su mercado y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
With the intention of contributing toward the household expenses, Rubiela decided to start working from home. She sells products from catalogs and offers them to her relatives, friends, neighbors, and acquaintances.

At the moment, Rubiela needs a loan to buy natural products so that she can expand her market and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 23 years old, married, and has two infant children. To generate income and support the family, Jennifer has been managing her hog raising business for almost three years. Since Jennifer's parents struggled financially, she wasn't able to finish her college education and seek good employment. She also married early. Jennifer doesn't want her children to experience the same hardship as she has. She is determined to send them both to school. Profits earned form the business are being saved in preparation for her children's education. 

She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy hog feed, medicines, and vitamins to ensure good nutrition for the pigs. With good nutrition, she will be able to sell the hogs at a higher price when they are ready for sale.

In the future, Jennifer wants to achieve financial stability. She also wants to see both of her children get a degree and good employment some day.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines, and vitamins to ensure good nutrition for the pigs

loans.name: Ok Mufakose Group B

texts.en:
Maureen is 27 years old and lives in Mufakose. She is married, but as yet they have no children. Both Maureen and her husband sell vegetables at the local market. They have no other source of income. The main issue facing them both is the lack of capital with which to grow their business. She will invest the money she borrows in purchasing more vegetables to sell.

In time, Maureen hopes to run her own vegetable wholesaling business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora y el señor Susano son padres de familia y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando. Son  originarios de la ciudad de VeraC. México tiene ya mas de diez años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
Están solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la inscripción de la escuela y comprar los útiles que son (cuadernos, lápices, carpetas y libros)  que les pidieron a sus hijos, no cuentan con el dinero necesario para realizar esta necesidad escolar. 
Doña Aurora es empleada de una maquiladora donde desempeñe la labor de producción, con este ingreso pagaren el préstamo, ya que Don Susano se encargara de los gastos de la familia con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en: Señora Aurora and Señor Susano are the parents of two children who are studying. They originally come from the city of VeraC., Mexico and have been living in the city of Nuevo Laredo for over 10 years now. They are seeking a loan to be able to pay the school fees and to buy the equipment the children are asked to bring (such as exercise books, pencils, folders and textbooks). The family does not have the money required to meet the costs of school. Señora Aurora is employed in a factory where she works on an assembly line; with this income they will make the loan repayments. Señor Susano takes care of the family's other household expenses with the money he makes from his business selling clothing.

loans.use: To buy what her children need for school and to pay the tuition fees.

loans.name: Japuraya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JAPURAYA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Achacachi, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Reina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de material de escritorio, agricultura, albañil, herrero, costura, tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas, venta de verduras y frutas. 

La señora Reina  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas y de verduras desde años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de verdura y frutas que comprará de La Paz y lo comercializa en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera.
texts.en:
The “Japuraya” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Center.  It has 10 members led by a governing board headed by Reina.  The members of this communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: office supply sales, farming, bricklaying, metal worker, sewing, grocery store, blanket weaving and sale of fruit and vegetables.

Reina indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer; she was invited by the promotion.  She currently has a business selling fruit and vegetables, a business she’s had for several years.  The loan she will now take out is to increase her stock merchandise (to buy vegetables and fruit in La Paz to then sell in her community).  This way of working allows her to generate income to help her family as much as possible since she’s single.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Sunu Gie Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Sunu GIE" est une association qui s'active dans l'élevage notamment l'aviculture.Ses membres disposent d'un poulayer ou elles élevèvent des poulets de chair pendant trois mois avant de les revendre sur les marchés locaux.Cette activités leur procurent des revenus aasez importants qui leur permet de satisfaire leurs propres besoins mais aussi de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles .Le chef du groupe, assis au milieu, est mère de trois enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Avec cette élevage,elle paie leurs frais de scolaritré et la plupart des frais de santé.Le groupe sollicite un pret de 1500000f pour acheter des poussins, de l'aliment volaille et des produits vétérinaires.
texts.en: The group "Sunu GIE" is an association whose members work raising animals, notably poultry. Its members have a chicken yard where they raise their fryers for three months before selling them on the local market. These activities bring in considerable income which allows them to support themselves and help cover some expenses for their families. The leader of the group, sitting in the middle, is the mother of three children who all attend school. By raising chickens, she pays their school fees and most of their health-related expenses. The group is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 francs to buy chicks, chicken feed, and veterinary products.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chicken feed, and veterinary products.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is 59 years old.  She lives in Nguyet Cau village, Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh city.  She has four children.

Ut sells dry goods like beans, salt, sugar, chilli, garlic and more to many people in her village.  She has been in business for ten years and earns a monthly income of about 6.000.000 VND. 

She has borrowing money from SEDA since 2008.  This will be her fifth loan from SEDA.  Her last loan of 8.288.000 VND was repaid punctually. 

This time she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy goods for her store.

loans.use: to buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 31 years old, and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Ester owns and operates a farming business together with her husband. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ester has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP every season (every four months). She is also engaged in a hog-raising business for their additional income.

Ester needs both sources of income in order to sustain the family's daily needs and to afford sending her children to school. She would like to request a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 in order to buy seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers for her rice farm production. She hopes that she will make more improvements in her business through this loan, and hopes that her patience and sacrifices will lead her to reach her goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers for her rice farm production

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
This is Digna, 52, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a widow and is solely responsible for her three children, one in college and two in high school. She manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to meet their daily needs and expenses

Digna owns a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like copper, plastic, paper, etc. They sell these to junk shops like Digna’s for a little profit. A junk shop then stacks, cleans, and gathers huge quantities of these materials to sell them back to factories or to a bigger junk shop.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in her daily sales.

Digna is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 that will help to continue her business well.  She will use the loan to buy more recyclable materials from scavengers. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's educational expenses.  

Digna dreams that her junk shop will last and continue to grow. She wants her children to finish their studies and be able to have a comfortable life someday. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it helps her to be stronger and closer to God with all the Bible studies being conducted. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna trades in food from a rented booth in a city market. Ruzanna would like to expand her business by selling more food. With the loan's help Ruzanna will develop her business and increase her income. Additional income is vital for Ruzanna and her family, as she'll be able to cover her three student daughters' educational costs and insure better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for food inventory

loans.name: Sapia

texts.en:
This is Sapia, who is 25, single, and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She manages her own household while operating her general retail business. Sapia buys general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells it for a little profit. She sells bags, stuffed toys, and other similar products. She works hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. Sapia's customers are attracted to her merchandise because of her low prices and variety. Her regular customers are local community members and passersby and she earns a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every day.

Sapia is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to help continue to operate her business. She will purchase additional bags and stuffed toys to expand her product inventory. Sapia expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. In the coming years, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Sapia faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members each week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy bags, stuffed toys, and other items to sell

loans.name: Delphine Badoussi

texts.fr: Delphine est mariée avec cinq enfants à charge. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de divers, condiments, tapettes, charbons etc... à son domicile. Elle s'approvisionne presque dans tous les marchés de la place. Pour satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle, elle sollicite le renouvellement de son micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra  d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et pour mieux contribuer au bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en: Delphine is married with five children in her care. She sells miscellaneous items, seasonings, flip flops, charcoal, etc. from her home. She stocks up at all the area markets. To satisfy the needs of her clientele, she is seeking to renew her micro-loan from Finadev. This loan will allow her to increase her business and to better contribute to the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of charcoal, 4 baskets of tomatoes, and miscellaneous items

loans.name: Gary

texts.en:
Gary is 46 years old and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City. He is married with two children. Gary has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock for his store. 

He has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Gary hopes to have a general merchandise business to earn money for the family's future and for the children in their studies. Gary is a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store.

loans.name: Christ Roi Group

texts.fr: CHRIST ROI est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui font des tontines ensemble. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Assiba I. Sabine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Assiba I. Sabine est mariée à un certain René. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Assiba I. Sabine et son mari. Pour cette raison, Assiba I. Sabine vend des produits de coiffure dans sa région depuis douze ans. Assiba I. Sabine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Assiba I. Sabine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe CHRIST ROI, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits de coiffure.

loans.name: Narcizo

texts.es:
Narcizo con 48 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cinco hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor de 04 y 05 años de edad, con una experiencia en el rubro de 05 años. Adicionalmente se desempeña como peón agrícola así mismo a la cría de ganado vacuno. Solicita préstamo para gastos de abono y mantenimiento de su finca de café.De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Narcizo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, este es su segundo crédito.

loans.use: para gastos de abono y mantenimiento de su finca de café

loans.name: Tzvetan

texts.en: Tzvetan K. has an own business since 2003. Previously he had worked as a driver and a fitter. His wife is a tailor and works in a sartorial factory near the city. Tzvetan keeps a small grocery and a café in his native village. The grocery and the café are built on his own property, on the place where his family house had been. Tzvetan has used two loans so far. The firs one he used for building and repairing the halls and the second one for equipment. Now he needs a loan to buy new furniture for the café. The loan amount he applies for is $ 1 000.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for the cafe

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has 3 years of experience selling cosmetics and perfumes. She was motivated to start by her sister, who is in the same line of business and experiences success. With the help of a close friend who lent her money, Mary invested in cosmetics and some perfumes. She sells by visiting the homes of family, friends and acquaintances. Like her, the clients she sells too often lack liquidity and they must pay for the products in installments. Part of Mary’s work is to collect on the weekly and biweekly payments owed to her by clients.

May will use the loan to continue to invest in her products. With an increase in products she will be able to offer better variety and increase sales.

Mary is 37 years old and is a native of Guayaquil. Her husband has been working at a nearby factory for about 4 years. They have 2 children together and live in a home made out of bamboo with some concrete. They are slowly improving their living conditions and they make sure to provide an education for their children.

loans.use: Invest in cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Benita Abad

texts.en:
Benita is 19 years old and is married. During the week she cleans house for a particular family, and on Saturdays and Sundays she sells vegetables in the market. She buys them from a cousin who has a garden, and if her cousin doesn’t have vegetables on a given day, she buys them from farmers who bring their produce to sell in the city. Benita doesn’t have a fixed place—she sells her produce in an unoccupied spot in the market. With the loan, she would like to buy a place in the market from which to sell her vegetables, so that she won’t have to work cleaning a house anymore. She is part of the “Ecatepec Group 1”.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

BENITA TIENE 19 AÑOS, CASADA, DURANTE LA SEMANA SE DEDICA A LIMPIAR UNA CASA PARTICULAR Y LOS SABADOS Y DOMINGOS VENDE VERDURAS EN EL MERCADO, ESTO LO COMPRA CON UNA PRIMA DE ELLA QUE TIENE HORTALIZA, Y SI UN DADO CASO NO TIENE NADA DE COSECHA LO COMPRA CON GENTE DE LAS COMUNIDADES QUE TRAEN VERDURAS PARA VENDERLAS A LA CIUDAD. ELLA NO TIENE LOCAL, VENDE SUS PRODUCTOS EN ALGUN LUGAR DESOCUPADO DEL MERCADO. CON EL PRESTAMO QUISIERA COMPRAR UN LUGAR AHI PARA VENDER SUS VERDURAS Y ASI NO TENER QUE TRABAJAR MAS EN CASA PARTICULAR. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ECATEPEC 1.

loans.use: To buy a permanent spot in the vegetable market

loans.name: Paulina Juliana

texts.en:
Paulina was born in the countryside near Juliaca, where she lived until her twins began primary school. She decided to move the family of four children closer to the city so that her children would not have to travel so far to get to school. She did not have the opportunity to finish primary school and hopes that her children will have the opportunity to attend a university. So far the 11 year old twins have remained at grade level and are soon to start secondary school.

For the past two years, Paulina has been selling food items from a cart on the street. In the last year, she has purchased a cart with wheels which has allowed her to expand the quantity and the type of foods she sells. Having a mobile business makes it easy for her to find the best location for sales depending on the time of day.

Paulina is requesting a loan of $175 with which she hopes to buy a stand in the market where she can continue to expand her business and clientèle as well as her financial security. Her primary goal is to make enough money to send all four of her children to school.

loans.use: Purchase a stand at the local food market.

loans.name: Liz Karina

texts.es:
Sra. Liz, 24, is the mother of 3 girls. She belongs to the Banco Comunal Manos Unidas (United Hands Community Bank) in the Manantay district of Ucayali in Peru. Her partner earns a living making charcoal--he burns wood to make it--but it's Liz who carries it by the sack-full to the local market where it's in demand as the most popular product for firing kitchen stoves. Her first loan was for S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$94).

With the recently granted loan of S/.1,000 (or US$319, approximately) from Manuela Ramos, she will buy 2 truckloads of wood, 15 bags of aserrin (wood shavings?) and install a new kiln for burning the wood. She and her partner jointly make a living from the business, something that at the same time allows her to educate her daughters. Both are happy working as a team where he makes the charcoal and she sells it, together providing a much-needed product.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Liz tiene 24 años y es madre de 3 niñas, pertenece al Banco Comunal Manos Unidas, del A.H. Santa Graciela Mz K. Lt 4 del distrito de Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali. Su conviviente trabaja en la elaboración de carbón (hornea la leña para obtener carbón) y Liz es quien se dedica a vender el carbón por sacos, llevando al mercado mas cercano de la población, ya que con este producto muchas personas lo utilizan como combustible para la cocina. Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.).

Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 319 aprox.) comprará 2 camionadas de leña, 15 sacos de aserrín e implementarán un nuevo volcán para hornear la leña. Ahora conjuntamente con su conviviente se dedican a este negocio, a la vez pueden educar a sus hijas. Ambos están contentos de trabajar en equipo, donde él elabora el carbón y ella lo vende en el mercado, atendiendo a muchas personas que lo requieren.

loans.use: Buy wood, supplies and equipment for charcoal-making business.

loans.name: Namik

texts.en: Namik S. is 37 years old, is married, and has three children. He lives in the Yenikand village in the Salyan region.  He has been in this business for 8 years. With this business he can support his family. Now he applies for a loan of $1200 to buy  a plot of land for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Please Delete's Group

texts.en:
DIA, age 54, runs a small breakfast cafe from the porch of their home, which she calls “Mama Kingwiti.” She began this business in 1971. She serves food from 6am-10am daily, charging an average of 45-55 cents per plate. Every day, Dia makes about $5.50-6.50 from her breakfast business. She has been using the profits to make repairs on their home. A long term goal of hers is to one day get electricity in their home.

While Dia and her husband live alone, they have 7 grown children. Some of their children still help Dia cook and serve at her café. Her husband is a retired City Council Member.

Dia is the leader of Subgroup C of group Tuwezeshane (meaning “let's help each other" in Swahili), which totals 24 members. Dia will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members: Kidawa S. (food vendor), Kasim R. (tailor), Asha K. (selling clothes), and Salma M. (selling charcoal). Her subgroup has shared 3 previous loans together, which they paid back successfully.

Dia used the previous loans to increase her food supply for her café. She hopes to use the new loan to do the same in order to continue their house repairs.

In the picture, Dia is on the far right.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Allah's Group

texts.en: I am Allah R., and wife of Muhammad Rafique. I have lived in a small town called Borewala in Pakistan for the past 20 years. I am a mother of eight: five boys and three girls. My husband buys and sells used items and gadgets. The used items include iron, steel and plastic goods. My husband now requires a loan to buy used items in bulk. He also sells fruit. I am a group leader of other women and all of us have acquired loans together before, and we are mutually responsible for each other's loans. Sakina B. needs a loan to buy a rickshaw for her brother, who currently drives someone else’s rickshaw on rent; and Shahnaz B. will invest the loan in her son’s readymade garments business.

loans.use: Buy used items in bulk for the business

loans.name: Bukaye B North B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Saniya K.. She is currently in the business of selling timber and is requesting a loan to boost business. Saniya is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 12 children ranging from age 11 to 20 and two of them go to school. Each week, Saniya makes approximately UGX 49000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater to home expenditures. Saniya has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to start a timber business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Saniya is joined in her small group by Jamila N., Aziza M., Alayisa K., and Mariamu N.. Jamila N. has a business in trading millet flour and produce and wants to expand the flour business. Aziza M. is currently operating a business in clothes vending and wants a loan to uplift it and also start a poultry business. Alayisa K. operates a business of cattle trading and a butcher shop and wants to increase the number of animals traded. Mariamu N. is currently in the local restaurant and retail shop business and is requesting a loan to increase stock in her shop.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of timbre traded

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem H., age 30, is married with two little children and lives in a Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She buys coconuts from the growers and resells them for a profit. She can earn about $2.50 each day. Her husband makes about $2.50 each day by working as a construction foreman. Mrs. Hem H. has applied for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business transportation

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Madeleine B. is married and takes care of five children. She is a member of the village bank of Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara in the Kolda region. She buys fish, drinks, peanut butter, and monkey bread (baobab fruit) and then resells them. She also sells pork, which she raises. The income drawn from her business enables her to improve her family's living conditions. This 9th loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madeleine B., mariée, 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara dans la région de Kolda. Elle achète et revend du poisson, de la boisson, de la pate d'arachide et pain de singe (fruit du baobab). Madeleine vend aussi des porcs qu'elle élève.. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Ce 9ème prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy fish, drinks, animal feed, peanut butter, and monkey fruit

loans.name: Rose's Leaf Group

texts.en:
Rose is 39 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages11, 6, and 3 years old. Rose sells fish. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6.30am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $10 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwaija, Eliza, Anna and Zubeda, who have cooking businesses and sell clothing and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of tablecloths, cushions, and ornamental plants to retail in her community

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria is 45 years old. She was able to complete her elementary education. She speaks Spanish and Aymara (indigenous language) and is married to Don Lucio Yupanqui Condori. They have three children that are students; one of them studies in Arequipa and two in Yunguyo. She lives in Villa Queñuani, Yunguyo Duistrict.

Beforehand, she used to sell clothes which she will also took to Tacna and Arequipa. Since young she has been dedicated also to sell potato starch, potatoes, and quinoa which she actually does athe markets of Tacna and Arequipa

She belongs to the "Vista Alegre" Communal Bank and at the beginning she obtained a S/. 300.00 nuevos soles(Peruvian currency) loan which she invested in buying sheep. With the new loan of S/. 1,500.00 (Peruvian currency), which she promises to pay back in 4 payments, she will buy potato starch, potatoes, and quinoa in larger quantities.

Gregoria has also learned to be responsible with ther payments. Her biggest wish is to be able to buy a house in Arequipa and another one in Yunguyo, give a good education to her children and lately be able to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Gregoria tiene 45 años de edad, logro estudiar primaria completa, habla castellano y aymará, es casada con don Lucio Yupanqui Condori, con quien tiene tres hijos, de los cuales los tres estudian, uno en Arequipa, dos en Yunguyo, ella vive en Villa Queñuani, Distrito de Yunguyo. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, que también llevaba hacia Tacna y Arequipa, actualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de chuño, papa, quinua, oca, que lo vende en mercados de Tacna y Arequipa inicio el negocio desde muy joven. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre” a un inicio tuvo un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra de ovejas. Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró chuño, papa y quinua en mayores cantidades. Aprendió a ser responsable en sus pagos. El gran anhelo que ella tiene es, comprar una casa en Arequipa y Yunguyo, darles una buena educación a sus hijos, posteriormente comprarse un volvo.

loans.use: Buying tubers and cereal.

loans.name: Groupement Des Femmes De Aynoumane

texts.fr:
These women are part of the large Lingueres de Mbour association. They have a good history with the IMCEC credit organization, dating from two years ago. They buy vegetables, fish, oil and second-hand clothes, which they resell in their neighborhoods around the village of Mbour. They are mothers of families, very lively and hardworking. They will use this loan to augment their working capital, thereby increasing their stock and diversifying the products they carry.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Elles font parti du grand groupement des Lingueres de Mbour. Elles ont une bonne expérience avec l’IMCEC (deux ans). Elles achètent des légumes, du poisson, de l’huile et de la piperie qu’elles revendent dans leurs quartiers situés à la périphérie de la commune de Mbour. Elles sont des mères de familles très dynamiques et travailleuses. Elles vont investir le crédit dans le renforcement de leur fonds de roulement et ainsi, améliorer le niveau de les stocks et la diversité de leurs produits

loans.use: Supplementation of working capital

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi .A. est un commerçant dynamique  âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il tient une boutique de prêt à porter au quartier commercial de Kpalimé une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo à 120 Km de Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Kossi est un client fidèle de FECECAV et désire par ce troisième crédit renforcer son  fond de roulement permettant de renouveler à une fréquence régulière son stock. Avec cette chance de Kiva, il pourrait désormais faire face à une clientèle exigeante en tissus de marque, gagner plus d’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi A. is an energetic merchant, 32 years old, married, and the father of two children. He has a shop of ready-to-wear clothing in the commercial district of Kpalimé, a city located in the southwest of Togo and about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Kossi is a loyal client of FECECAV and would like to use this third loan to bolster his working capital. This would allow him to renew his inventory on a regular basis. With this Kiva opportunity, he would then be able to cope with his demanding customer base regarding name-brand fabrics. He would also be able to earn more money and to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear clothing for resale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel A. is a 47-year-old man, married with three children. All the children are in school. Emmanuel A. enjoys selling and takes pride in serving his customers. He has been selling maize for two years to support his family. He obtains his supplies from the farming communities, and sells at retail to his customers. He wants to use the loan to buy bags of maize to meet the daily demands of his customers in his community and the surrounding markets. He hopes to use part of his profit to pay his children's educational fees. Emmanuel A. is a member of a community group called "Nyame Mma" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha B. T. is a member of the community bank Llapanchik, which is a Quechuan word meaning ‘everyone together’. Bertha lives in Ayacucho with her husband and their 2 children, aged 15 & 14. Bertha travels to the fairs daily to sell cereals and grains.

With her loan of 2400 soles, Bertha will invest in her business purchasing corn and wheat from the country. Her goal is to have a bigger business and ensure her children attend the university to earn their degrees and become professionals.

loans.use: purchase corn and wheat from the country

loans.name: Savi

texts.es: La señora Savi tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto  Su actividad diaria es la venta de abarrotes, labor que viene realizando desde hace 6 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto directo con sus clientes y desde luego darles una buena atención para que regresen en otra oportunidad. Le es rentable porque cuenta con una clientela que la apoya desde el primer momento que puso este negocio, por lo que no muestra dificultad alguna.a su conviviente y sus 3 hijos,  quienes están estudiando y son su razón de seguir adelante. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, mostrándose puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere ampliar y ambientar adecuadamente su negocio, para así dar una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Savi is 30 years old and lives with her family. Her daily activity is grocery sales, work she has done for 6 years. She likes being in direct contact with her clients and of course likes to give them good service so that they come back. The business is profitable since she is able to depend upon a client base that has helped her from the start. For this reason, she has had no troubles to mention. She lives with her domestic partner and their three children, who are students and are also her reason to persevere in her efforts. This is the fourth loan that she has solicited from Kiva field partner MFP, and she has demonstrated punctual repayments. With the solicited loan proceeds she would like to expand and decorate her business adequately, for her clients' benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To decorate and expand a store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. is married to a blacksmith and has 5 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high school. Since 1994, Agnes has been selling a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey' which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country and it is normally eaten with hot sauce and fried fish at Ataabadze near Elmina. Agnes uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Agnes will use the loan to increase her purchase of maize, fresh fish and other ingredients which she uses to prepare the Kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To increase her purchase of maize, fresh fish and other ingredients which are used to prepare the Kenkey.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila A. is 50 year old woman who has bred sheep for the last ten years. Naila and her husband are very responsible parents of their four dear children, and they work very hard breeding sheep so they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. Naila has been working in agriculture since getting married. She and her husband buy and sell sheep in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, Naila now finds herself with more expenses than income, and she would like a loan in order to increase production. Naila and her family are counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchase ten sheep and fodder

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont tous des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et de 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les frères, sœurs, enfants et époux. Elles résident tous dans le village de Coni sous préfecture de Fana région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Par des relations de mariage, ces femmes se sont connues et font majoritairement l’achat vente des condiments alimentaires. 
Dans l’intention d’agrandir la taille de leur commerce elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur quatrième prêt après avoir remboursé tous les trois prêts précédents.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 100kg de sel de cuisine, 10 boites de 2 kg de concentrée de tomate  et une grande quantité de condiments divers. 
Elles s’approvisionnent dans le marché de Marka-Coungo et viennent revendre sur le marché local de Coni et ses environnants. Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice de 25 000 F CFA chacune et se proposent d’utiliser ce bénéfice pour assurer une bonne alimentation  de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are all married women with an average age of 29 and on average, 5 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, children and husbands. They all reside in the village of Coni, Sous-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali.

These women are acquainted with each other because they are in-laws and for the most part, they buy and sell condiments.

With the intention of increasing the size of their businesses, they joined the micro-finance institute Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth loan, after having reimbursed the three preceding loans correctly.

With this loan they intend to buy 100 kg of cooking salt, 10 cans of 2 kg of tomato concentrate, and a large quantity of various other condiments. They do their buying in the market of Marka-Coungo and come to sell their merchandise in the local markets of Coni and its surroundings.
