Maura thinks that the majority of women don’t value themselves, and there has never been an institution in her community that only works with women. The bank has taught Maura how to run her business, and now she wants to expand it and open a restaurant. Maura’s dream is to improve her food sales and to send her children to school so that they can become professionals.

Isabel García sells cereals in Cangallo. She also sells fruit in the market in Ayacucho. Isabel says that before she found the community bank she was half-dead, but when she joined she was born again. When they invited Isabel to stat work with a loan, she had her doubts, but she soon gained confidence in the partners. Now, Isabel says, they help each other, like a family. With her savings, Isabel would like to buy a house, as she now rents her home. Isabel would also like to expand her business while her children are still small. Isabel has many dreams, for example, she hopes to be the perfect mother for her children, and she’d like her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El Bancomunal Santa Rosa esta formado por 11 clientas, esta ubicado en la comunidad de Cangallo, capital del distrito de Cangallo en el departamento de Ayacucho, esta comunidad mayormente se dedica a la producción de frutales, pero es poco la producción de cereales y la mayoría de la gente se dedica al negocio.

Maruja C., tiene un molino de granos, se dedica a criar cuyes en casa con el desperdicio del molino y vende morón, ulpeada y 7 semillas. El sueño de Maruja es comprarse una casa, por que actualmente vive en casa alquilada, también quiere hacer estudiar a sus hijos. En su bancomunal ella a aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona, se relaja con lo que se le enseña en las capacitaciones y con los juegos. Ella invertirá sus ahorros en comprar máquinas de moler, porque una sola con la que cuenta actualmente no le abastece.

Maura E., vende yuyo picante los días de feria y en las noches sale a vender café con charapitas. También lava ropa y otras veces vende frutas. Maura dice: “la mayoría de las mujeres, no nos valoramos”, en su comunidad nunca hubo una institución que solo trabajara con mujeres, en el bancomunal me enseñan como hacer mi negocio. Ahora quiero ahorrar para poder ampliar mi negocio y abrir un restaurante. Mi sueño es mejorar mis ventas de comida hacer estudiar a mis hijos para que sean profesionales.

Isabel García, Hace negocios con cereales, compro y los llevo a Cangallo, compra cereales, pero también realiza negocio con frutas de Ayacucho que las trae a la feria. Isabel dice: “En el bancomunal he aprendido a nacer nuevamente, por que yo estaba semimuerta y me invitaron a trabajar con el préstamo, al inicio tenían dudas pero luego me gané la confianza de Finca y de las socias”, ahora somos como una familia nos ayudamos a unos a otros. Con mis ahorros quiero comprarme una casa, por que vivo en casa alquilada y quiero aumentar mi negocio, mientras que mis hijos sean pequeños. Isabel tiene muchos sueños, como por ejemplo ser la madre ideal para mis hijos, y que mis hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: The partners need different loan amounts. Some need 300 soles, some 500 soles, for a total of 4,300 soles in loans to the Community Bank.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emma as this young man is popularly called is 31 years old. He is single and very hard working. Emmanuel is a dealer in electrical goods like assorted lights, electrical cables, extension plugs, wires, electric lamps, speakers, transistors, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

Emmanuel is requesting a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators. He would be very grateful for your support.

Emmanuel has been in this business for the past eight years and has a lot of experience with a wider market share in his business area. He belongs to the community group called Great Provider Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of electric appliances

loans.name: Loy

texts.en: M. Loy is a member of the Abateesa women's group.  For three years, she has owned a depot in Kabowa where she sells soda, beer, and other soft drinks. This is her second time to ask for a loan from Pearl Microfinance. Before her first loan, she usually found difficulties in stocking enough for her ever-increasing customer demands, but since then she has had no problems and it has greatly improved her business. She manages her depot alone, though her husband is very supportive.  They have two kids and also care for four orphans. She needs a loan to be able to buy more crates of soda, beer, wines and spirits for her customers and to ensure a stable business that will sustain itself through the end of the year.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, beer, wines and spirits for her customers.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JULIO CESAR  LABORA PARA UNA EMPRESA MUY CONOCIDA DE REFRESCOS, EL HA DEMOSTRADO DENTRO DE SU TRABAJO  QUE ES UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE Y DEDICADA ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA LA AMPLIACION DE SU VIVIENDA TENIENDO MAS COMODIDAD PARA EL Y SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar works for a very well-known soda company, and has shown in his work that he is a very responsible and dedicated person. He is asking for this loan to extend his home in order to have more room for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home extension

loans.name: Clara Elena

texts.es:
La señora Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya Mz. O Lt. 36, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos, 5 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de queso. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una motokar de carga. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo para manejar su herramienta de trabajo. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 llantas, 2 focos, arreglará el motor, etc. 

Clara agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada, porque gracias a ello la estabilidad económica de su familia ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Señora Clara belongs to the “El Paraíso” communal bank located on Jr. José Olaya Mz. O Lt. 36, Yarinacocha District, Coronel Portillo Province, Ucayali Department. She is 54, the mother of 6 children, 5 grown and one still dependent on her. She is married, her husband drives a motor cart. With the first loan she got from the Manuela Ramos organization of $100, she decided to invest in cheese sales. She has been working with the communal bank for 4 years. Currently she owns a freight motor cart. She has the help of her husband to drive her work vehicle. With this loan of $975, which will be repaid in 6 months, the will buy 2 tires, 2 headlights, she will have the engine repaired, etc. Clara is thankful to the Manuela Ramos organization for the help it has given her, because thanks to it, the economic stability of her family has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 tires, 2 headlights, have the engine repaired, etc.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat S. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, who are all attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice for a living. In addition to this activity, she also sells fruit at the local market. Since the business is going well, she wants to expand it. She is asking for a loan to buy more fruit to sell at the market. Her husband, Mr. Nhem Sarorn, is a government officer earns a small salary.

Mrs. Yat S. is a group leader. The four members live in Kaoh Reah Leu village in Kandal province.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell at the market.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en:
Avaz R. is 38 years old. He is married and has two adorable kids. His wife keeps the house and takes care of the kids. 
In order to support his family, Avaz sells clothes for men and children. He has been in this business for nine years. Avaz has a wealth of experience and he is able to choose goods that meet the needs of his clients whose tastes differ. The business is quite successful and generates a stable income that allows Avaz to improve the living of his family. 
Today, Avaz requests 1200 USD for the term of 15 months. With the loan, he is planning to purchase new suits to sell and thus increase his range of goods.

loans.use: purchase more clothes inventories

loans.name: José Felipe

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Felipe Guerrero le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior e interior de la casa. 
  Esta solicitando un crédito para poder realizar  su mejora lo más pronto posible, ya que por la humedad que hay en su vivienda su hijo se le enfermo. Planea pagar este préstamo con los ingresos de su trabaja como chofer de una paquetería. (En la foto aparece su esposa la señora Elda Izquierdo ya que el se encontraba en horario de trabajo).
texts.en:
Mr. José Felipe Guerrero's house needs interior and exterior finishing. He is requesting a loan to perform the improvement as soon as possible, since his son became ill due to the humidity in his home. He intends to repay the loan with his income as a package delivery driver. (Pictured is his wife Mrs. Elda Izquierdo since he was at work at the time.)

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior and exterior finishing

loans.name: Bendicion Group

texts.es: El comité Bendición es un comité que se encuentra en el 4to. Ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendadoras.  El comite tiene un ahorro de 4.500.000.  Las integrantes son señoras que viven en la villa CONAVI, de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Todas las mujeres son muy responsables y activas, y ellas realizan actividades para ayudar a sus vecinos.  Ellas aprecian mucho las capacitaciones que reciben a traves del programa de Fundacion Paraguaya. Pues así aprenden a ahorrar y administrar mejor su negocio. Las integrantes de Bendicion están trabajando hace mas de 2 años con la fundación.
texts.en:
The Blessing Group is a group currently in its fourth cycle of the Enterprising Women program. The group has a savings of 4,500,000 Paraguayan Guaraní. The members are women who live in the Conavi neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. All of the women are very responsible and active, and they do activities to help their neighbors. They very much appreciate the trainings that they have received through the Fundación Paraguaya program. Through the trainings they have learned to save and to better administer their businesses. The members of the Blessing Group have been working with Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya for more than two years.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as clothing for children, teens and adults; underwear; cosmetics; vegetables; animals; fabric, thread, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia B. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high.

Sadia sells used clothing at Abura, which she has done since 2002. Her husband is a commercial driver. Sadia uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Sadia will use this loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sadia plans to reinvest back into her business and expand it further.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Hayot

texts.ru: Хаёт женщина 46 лет , замужем , имеет двоих детей.Имеет средне-специальное образование. Муж работает водителем городского троллейбуса. Зарабатывает немного. Чтобы прокормить и обучать детей в школе Хаёт занимается перепродажей хлеба в центре города Худжанда на рынке "Панчшанбе". У нее очень качественный и вкусный хлеб, который пользуется большим спросом. каждый свой займ она использует для увеличения своего товарооборота. Раньше у нее была одна точка реализации, а на сегодня она имеет продавца, который торгует недалеко от нее. Следующий займ она хочет потратить на расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Hayot is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She received a secondary vocational education. Her husband drives a city trolley. Hayot earns enough selling bread at the Panchshanbe market in downtown Khujand to feed and educate her children. She retails very high-quality, delicious bread, which is in high demand. Each loan she has taken out has been used to increase her turnover. In the past she had only one sales outlet, but today she employs another saleswoman who works nearby. She would like to spend the next loan on expanding her business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bread retailer

loans.name: Anor

texts.en:
O. Anor is 44 years old and is married with five children. Anor is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife (pictured) and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.

Today Anor is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $650 in his business. In order to receive this amount, Anor has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose A. is 49 years old and married with three children. She sells planks. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath M. is 46 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, where she earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind her house. She raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house.

She is married with four children who are themselves married, and most of them have aready started new families. Her husband’s name is Nin Sokol (pictured) who works with her in the business.

Rath M. has applied for a $500 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional feed and ducks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and ducks to raise

loans.name: Mulija

texts.en: Mulija H. was born in 1976. She is now divorced and lives in the town of Visoko with her six year old daughter. Mulija is not employed and lives on a very low income. She produces vegetables for her own use and earns some money from time to time. She also raises chickens and gets eggs, for her own use. Mulija decided to take her first loan in WWI (Žene za Žene International) in the amount of 1000 KM. She will use this loan to purchase chickens to fatten for poultry food. Mulija`s daughter will start her first school classes this autumn. Mulija wants to use the income from the sale of chicken meat to provide the needed supplies for her daughter to start with school.

loans.use: To purchase the chickens to fatten for poultry food.

loans.name: Esperanza Aurora

texts.es:
La sra. Esperanza pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 2 están a su cargo.  Tiene estudios de primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de harina para la preparación de pan. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de harina, azúcar, e insumos para la preparación de pan, ella luego los vende en el mercado de Pomata.

Su deseo es comprase una casita en Puno.

A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Esperanza belongs to the Medalla Milagrosa Community Bank, which is located in the Pomata district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 50, married, and has five children. Two of her children are dependents. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy flour to make bread. She now needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy flour, sugar, and ingredients to make bread. She will then sell the bread in the Pomata market. Her wish is to buy a small house in Puno. She likes the way they work and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour

loans.name: María Albertina

texts.es: Dona María T. tiene 26 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Secretaria,  “Receptora de ASDIR”  habita junto  a su Esposo, lleva 3 años de laborar en la Asociación ASDIR su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Xequiac, de la Aldea Nimasac del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,   por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de cubrir sus Gastos, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 26-year-old married secretary who lives with her husband and has worked for la Asociación ASDIR for 3 years. She lives in a country house in Xequiac in the village of Nimasac and for this reason she has turned to la Asociación ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of using it to cover her expenses. She also hopes to help her family move forward and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: medical expenses

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana L. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 44 years old, and is married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Flaviana owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Flaviana has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Flaviana joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flaviana is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to build shelter for her livestock. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business and support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build shelter for her livestock

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 26 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 5,2 years.

Gloria started her own clothing business selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 95,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Gloria`s first loan from BRAC-Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Gloria hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has worked as a butcher and a cook for 16 years. People often told him that his cooking was so good he should make a business out of it. Last year, James started his own catering business in a church kitchen. He makes and sells tamales and smoked meats, including ribs, links, lamb, duck, and goat. 

One of James’ main challenges is the high cost of cooking and catering equipment. He can only afford to purchase a little at a time. He is proud to have purchased his smoker, his biggest purchase so far, with his own savings. 

James needs a loan to help him purchase a mobile food cart. He plans to sell his tamales and meats in California parks, so people will know where to find him and his products. In the future, James hopes to have his own kitchen so that he can expand his business to its full potential, including a staff of two employees. 

James is excited about working wtih Opportunity Fund, not only for the chance of getting a loan to buy the cart, but also for teaching him important business skills to help him run and expand his business effectively. He feels good about his future and about finally taking the risk to become an entrepreneur.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur James from  United States

loans.use: Mobile food cart

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Aurelia es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 1 hija, Aurelia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado que se encuentra cerca del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende golosinas en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Aurelia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas.
Los sueños de Aurelia son tener otra sucursal y que su hija culmine sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de gaseosas.

loans.name: Rita Fernando

texts.pt:
Rita Fernando U. nasceu em Maputo, tem 30 anos de idade, é divorciada e mãe de 01 filho de 10 anos de idade. Estudou ate 5ªclasse parou de estudar por falta de alguém que lhe dessa assistência e lhe mostrasse a importância da escola, pois seu pai trabalhava na África do Sul (Pais vizinho de Moçambique). Ela cresceu com os avos, vive na casa própria em Boane e para alem do filho sustenta 02 sobrinhos órfãos que vivem com ela. 

Saiu de Boane para cidade de Maputo devido à guerra de desestabilização, regressa em 1995 para continuar com a sua vida normal. Actualmente tem um negocio próprio há mais de 10 anos, não tem trabalhadores, mas seu irmão tem lhe auxiliado de vez enquanto. O produto que vende mais é a cerveja que vende por 25.00MT a media, tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00MT por mês, poupa algum dinheiro fazendo (Xitique) um sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa.

Nunca pediu empréstimos em outras instituições de credito, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua mãe que também é cliente da instituição. Este é seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT com o qual pretende comprar refrigerantes, bebidas, e produtos de mercearia. O empréstimo anterior foi de 6.000.00MT também para a mesma actividade.

Com presente empréstimo espera melhorar bastante o seu negocio através de aumento da quantidade de produtos e ajudar a responder as necessidades primarias da família. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para melhorar o seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Rita Fernando U. was born in Maputo, Mozambique. She's 30, divorced and the mother of a 10 year old boy. Besider her son, she also supports two nephews who live with them. She was raised by her grandparents and dropped school in 5th grade. She's had her own business for the past 10 years; she has no employees, but her brother helps her from time to time. Her best selling product is beer, and she makes around 5.000,00MT (U$175) per month in profit, which she uses to support her household and save for the future. This is her second loan with this institution. She's asking for 10.000,00MT (U$350) to buy sodas, alcoholic beverages and other food products to sell in her store. She hopes to improve her business and give her kids a better life.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages for reselling

loans.name: Namsraijav

texts.en:
Namsraijav T. is 24 years old and lives with her husband and 2-year-old son in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home. Her husband, Enkhbayar, owns a microbus and earns money by transporting people. T. operates a grocery trading business at the local market in her town. She started her grocery service in 2008 and has quickly made good progress with her business. Her earnings have enabled her to purchase a refrigerator for her business and a computer for her family. T. is very hardworking and is focused on operating an honest business. She says, "I will work hard to pay the bank loan on time and I will use it to grow my business." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,600,000 tugrug (~1120 USD) to purchase a large amount of flour for her grocery trading business.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of flour for her grocery trading business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is Isatu B., a 23-year-old single woman from Wilberforce (an area within Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone). Isatu has one child, a girl, who is one year old. She has been a client of LAPO for some time now, and has taken out two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPO union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Isatu has a shop in Lumley market in Freetown, from which she sells soap paste and creams. With her first two loans, she expanded the inventory of her shop. With her new loan, Isatu decided to buy more stock of the same types of goods. Isatu hopes her latest LAPO loan will allow her to move forward to an increased profit and a higher standard of living.

loans.use: purchase additional inventory of soap and cosmetics

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en: Mirna is a 20-year-old single woman. She is living with her parents and five brothers and sisters. Mirna has been working as a tailor since 2007. Now, she is borrowing US$ 1,000 in order to buy a new sewing machine to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Kambar

texts.ru: Камбар Ниезов проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 55 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Ниезов более 4 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает лук, пшеницу для продажи. Ему в этом помагает его семья. Помимо этого он "художник", рисует картины. Кредит просит для закупа семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Kambar N. lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 55 years old. He is married and has three children. Kambar does agriculture for more than four years. He mainly grows onions and wheat for sale. His family helps him in this. Besides that he is an artist, he makes paintings. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow a new harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for sowing

loans.name: Eliava Adiru Monica Group

texts.en:
Monica A. is twenty-six years old. She is married and has one school-aged child. She also cares for five dependents, three of whom go to school. 

Monica sells food, such as cassava, beans and fruits, and fish.She has been in business for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase food to sell. The loan is expanding her business because it allows her to purchases in large quantities and to stock even more inventory. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose future plan is to own an enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is fifty – two years old. He is married and the father of six children. Three of them are currently pursuing education at the junior and senior high school levels. The other three have graduated and now independent. John is the major bread winner of his family. He has very good knowledge in herbal medicines and so he prepares and sells to his customers herbs and mixtures of herbs that treat various ailments like stroke, jaundice, malaria, typhoid etc. John has a license from the food and drug board to operate.  His service to his community is well known since he has treated a number of sicknesses for many people. John is requesting for a loan to enable him inject additional working capital into his business to scale up to serve more people. He is expecting to increase his profits also to support his children in school.

loans.use: To buy herbal ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Hilda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
El banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús lo conforma un grupo de mujeres muy alegres, luchadoras y carismáticas que buscan en el día a día la superación personal, familiar y en sus  trabajos siempre con optimismo  y visión de un mejor presente y futuro para todo los miembros de sus  familias, éste banco se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador ubicada en el centro sur del país que goza de clima frío permitiendo a su población dedicarse al cultivo de diferentes frutas y legumbres  para abastecer tanto el mercado local como para el resto del país.  

Hilda R. vive en la urbe cuencana en la ciudadela Los Eucaliptos con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 15, 13 y 6 años, su cónyuge es empleado de EMAC (Empresa municipal de Agua Potable y Alcantarillado),  aun no tienen casa propia y viven en la de un familiar.

Hilda tiene dos profesiones  Auxiliar  Contable y   Enfermera particular,  debido a la poca demanda de estas actividades, hace un año  inició su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de artesanías en su taller ubicado en su domicilio compartiendo con las actividades del hogar y dedicando más tiempo a sus hijos.

Se encuentra en su sexto ciclo y fue una socia del  banco quien la incentivo a participar de éste equipo de mujeres visionarias para que acceda a  todos los beneficios que la Fundación entrega a sus socias, el dinero del préstamo lo va utilizar en la compra de un horno para preparar la masa de sus artesanías,  su meta de llegar a tener sucursales de su negocio  y dar empleo a más mujeres de su sector.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Divino Niño Jesús” (Divine Christ Child) is a group of cheerful, determined, and charismatic women who are looking to improve themselves, their families, and their businesses. They are always optimistic and envision making both the present and future better for every member of their families. This Communal Bank meets in the city of Cuenca, which is the third largest city in Ecuador and located in the southern part of the country that encounters cold weather. The residents grow different fruits and vegetables to supply the local markets as well as the rest of the country.

Hilda R. lives in the area of Cuenca called Los Eucaliptos with her husband and three children (ages 15, 13, and 6). Her husband is employed by EMAC (“Empresa Municipal de Agua Potable y Alcantarillado”, which is the local water utility). They do not own a home and currently live with a relative.

Hilda works two jobs, as an assistant bookkeeper and as a nurse. Since there is less demand for her services, she started her own business a year ago making and selling crafts. Her shop is located at home, which enables her to perform her household duties and spend more time with her children.

Hilda is participating in her sixth loan cycle. She was invited to participate in this team of visionary women so that she could partake in all of the benefits the Foundation provides to its members. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a kiln for preparing the clay used in her handicrafts. Her goal is to branch out her business and create jobs for more women.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a kiln

loans.name: Vhin Flores Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA VHIN FLORES, EN HONOR A UN MAESTRO DE ESA LOCALIDAD, ERA UN LUCHADOR SOCIAL QUE LOGRO UN IMPORTANTE  DESARROLLO DENTRO DE LA COMUNIDAD, ENTRE SUS CONTRIBUCIONES DESTACAN LA CONSTRUCCION DE UNA SECUNDARIA Y LA ESCUELA NORMAL DE AMILCINGO 

ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE AMILCINGO, TEMOAC  EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS EN MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES Y ES LA CUARTA  VEZ QUE SOLICITAN UN CREDITO A CREDICOMUN.

PETRA N. C. ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO. TIENE 42 AÑOS Y ESTUDIO HASTA LA SECUNDARIA, TIENE 2 HIJOS (1 MUJER DE 9 AÑOS Y UN  VARON DE 14 AÑOS). ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE DULCES TRADICIONALES DESDE LOS 17 AÑOS, LLEVA 25 AÑOS EN ESTE OFICIO, YA QUE ES UNA TRADICION FAMILIAR.  

SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA  QUE UTILIZA, COMO SON EL CACAHUATE, TAMARINDO, CAMOTE Y AMARANTO ESTE ULTIMO UTILIZADO YA EN LOS ALIMENTO PARA ASTRONAUTA POR SUS PROPIEDADES NUTRITIVAS.  SU SUEÑO ES COMPRAR UNA VENTANA Y UN PORTON DE FIERRO  PARA SU CASA CON LA GANACIA QUE OBTENGA DE LA VENTA DE SUS DULCES  YA QUE POR EL MOMENTO NO CUENTA CON UNO.

EL NOMBRE DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPOS SON:

ANGELINA ALBERTA O. E., VENDE ZAPATOS
MARICELA  HARNANDEZ N.; ELABORA ARTESANIAS
EDUARDO QUEBEDO G.; VENDE TORTILLAS
YAZMIN R. O., VENDE ROPA Y TELAS
VIVIANA  E. S., VENDE ZAPATOS
FLORIBERTA LUCILA S. S., VENDE DULCES TRADICIONALES
ALFONSA ROSA S. E., VENDE DULCES TRADICIONALES
ELBA LETICIA S. E., VENDE DULCES TRADICIONALES
MONICA YUDITH C.  V., VENDE DULCES TRADICIONALES
texts.en:
This group is called Vhin Flores, in honor of a local teacher who was a social activist that achieved significant development within the community. Among his notable contributions are a middle school, and the Escuela Normal de Amilcingo [Amilcingo School of Pedagogy], located in Amilcingo, Temoac in the State of Morelos, Mexico. The group has 10 members and this is the fourth loan they have requested with CrediComun. Petra N. C. is the group's treasurer. She's forty-two, with a middle school education. She has two children (a girl, 9, and a boy, 14), and has earned her living making traditional sweets since she was seventeen. She's been in business for twenty-five years, and now it's a family tradition. She is requesting a loan so she can buy the ingredients she needs, such as peanuts, tamarind, candied sweet potato, and amaranth, which is still used in food for astronauts because of its nutritive properties. Her dream is to use the profits from her candy business to buy a window for her house, as well as an iron gate since she doesn't have one yet. The other group members are: Angelina Alberta O. E., Sells shoes Maricela Harnandez N., Makes handicrafts Eduardo Quebedo G., Sells tortillas Yazmin R. O., Sells clothing and fabrics Viviana E. S., Sells shoes Floriberta Lucila Sanches S., Sells traditional sweets Alfonsa Rosa S. E., Sells traditional sweets Elba Leticia Sanches E., Sells traditional sweets Monica Yudith C. V., Sells traditional sweets

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients including peanuts, tamarind, candied sweet potato, and amaranth.

loans.name: Cesar Silverio

texts.es: El. Sr. Cesar tiene 43 años de edad, es separado tiene 2 menores hijos aquien le pasa una pension de alimentos, cuenta con casa propia de material noble. El se dedica  a la venta de ropa  como recorredor  por los caserios. El tiene  un triciclo y recientemente a adquirido una moto car, con financiamiento de la Caja Municipal. Tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es poder tener su negocio mas grande.Con el dinero que solicta invertira en capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Cesar is 43 years old. He is separated and has two young children, to whom he provides an allowance for food. He has his own house, constructed of good-quality materials. He sells clothing as a traveling salesman in the small villages. He has a motor-tricycle and recently acquired a car, with financing from Caja Municipal. He has many dreams. One of them is to have a bigger business. With the money that he is seeking, he will invest in working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in working capital

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es: Zulema tiene 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos y de sus 2 hermanos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa (tubérculo peruano) y arveja, en donde cada día se despierta por la madrugada, y con ayuda de sus hermanos, vigilan los cultivos que tienen de las constantes amenazas como los cambios climáticos y plagas de insectos que afectan su producción. Afirma que le gusta mucho esta labor porque puede desarrollarla con mucha tranquilidad, aunque es algo sacrificada, sin embargo la recompensa llega cuando recoge toda la producción y logra venderlo a los mayoristas de su ciudad, pagándole regulares precios por todo lo cosechado. En el futuro desea sembrar nueva variedad de papa, de esa manera aumentaría sus rentas. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y espera alcanzar con lo que se ha propuesto. Además está contenta de saber que continuará trabajando en su agricultura. Además le agrada estar con su grupo comunal por ser todos muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Zulema tiene pensado invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de fertilizantes y abono para asegurar una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Zulema is 20 years old and lives at home with her parents and two siblings. She has been farming for three years, growing potatoes (Peruvian tubers) and peas.

Zulema wakes up every day at dawn. With the help of her siblings, she monitors the crops for constant threats such as weather changes or infestation of pests that can affect her production. She says she enjoys this work very much because it allows her to grow in a peaceful environment. Even though the work requires sacrifice, there is great reward when it is time to harvest her entire crop and sell it to wholesalers in the city who pay regular prices for everything she produces. In the future, she wants to plant a new variety of potato so that she can increase her income.

This is her second loan with MFP. Zulema hopes to proceed with her plans. She is happy that to know that she will be able to continue working in agriculture. Zulema also enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because all the members are very responsible with their payments. She will invest the loan she requested in the purchase of fertilizers and compost to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & compost

loans.name: Ameth

texts.fr: Monsieur Ameth D. est un professeur de collège au niveau des établissements de Mbour .En plus de ses heures de cours Mr D. s'occupe d'un poulailler où il élève des sujets au bout de 45 jours pour être revendu dans le marché . Vu l'état de son salaire et la chére té de la vie ,il sollicite ce crédit pour combler son déficit budgétaire
texts.en:
Mr. Ameth D. is a middle school teacher with Mbour schools. In addition to teaching his classes, Mr. D. operates a chicken coop, raising the chickens to be sold at market when they are 45 old. Considering the level of his salary and the high cost of living, he is requesting this loan to make up for his budget deficits.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of poultry

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
C., 25 years old, is a married mother who has been blessed with a small kid who is not yet enrolled in school. 

She rents a store in the busy local market where she sells used clothes to people who come to buy anything in the market. She generates a daily income of about $3.50 each day to manage her family's expenses, especially to support her child’s food needs. She has an assistant in her husband who helps her in selling clothes. 

C. will be using her first loan as capital for her used clothing business. She intends to use any remaining cash from the loan to invest in a fish-sale trade.

loans.use: To use as capital for her used clothing business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward N. is from the village of Natugod, Medina, Misamis Oriental. He is 35 years old and is married. Edward owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling charcoal and firewood in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Edward joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP of which part will be used to purchase coconut shells that will be processed into charcoal, and part will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Edward plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase coconut shells that will be processed into charcoal, and as additional working capital

loans.name: Rumbo Al Exito Group

texts.es:
Lisette tiene su restaurante tiene por nombre "VALERY" el nombre lo escogió por su hija, ella  tiene 04 hijos que son su mayor incentivo para seguir trabajando, cuando ella era soltera trabajaba como anfitriona y tenia carisma para las ventas, ya casada fue su esposo quien se animo a poner su propio restaurante aprovechando que le estaban ofreciendo un traspaso con todo los utensilios necesarios  fue así que se iniciaron vendiendo almuerzos y menú que ofrecían al publico teniendo mucha acogida, en el futuro quieren ampliar su local usando todo el primer piso para dicho fin.
Lamentablemente este año tuvieron inconvenientes por que uno de sus hijos enfermo y esta en tratamiento pero sabe que su situación mejorara, con el dinero de su préstamo podrá comprar insumos para reflotar su restaurante y mejorarlo, Lisette es la tesorera del grupo “RUMBO AL ÉXITO”  ya pertenece al grupo cerca de un año.

* La Sra Lissette aparece en la foto cargando su bebe es la quinta de las señoras paradas.
texts.en:
Lisette has a restaurant called "Vallery" on her daughter's honor, she has 4 kids who are her biggest incentive, when she was single she used to work as a hostess and was very good at sales, once she got married her husband decided to open a restaurant as there was an offer of a place with all the equipment. That is how they started selling lunch and their menu had very good acceptance, in the future they want to improve their place using all the space on the first floor. Unfortunately they had troubles this year as one of their kids got sick and is undergoing medical treatment, and his condition is improving, with the loan they will be able to buy food supplies for the restaurant and improve it, Lisette is the treasurer of the group called "Road to Success" and belongs to the group for the last past year. * Mrs. Lisette appears on the picture carrying her baby, is the fifth of the ladies who are standing.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials for his home

loans.name: Fabiola Lidubina

texts.en:
Fabiola Lidubina T. T., 46 years old, is married and lives with her husband and 3 children, 12, 17 and 21, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Fabiola is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. The 14 group members are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Fabiola cultivates blackberries, potatoes, corn, beans, peas and vegetables, only for family consumption. She purchases and sells her products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where she lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year.

Fabiola is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers and sprays to fight crop diseases. She also wants to diversify and start a business of purchasing and selling pigs. She thinks the credit will help her purchase what she needs to grow her products: seeds, fertilizers, and also to diversify, since she is losing her crops with diseases. She faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas,” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest. She fears she may lose most of her harvest.

Fabiola's dream is to move forward and enable her children to study (send them to University). She likes to knit and watch television in her spare time.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and sprays to fight crop disease.

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiru

texts.en:
Eunice has been involved in tailoring and dressmaking for five years now.  She is 26 years old, married to Joseph Maina, and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy more fabric from which she will make more dresses to sell and meet the demands of her customers.

Eunice hopes to continue in dressmaking and become a big market player in both tailoring and dressmaking in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for sewing

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Rita N. who is married and has two children aged 14 and 2. In 1995, Rita established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. Rita has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW. She used this new loan to purchased raw materials for her tailoring business. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailors’ stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, Patan BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase their production and profitability. About Patan BPW: This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner in Nepal: micro-finance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. It operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower N. women within the home and community.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma T. is from the village of Dapacan Alto, Calamba. She is 48 years old, married and has 3 children, two adult-aged and one school-aged. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the construction sector selling lumber. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Norma is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital for the business

loans.name: Maria Izilda

texts.pt:
Maria izilda José M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 1 filho que freqüenta a Escola. Fez 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta sua mãe e irmã que vivem com ela. 

Nunca saiu de Maputo, é comerciante ha mais de 4 anos cria frangos de abate para vender. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 25.000.00 a 30.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Já teve empréstimo na PROCREDIT e pagou sem problemas. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhas e colegas de mesma actividade, este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 30.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos e ração para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock..

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para terminar a sua casa que se encontra em construção.
texts.en:
Maria Izilda José M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is unmarried and has one child who is in school. Maria only studied through 7th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives with her family in their own house and supports her mother and sister who live with her.

Maria still lives in Maputo, where she has worked raising chickens to sell for food for more than 4 years. She has no employees and makes a profit of around 25,000 to 30,000 Meticais per month, which she uses to cover household expenses. She also saves some in her bank account.

Maria has taken out loans in the past with PROCREDIT and repaid them as promised. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through neighbors and colleagues who also work raising chickens. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 30,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy baby chicks and feed in order to increase her stock of animals. 

She is confident that she will repay the loan as indicated. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish work on her house.

loans.use: Purchase of baby chicks and feed

loans.name: Irving

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Irving;  El socio tiene 22 años de edad;  el es conviviente y tiene 1 hijos; El socio  trabaja vendiendo animales menores, el ayuda  a su mama a la venta de aves de corral (patos bebes, pollitos), el los vende en el mercado central, el socio solicita el préstamo para hacer de este  un pequeño capital y aumentar en el negocio de su mama y generar su propio negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar aves de corral y venderlos.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is part of the Señor de Tantamarca communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Chicón, which is in the province of Urubamba and in the department of Cusco.

Irving is 22 years old and has a live-in partner and one child. He works helping his mother to sell young fowl (baby ducks and chickens) in the central market. He is requesting the loan to have capital and to expand his mother’s business and have his own. Specifically, he will use the loan to purchase fowl and sell them.

He appreciates and values the loan provided and he promises to make his loan payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: To buy more fowl and sell them.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. LOS TEMBLORES II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Mercedes; ella tiene 49 años D. edad y es madre solera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. restaurant y por medio D. este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el restaurant y mejorar.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 49, is a member of the “SEÑOR D. LOS TEMBLORES II” (Lord of the Earthquakes II) communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is a single mother of two children.  She alternates her daily activities with a restaurant through which she is able to support her children.  She wants to expand the business and is asking for a loan to equip and improve the restaurant.

She thanks all those who will share her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To equip and improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika, de 35 años, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y juntos viven en casa de su madre. Durante la semana trabaja como en una fábrica de textiles colocando etiquetas a las prendas, pero los fines de semana se dedica a vender tamales, es así que cada viernes luego de la jornada laboral, lo que resta del día hasta altas horas de la noche prepara el maíz y los convierte en ricos tamales. Desde hace 6 años realiza la misma rutina, siendo éste paltillo vendido en el puesto de venta de comida de su madre. Esta muy contenta por su negocio, por lo que puede captar buenas utilidades para el bienestar de sus hijos, quienes son su mayor adoración. Más adelante  anhela instalar un restaurante en sociedad con su mamá. Es su 16avo crédito con MFP, sabe que éste aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, es para comprar utensilios de cocina.
texts.en:
Erika, age 35, is a single mother.  She has four children, and they live together in her mother’s house.  During the week she works in a textile factory placing labels on clothes.  On the week-ends she sells tamales.  

Every Friday she spends the time after work until very late at night preparing the corn and then making the delicious tamales.  She has been following this same routine for six years.  This is the dish that is sold at her mother’s food stand.

She is very happy with her business because she is able to get good income for her children’s well-being.  Her children are her greatest love.

This is her 16th loan with MFP.  She knows that this help with be of great benefit in the development of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy cooking utensils.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils

loans.name: María Verónica

texts.es:
Maria de 37 años, ella da sus servicios como empleada domestica. Vive con en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares ya que tiene dos hijas ella comenzó a trabajar como empleada domestica en distintas casa. Ya tiene tiempo trabajando como empleada en distintas casas por eso ahora ha optado que con un pequeño capital que tenia comprar perfumes y ropa para seguir dándole a sus hijas una mejor vida ya que ellas estudian en una escuela fiscal.  Para mejorar su casa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques, empaste. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijas terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
María, aged 37, offers her services as a housekeeper. She lives in Primavera de Duran, a peri-urban marginalized area of Guayaquil with ecology on the brink of collapsing.

To help her husband with household expenses (they have two daughters), she began to work as a housekeeper in several households. She still has some time left over after her housekeeping assignments, which is why she decided to buy some perfume and clothes with a little capital, enabling a better life to her daughters who study at the public school. María wants to use her loan to buy cement, stone blocks and filling to improve her home.

In the future she wants to finish building her house and that her daughters complete their studies successfully.

loans.use: To buy cement and stone blocks

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She operates a furniture shop, selling tables and beds. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing timber to use in her furniture shop. She hopes to open a cafe and expand her workshop in the future.

With the loan of 30,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase timber, paint and nails. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase timber, paint and nails.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a baker for over ten years. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. With his loan of US $1200, he will develop his business and increase his productivity by upgrading his equipment. In the long term, he is planning to continue expanding his business and he is positive about the coming year. His bakery is an important source of income for his family. Lebanon has many pastry shop and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood. In the future, he is planning to develop his operation by opening a restaurant on the same lot where his bakery is located.

loans.use: To upgrade his equipment

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar:
حسن في عمر 21 سنة غير متزوج ويعمل في مجال الاليات الزراعية له في عمله حوالي 8 سنوات يحب عمله
ويسعى دائما الى زيادة مدخوله وتحسين وضعه وتأمين مستقبل جيد يحب ان يكون عائلة وان يكون مرتاح ماديا
من خلال تحسين عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء ماكنة لضخ المياه ما ينقص حسن هو زيادة المدخول
لزيادة العمل زبائنه كثر هم من محيطه وجيرانه ولكن له خبرة واسعة في هذا المجال طموح وجدي في عمله ويتميز بالدقة 
والجدية
texts.en: Hassan, 21, is single. He has been working in agricultural machinery for 8 years. He likes his work and always seeks to increase his income, improve his living standard, and secure a bright future. Hassan wishes to make a family and to be financially successful by promoting his business. He wishes to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a water pump. Hassan lacks funds that would help him expand his business and increase his clients. Most of his clients are from his neighbourhood and the circle of people who know him. Hassan is ambitious, with wide experience in his work. He also takes his work seriously and is known for his meticulousness.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: investment capital-the purchase of a new computer

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Rose has a business selling food like matooke (bananas), which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself (as she has lost her father). In the future, she hopes to become a tailor in fashion design.
Rose is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by showing her how to use a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase more food for resale
